loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling chicken.  Angelita is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional meat and other food to sell through her food-vending business.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional meat and other food to sell.

loans.name: Kevin Alejandro

texts.es:
Kevin es un joven emprendedor y enérgico, a sus 18 años de edad ya posee su propio negocio, un puesto de venta de refrescante guarapo de caña que inició con unos ahorros que tenía de su anterior empleo, con el ánimo de generar ingresos por cuenta propia y motivado por un amigo comenzó a vender el producto a las afueras de su casa, que está ubicada en una zona privilegiada por la gran afluencia de personas que transitan por allí, pues es una vía principal del barrio donde reside; esto le ha permitido generar recursos para apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar.
Actualmente solicita su primer ciclo de crédito con el que desea comprar materia prima e insumos al por mayor (caña, vasos y pitillos desechables) y una alfombra plástica para poner el motor y las canecas plásticas, esto le permitirá mejorar la imagen del negocio y además tendrá suficientes insumos para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa notablemente en la temporada de fin de año, dando como resultado un mayor nivel de ingresos para la familia.
Kevin, con su espíritu emprendedor y su proyección hacia el futuro, desea seguir trabajando en la acreditación y fortalecimiento de su negocio, para que sea más rentable y le permita seguir apoyando a su familia con los gastos del hogar, además quiere brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Kevin is a young and energetic entrepreneur. At 18 years old he already had his own business, which was a stall selling refreshing sugar-cane juice and began with some savings that he had from a previous job. With the aim of generating a self-employed income, and motivated by a friend, he began to sell his product outside his home, which is located in a privileged area due to the large influx of people moving around. He lives on the main thoroughfare of his area and this has enabled him to generate income to support his family's household expenses.

He is now requesting his first loan cycle with which he wants to buy raw materials and wholesale stock (e.g. cane, cups, disposable straws) and a plastic cover on which to put the motor and plastic containers. This will enable him to improve the business image and, in addition, have sufficient supplies to meet demand, which increases significantly, at the end of the year, resulting in a higher level of income for the family.

Kevin, with his entrepreneurial spirit, and his future focus, wants to continue working on the credentials and strengthening of his business, in order that it may become more profitable, allowing him to continue to support his family with household expenses, as well as providing a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and wholesale stock (e.g. cane, cups, disposable straws) and a plastic cover on which to put the motor and plastic containers.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Don Santos es originario de la ciudad de Estelí, casado. Tiene 36 años de edad. De oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su negocio con fondos propios y con la ayuda de su esposa ha ido creciendo poco a poco. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Gaseosas, Carnes, Pollo, Lácteos, Arroz, Recargas celulares etc. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para ampliar la capacidad de oferta de sus productos y podrá incrementar su clientela. Su plan futuro es que el negocio crezca y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Santos is a native of the city of Estelí. He is thirty-six years old and married. As a retailer, he runs a local convenience store. He opened his business with his own capital, and with the help of his wife, it has been steadily growing. He is applying for this loan to buy soft drinks, meat, chicken, dairy products, rice, and cell phone refill cards. He expects that this loan will greatly help him to increase his product variety and customer base. His future plan is to grow his business and increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, meat, chicken, dairy products, rice, and cell phone refill cards.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Basilisa has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income from buying and selling firewood.

Basilisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 23 years old and married with one child. Marlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods like canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft-drinks, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft-drinks, detergent soap, etc. 

Marlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft-drinks, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 9 years.

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell like eggs, milk, coffee, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to sell like eggs, milk, coffee, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 29 years old and is married with two children, one of whom is in school. Glenda works very hard to provide for them.

Glenda runs a business buying and and selling charcoal in the Philippines.  She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Glenda has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Glenda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 48 years old and is married with 4 children. One of her children is in school.

Tessie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Tessie requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Tessie has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Ramón Enrique

texts.es:
Ramón es un ejemplo de superación personal para los habitantes del barrio donde reside, tiene una limitación física en sus miembros inferiores, además vive solo pues la vida le dio un duro golpe luego del fallecimiento de su madre quien lo cuidaba y velaba por su bienestar. Con empuje y su espíritu de superación, decidió iniciar su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en su vivienda, allí atiende todos los días de 8:00 am a 8:00 pm, ofrece diversos productos de la canasta familiar y, aunque tiene limitaciones para moverse dentro del negocio, esto no le impide prestar un buen servicio a sus clientes, pues finalmente sus clientes lo conocen y comprenden su situación; así, ha logrado generar recursos para su sustento propio durante los últimos 8 años que lleva funcionando el establecimiento.
Solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (granos, galletería, chocolate, café, entre otros), esto le dará la posibilidad de ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y mejorar las ventas en esta temporada de fin de año.
Ramón, a pesar de los desafíos que enfrenta diariamente, se caracteriza por ser un hombre alegre y pujante, por ello desea seguir luchando para poder cumplir el sueño de ampliar el negocio para que sea más rentable y además desea adecuar el espacio para facilitar su movilidad dentro del establecimiento; logrando una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para si mismo.
texts.en:
Ramón is an example of personal self-development for the inhabitants of the neighborhood where he lives. He has a physical disability in his lower limbs. He has lived alone since life dealt him a hard blow with the death of his mother who had taken care of him and looked after his well being. With drive and a spirit of self-improvement he decided to start his own business, a grocery store located at his home. There he waits on customers every day from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. He provides a variety of basic supplies for the household. Although he has mobility limitations within his business, this does not stop him from providing good service to his clients. Finally, his customers know him and understand his situation. Therefore he has been successful in generating the resources to support himself for the past eight years he has run his store.

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock wholesale (grains, cookies, chocolate and coffee among other items). This will give him the possibility of offering a greater inventory to his customers and improve his sales during this end of year season.

Ramón, despite the challenges that he confronts daily, is characterized as being a happy and vigorous man. Consequently, he wants to continue struggling to fulfill his dream of expanding his business so that it is more profitable and in addition he wants to upgrade the space so that he can move more easily throughout the establishment, thereby improving his quality of life and sense of well-being.

loans.use: to purchase supplies wholesale (grains, cookies, chocolate and coffee, among other items).

loans.name: Yennifer Natalia

texts.es:
Yennifer es una joven emprendedora de 21 años de edad, que realizó cursos de belleza, químicos, corte y cepillado, manicure y pedicure, luego de graduarse decidió emprender su propio negocio y comenzó a prestar sus servicios de estilista a domicilio, así ha logrado generar los recursos con los que aporta al sostenimiento de su familia; pero, con el ánimo de generar un ingreso adicional, desea incursionar en el área comercial, vendiendo helados en la comodidad de su hogar, por ello solicita el crédito, con el que desea comprar un congelador para almacenar los helados, así mejorará los ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia. 
Yennifer, se proyecta en un futuro cercano, teniendo su propio salón de belleza, que le genere una buena rentabilidad para poder adquirir su casa propia y a largo plazo poder conformar una familia a la que pueda brindar un bienestar y calidad de vida adecuados.
texts.en:
Yennifer es una joven emprendedora de 21 años de edad, que realizó cursos de belleza, químicos, corte y cepillado, manicure y pedicure, luego de graduarse decidió emprender su propio negocio y comenzó a prestar sus servicios de estilista a domicilio, así ha logrado generar los recursos con los que aporta al sostenimiento de su familia; pero, con el ánimo de generar un ingreso adicional, desea incursionar en el área comercial, vendiendo helados en la comodidad de su hogar, por ello solicita el crédito, con el que desea comprar un congelador para almacenar los helados, así mejorará los ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia. 
Yennifer, se proyecta en un futuro cercano, teniendo su propio salón de belleza, que le genere una buena rentabilidad para poder adquirir su casa propia y a largo plazo poder conformar una familia a la que pueda brindar un bienestar y calidad de vida adecuados.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to store ice cream.

loans.name: Julicia

texts.es: Julicia, de 28 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija 09 años con quien vive en su casa propia. Julicia tiene su actividad laboral orientada al área de la diversión y el esparcimiento. Tiene una discoteca que ha construido en su casa y en el que recibe a su público todos los fines de semana para que pasen un buen momento de relajo. Su ganancia se basa principalmente en el consumo que sus clientes realizan dentro del local, para ello ofrece a la venta diversos tipos de bebidas alcohólicas, gaseosas y ciertos bocaditos para hacer mas amena su estancia en el lugar, Complementa su trabajo brindando una agradable atención, buena música y un ambiente confortable. Lleva con este negocio más de 10 años con la ayuda de su esposo. Adicionalmente tiene otra fuente de ingreso que es el alquiler de cuartos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene muy buenas ganacias y eso le da la tranquilidad que necesita para brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia, por ese motivo ella sigue esforzándose  para seguir adelante y mejorar la calidad de los servicios que brinda. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.2000, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito, para continuar con sus objetivos. El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá totalmente en la compra de bebidas para tener su local abastecido con estos productos.
texts.en:
Julicia is 28 years old, she is married, and she has a 9 year old daughter that lives with her in her home.  Julicia works in the entertainment and recreation industry.  She owns a disco that is located inside her home and it is where people come every weekend to relax and have fun.

Her earnings are primarily from the drinks that people purchase in the disco.  She serves a variety of alcoholic drinks, soft drinks, and some small snacks to ensure that everyone's visit is comfortable and fun.  Her business gets a lot of compliments due to the great service, great music, and comfortable atmosphere.

She has owned this business for more than 10 years thanks to the help of her husband.  Additionally, she has another source of income - she also rents out rooms.  What she likes most about her business is that she makes great money and this has provided her with the tranquility she needs to provide everything that is necessary for her family.  This is her motivation to continue working hard to get by and to improve the quality of services that she provides her customers.

She is seeking a loan of 2000 soles.  She thanks everyone that is making this loan possible so that she can continue striving to reach her goals.  All of the money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of beverages so that her bar/disco is well stocked.

loans.use: to buy beverages in bulk.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 47 years old. She is married, with three children. She sells sugar and other various items in her boutique. 

With the loan, Alphonsine would like to buy more sugar, soap, and cooking oil to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Annoitte

texts.en: Annoitte is 33 years old. She is married with two children and has been in the business for the past thirteen years. With this loan, she would like to buy more peanuts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more peanuts for sale.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 45-years-old and married with five children.

Marivic works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell such as egg, spices, canned goods, chips, etc.

Marivic has borrowed and repaid three loans from Kiva partner NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Marivic aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell such as egg, spices, canned goods, chips, etc.

loans.name: Balvina Cecilia

texts.es:
Balvina  tiene 40 años de edad estado civil casado vive con el esposo  y con su hija de 5 años, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama ASOCIACIÓN MONTUBIOS VENTANILLA NORTE se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Ventanilla Norte, perteneciente al cantón ventanas, se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Balvina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace tres años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para la siembra de maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para mejorar la situación económica. Su sueño es  tener una casa propia.
Le gusta trabajar y dedicarse a la familia.
texts.en:
Balvina  tiene 40 años de edad estado civil casado vive con el esposo  y con su hija de 5 años, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama ASOCIACIÓN MONTUBIOS VENTANILLA NORTE se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Ventanilla Norte, perteneciente al cantón ventanas, se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Balvina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace tres años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para la siembra de maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para mejorar la situación económica. Su sueño es  tener una casa propia.
Le gusta trabajar y dedicarse a la familia.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Mariana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Mariana tiene 33 años de edad de estado civil Union Libre tiene tres hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Recinto Desvio De los Amarillo perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES se encuentra ubicada el  recinto Desvio de los Amarillos , perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Mariana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, una bomba para fumigar y evitar las plagas y enfermedades, ademas alimento para los animales balanceado. 

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es tener mas ingresos para dar mejor calidad de vida y  dar lo necesario a los hijos, le gusta trabajar y descarnsar cuando tiempo tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Mariana, 33, is married and has 3 children. She lives with her husband and kids in the area of Desvio de los Amarillo in Ventanas canton, Los Rios province. She is part of the lending group Pequenos Agricultores, located in the same place as where she lives. The members work in agriculture and livestock.

Mariana plants corn and raises animals like chickens and pigs. With the loan she will be able to buy inputs like fertilizers, compost, and a fumigation pump to avoid the pests and diseases. She will also buy balanced feed for the animals. She will make her purchases in the city of Ventanas. Her dream is to have more income to give her family a better quality of life and give her children what they need. She likes to work, and to rest when she has free time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, a fumigation pump to avoid pests and diseases, as well as balanced feed for the animals.

loans.name: Christin Katerine

texts.es:
Christin tiene 24 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con su esposo e hijo de 4 años, en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama ASOCIACIÓN MONTUBIOS VENTANILLA NORTE se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Ventanilla Norte, perteneciente al cantón ventanas, se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Christin se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquímica Karlita y las vende en el mercado de ventanas.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para mejorar la actividad agrícola y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para construir una casa.
Le gusta trabajar en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Christin is 24 years old and lives with her husband in a common-law marriage and her 4-year-old son in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.  Her communal bank, Asociación Montubios Ventanilla Norte, is located in the area of Ventanilla Norte which belongs to the Ventanas canton.  The people here work in agriculture and raising livestock.

Christin has worked in agriculture planting corn and rice for some years now.  She purchases her supplies in Ventanas from Agroquímica Karlita and sells her goods in the Ventanas market.  

She requested the loan to purchase manure, urea, and liquid fertilizers to plant corn and rice.  The loan has helped her to improve her agricultural activities and to invest.  

Her dream is to purchase land to build a house.  She likes working in agriculture.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Jairo León

texts.es:
Jairo es un hombre trabajador y pujante, siempre va buscando alternativas que le permitan sacar adelante su familia y en especial a su hijo de 11 años de edad.
Actualmente trabaja como empleado en una empresa y, de manera alterna montó su propio negocio de venta de comidas con el fin de complementar los ingresos para solventar los gastos básicos del hogar, pues con el salario que recibe no le alcanza. Allí ofrece alimentos fritos como empanadas, palos de queso, sánduches, pasteles y otros productos de panadería y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien le colabora mientras él cumple el horario laboral.
El préstamo que solicita será invertido en la compra de surtido al por mayor (productos de panadería, gaseosas, desechables, entre otros), esto le permitirá capitalizar su negocio y podrá ofrecer nuevos productos que satisfagan los gustos diversos de sus clientes y mejorando así sus ventas.
Jairo manifiesta que su propósito es fortalecer su negocio para que sea rentable y le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable que le permita independizarse por completo y le brinde la oportunidad de compartir una mejor calidad de vida con su esposa y su hijo.
texts.en:
Jairo is a hard-working and strong man. He is always looking for ways to help his family prosper, particularly for his eleven-year-old son.

Jairo currently works for a business but he also has his own business selling meals in order to complement his income and cover household costs. His income from his job does not allow him to do this. Jairo offers fried foods, such as pastries, cheese sticks, sandwiches, cakes and other bakery products at his business. He receives support from his wife who helps him while he is at his job.

This loan will be used to buy stock (bread products, fizzy drinks, disposable plates, cups and cutlery and more) in bulk. This will allow Jairo to make more money with his business and he will be able to offer more products to satisfy his customers' various tastes and increase his sales.

Jairo tells us that his aim is to strengthen his business in order for it to be profitable and to give him the financial stability that will allow him to work completely independently. He wants the opportunity to enjoy a better quality of life with his wife and son.

loans.use: to buy stock (breads, fizzy drinks, disposable plates, cups and cutlery and more) in bulk.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, de 39 años de edad, está casada con Esteban y tiene dos hijos de 14 y 08 años de edad, por los cuales se esfuerza en salir adelante,  tiene su casa propia la cual compró con el apoyo de su pareja.El trabajo de Lucia consiste en la venta de plátanos y bebidas a base de frutas, la cual está implementada en un espacio muy bien  acondicionado en su puesto ubicado en el mercado, el cual lo abrió ya hace  03  años  tiempo en el cual le valió para hacerse conocida en la zona, ésta  actividad lo realiza sola como siempre con mucho entusiasmo.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener un ingreso económico que le da la tranquilidad de poder brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos, es  rentable, y le gusta socializarse; sigue esforzándose  gracias a que su puesto es muy concurrido teniendo todas la ganas de ampliar su negocio y en un futuro abrir un restaurante ya que le gusta la cocina. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1500, está agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para salir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el préstamo comprará productos tales como  plátanos, frutas  para ampliar su negocio, buscando comprar en mayor volumen, para tener menores precios, más acogida y mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Lucia is 39 years old and married to Esteban. Lucia has two children, aged fourteen and eight years old. It is for them that she puts in the effort to get ahead. Lucia owns the house where she lives, having bought it with her husband's support. Lucia works selling bananas and fruits juices, a business which she runs at well-set-up stall at the market. She opened her stall three years ago, during which time she has become well-known in the local area. Lucia works alone and always enthusiastically. What she likes about her work is that it gives her income, which means she does not have to worry about giving her children the best things in life. Lucia's business is profitable. Lucia is continuing to put in effort at her work as her stall is very popular. She wants to expand her business by opening a restaurant in the future because she enjoys cooking. On this occasion Lucia is applying for a loan of 1500 Nuevo Soles. She is grateful for this financial support that she is receiving in order to get ahead. She promises to make her repayments on time. Lucia will use this loan to buy items such as bananas and fruits in order to expand her business. She will buy in bulk in order to offer lower prices, have more customers and earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy bananas and fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna Isabel habita en el caserío Los Limones ubicado a 5 km del municipio de El Sauce, es una señora de 39 años, madre de cuatro hijos tres de ellos a su cargo.
Doña Reyna fue criada en el campo entre medio de las vacas y cosechas de granos donde sus padres le enseñaron el trabajo de campo y a ganarse la vida donde les agradece porque hoy tiene su propia vivienda y cuenta con ganado el que le permite comercializar la leche y obtener ganancias para sobrevivir.
Es un trabajo muy duro pero se siente muy orgullosa de sus raíces porque gracias al esfuerzo de los campesinos es que un país vive de la producción de leche, granos, miel, los cuales muchas veces son exportados por su buena calidad.
Doña Reyna con el fin de aumentar su hato ganadero está solicitando un crédito para la compra de tres terneros los que piensa engordar, desarrollarlos para su posterior venta con lo que le queda ganancia.
Espera y confía en Dios que su solicitud sea aprobada por los inversionistas de Kiva para llevar a cabo su inversión y agradece por el apoyo incondicional que brindan a las personas de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel lives in the village of Los Limones, located 5 km from the town of El Sauce. She is 39 years old and a mother of four children. Reyna was raised in the field among the cows and the grain harvests where her parents taught her to work the farm and to earn a living. She is grateful to them because now she has her own home and has cattle whose milk she can sell to earn money to survive. It is a hard job but she is proud of her roots because thanks to the efforts of the farmers, the country lives on the good quality milk, grains and honey they produce and often export.

Reyna, with the goal of increasing her herd of cattle, is asking for a loan to buy three calves to fatten, develop them and later sell them for a profit. She hopes and trusts in God that her loan will be approved by the Kiva lenders so that she can compete her investment, and thanks them for the unconditional support that they give to people of scarce resources.

loans.use: to buy three calves.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella desea seguir participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda con el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar emprendiendo su negocio, ella continua con su actividad económica que es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, pan, gaseosas, cervezas y otras cosas, ella continua con la pequeña tienda en su domicilio donde expende sus productos a sus amigos y vecinos. 

Hilda en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo panetones, champanes, galletas, tortas, dulces, leche, chocolate, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar al por mayor pues le sale a mas barato.
texts.en:
Hilda wants to thank all of her investors for the loan and is very pleased with the support provided. She want continue participating in this project because it has helped her provide the capital for her business. She is also motivated to continue launching her business, selling staple foods such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, bread, sodas, beer, and more. She is still running her small store out of her home, selling her products to friends and neighbors.

Hilda will use this loan to take advantage of an opportunity to buy merchandise such as panettones, champagne, cookies, cakes, sweets, milk, and chocolate, as well as sacks of rice and sugar, which she will be able to obtain at the less expensive wholesale prices.

loans.use: buy sacks of rice and sugar at wholesale, where she can get a better deal

loans.name: Bertha Camila

texts.es:
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de refrigerios para los distintos clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia elabora hamburguesas, salchipapas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando en su negocio para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This responsible, hard-working member continues to focus on her business selling snacks to her various customers. Her snacks include hamburgers and salchipapas, a typical street food composed of sausage and french fries. She has quite a bit of experience in this business, and it provides her personal as well as economic satisfaction. She wants to keep working at this business so that she can continue to support her family. The member is requesting this loan so that she can purchase ingredients such as oil and rice, among other things. She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: purchase ingredients like oil and rice for her snack shop

loans.name: Jose Alfonso

texts.es:
El socio José continua dedicándose a brindar el servicio de transporte, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su trabajo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para su carro.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: José continues to focus on being a service provider of transportation. He has spent a fair bit of time in this business, and it's going well for him thanks to the drive that he brings to his job every day. He wants to continue working in this way so that he can continue to support his family.  José is requesting this loan so that he can buy spare parts for his vehicle. He is grateful for the support he has been granted and he is commited to paying back his loan on time.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his work vehicle

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 31-years-old and married with one child.

Analyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, chips, soft drinks, etc.

Analyn has borrowed and repaid seven loans from Kiva partner NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Analyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, chips, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase stock to sell such as spices, canned goods, chips, bread, etc. for her general store business.

Celia has been in this business for four years. Celia earns additional income from farming rice.

Celia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock to such as spices, canned goods, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Mariefa

texts.en:
Mariefa is 37-years-old, single and works hard to support her parents to increase the family income.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. Mariefa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase more stock of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grain business.

Mariefa has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 45 years old and married with two children.

Beverly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29500 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF)  to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, and noodles.

She has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. Beverly has been running the general store for 18 years. She also earns income from raising pigs.

Beverly aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, and noodles.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 41 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Carina is in the agricultural business and raises pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 15000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF)  to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for eight years and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Francisco Santo

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 47 años de edad de estado civil Union Libre tiene tres hijos vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Recinto Desvio De los Amarillo perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES se encuentra ubicada el  recinto Desvio de los Amarillos , perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Francisco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos,semillas y uria, ademas alimento para los animales balanceado de engorde y crecimiento. 

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es tener mas ingresos para que la calidad de vida mejore, le gusta festejar las fiestas del pratron con comidas tipicas
texts.en:
Francisco is 47 years old, and he lives with his common-law wife and their children.They live in the Desvio de los Amarillos precinct, part of the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos. He belongs to the "Small Farmers" communal bank, also located in the Desvio de los Amarillos precinct, which is focused on farm and livestock work.
Francisco himself focuses on growing corn and raising barnyard animals, such as chickens. With this loan, he will buy supplies such as fertilizers, manure, seeds, urea, and balanced feed for the animals so they will grow up fat and healthy. He will buy these supplies in the city of Ventanas. His goal is to increase his income and improve his quality of life. He enjoys celebrating the patron saint's holidays with typical foods.

loans.use: buy supplies for his crops and his chickens.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. Monica earns more income from vending root crops.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business. Monica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Yury Cecilia

texts.es:
Yury, a sus 24 años de edad, es casada y madre de un hijo de 4 años. Actualmente se dedica a atender su propia microempresa de fabricación de obleas y barquillos, oficio que aprendió de su hermana, quien también posee una pequeña empresa similar. Cuenta con el apoyo de dos empleados y trabaja diariamente de 8 am a 10 pm, la producción la distribuye en diferentes heladerías y a comerciantes de obleas, así genera los ingresos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. 
Su empuje, empeño y actitud de superación la motivan para buscar nuevas alternativas que le permitan seguir avanzando, por ello solicita el crédito con el que desea comprar máquinas para elaborar sus productos; esto le permitirá aumentar su capacidad instalada y podrá producir mayor volumen para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada navideña; dejando mejores ganancias.
Yury sueña con fortalecer y acreditar bien su negocio y, en un futuro desea ampliarlo para aumentar la producción, generar más oportunidades de trabajo y tener una marca propia que sea reconocida en el país, así mejorará no sólo su calidad de vida, sino que aportará para que otras personas puedan lograr sus sueños.
texts.en: Yury, at 24 years old, is married and a mother of a four year old son. She spends her time tending to her small business which produces wafer cookies and ice cream cones. She learned the trade from her sister who also has a similar small business. She has the help of two employees and works daily from 8am to 10pm. She distributes her products to various ice cream shops and wafer cookie salesmen. This is how she makes income to support her husband with their living expenses. Her drive, determination, and succeeding attitude motivate her to look for new ways that will allow her to keep moving forward. For this reason, she applied for a loan so she can buy machines to make her products. This will help to increase her current capacity so she can produce a greater volume of products and satisfy demand which increases during the Christmas season. This will make greater profits. Yury dreams of strengthening and establishing a good reputation for her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business by increasing production, creating more job opportunities, and having her own brand that is recognized throughout the country. With this, she will not only improve her quality of life, but also help other people realize their dreams.

loans.use: to buy machines to make wafer cookies and ice cream cones

loans.name: Familia La Lagunita Group

texts.es: "Familia La Lagunita" se encuentra ubicada en una comunidad muy hermosa, los habitantes de dicha comunidad son muy amables, además de que muchos de ellos aún hablan su lengua materna: el mazahua. Los integrantes del grupo platican que la mayoría de sus conversaciones son en esta lengua, muy pocas veces dialogan en español. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque donde vive Inocencia y donde se reúnen hay una pequeña laguna pero también porque los tres integrantes del grupo son familiares. Inocencia quien es la representante del grupo tiene 33 años de edad está casada con el señor Esteban quien trabaja como comerciante, juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos, dos de ellos asisten a la escuela. Inocencia se dedica a la venta de bolsas y lentes en las ferias desde hace 14 años y quiere invertir su dinero para comprar más artículos. “Inicié mi actividad porque una de mis tías me dio la idea de iniciar un con un negocio”. Inocencia solo termino la primaria y no tenia muchas opciones para encontrar un buen trabajo por eso mismo decidió con su negocio.  Ella y su esposo venden juntos en las ferias y mercados porque dicen que es cuando hay más ganancias. Esteban vende carteras y juguetes y también usará su crédito para comprar más juguetes. Inocencia no tiene ningún problema con su negocio “Me gusta mucho la actividad porque de alguna manera conozco más personas” La meta de Inocencia y su esposo es poder hacer crecer los negocios y llegar a construir un local donde puedan vender sus artículos. Inocencia estaría mas tranquila porque dice que andar en ferias y puestos es muy riesgoso, algunos días se lleva a sus niños a su negocio pero teme por su seguridad. Teresa es la otra integrante del grupo y solicita su crédito para invertir en verduras. Los tres miembros están muy contentos y agradecidos con VisionFund y KIVA por la oportunidad de recibir un crédito.
texts.en:
“Familia la Lagunita” [The Little Lake Family] is located in a very beautiful community, and the people who live there are very kind. Also, many of them still speak their maternal language—Mazahua.  The members of the group say that they hold most of their conversations in this language—they seldom speak Spanish. 

They have chosen their group name because there is a little lake where Inocencia lives, and they meet there. Also, the three members of the group are relatives. 

Inocencia, the representative of the group, is 33 years old and she is married to Señor Esteban, who works as a vendor.  Together they form a family, with four children, two of whom are attending school.

Inocencia has been selling handbags and eyewear at fairs for 14 years, and she wants to invest her money in the purchase of more items.  She says, “I began my work because one of my aunts gave me the idea of starting a business.”   Inocencia only completed primary school and she did not have many choices when it came to finding a good job, so she decided to start her business.  

She and her husband sell together at fairs and markets because they say that is when there are the most earnings.  Esteban sells wallets and toys, and he will use his loan to purchase more toys. 

Inocencia doesn’t have any problems with her business, saying “I like this occupation a lot because it’s a way to meet more people.”
 
The goal of Inocencia and her husband is to be able to grow their businesses and build a store where they can sell their items.  Inocencia will have more peace of mind, as she says that going to the fairs and kiosks is dangerous—some days she brings her children to her business but she fears for their safety.

Teresa is the other member of the group and she is seeking a loan in order to invest in vegetables.  

The three members are very happy and thankful for VisionFund and Kiva—and for the opportunity to receive a loan.

loans.use: to purchase eyewear and handbags.

loans.name: Medjielyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Medjielyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling shells.  Medjielyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy fishing materials like fishing net, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

Medjielyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Aida works hard to support her family.

Aida has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.  She is borrowing 26000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy an additional fishing net for her business.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Diana Alejandra

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer emprendedora y pujante; a sus 30 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos de 13 y 5 años y con su esposo, se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, idea que surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar; inició vendiendo minutos a celular en las afueras de una universidad, luego le ofrecieron la posibilidad de trabajar como empleada en un puesto de venta de jugos en el mismo sector y, poco tiempo después, con gran esfuerzo y mucha dedicación, logró ahorrar el dinero y comprar el puesto, que ahora se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, que poco a poco ha ido fortaleciendo con nuevos productos.
Actualmente solicita el crédito motivada por la necesidad de seguir fortaleciéndolo, para lo cual desea comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, frutas, dulces, entre otros) y realizar adecuaciones al puesto de trabajo (pintar el carrito); esto le permitirá dar una mejor imagen que atraerá nuevos clientes, para ofrecerles mayor variedad de productos y satisfacer los diversos gustos, mejorando así las ventas y los ingresos para su familia.
Diana sueña con tener su negocio en un local propio, que le permita generar mayor rentabilidad para ofrecer a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar, y seguir velando por la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Diana is a strong and enterprising woman who is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children aged 13 and 5 years old. She works as an independent businesswoman - an idea that grew out of the need to generate income to support her husband with the household finances. She started selling cellular minutes outside a university, later working as an employee in a stall selling juice in the same area. A little while later, with great effort and dedication, she managed to save the money and buy the place, which has now become her main source of income, gradually having become strengthened with new products.

She is currently requesting a loan in order to continue strengthening her business, to buy wholesale goods (pastries, fruits, sweets, etc.) and to make adjustments to the business stall (e.g. paint the cart). This will allow her to portray a better image that will attract new clients, to offer greater variety of products and meet various tastes, improving sales and the income for her family.

Diana dreams of having her own business in her own establishment, which will allow her to generate higher returns to provide her family with better quality of life and well-being and to continue to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy wholesale goods (pastries, fruits, sweets, etc.) and to make adjustments to the business stall (e.g. paint the cart)

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas is married and has a clothing kiosk where many people come to shop every day.

Domingas can improve her business with a $1000 loan.  She will buy additional supplies such as trousers, shorts, short-sleeved shirts, and long-sleeved shirts. She has been involved in this business since 2002. Domingas feels comfortable running her business because she earns money every day.

Running a business has made Domingas independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, short-sleeved shirts, and long-sleeved shirts.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF)  to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Elsa has been in this business for 22 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling ginger.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to buy a tricycle to be used for the delivery of her products.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Cerlita

texts.en:
Cerlita is 52 years old and married with four children.

Cerlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like coffee, sugar, milk, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc.

Cerlita has borrowed and paid 33 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Cerlita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like coffee, sugar, milk, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Julita earns more income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal vending business. Julita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She is also looking after her mother. She has been selling cooked food door to door for eight years, working six days a week. She also runs a small retail shop for essential commodities to earn additional income.

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to purchase food like green bananas, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes plus charcoal and cooking oil. Her challenges include thieves and having to walk from door to door in order to sell her food. Her dream is to be able to employ people to work in her restaurant and to stop moving around selling food.  She joined MCDT because her friends told her about the relatively low interest on loans. She stays in her husband`s house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more food, such as green bananas, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes, plus charcoal and cooking oil.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio owns a Sari-sari store in Talibon, Bohol. He sell items such as ice, sugar, seasonings, canned goods, chips and other snack foods. This business has been his family's source of income, earning him an average profit of 10,000 PHP per month. 

Bonifacio needs to make further investments in his store; however, he lacks the funds to do so. Bonifacio is requesting a loan to buy additional items to sell such as cooking oil, sugar, coffee, shampoo, body soap, canned goods and noodles. With the loan, Bonifacio will be able to augment his stocks to attract more customers, thereby giving him the chance to increase his sales.

He hopes to make his business grow and become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, coffee, shampoo, body soap, canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and two of them attend school. She is also looking after her nephew.

She has been selling clothes in a retail shop for four years, working six days a week. She does not have any additional sources of income. 

She has requested for a loan of Uganda Shs 400,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to buy more long skirts for sale. Her challenges include recovering money from clients who buy on credit and seasonality. Her dream is to expand her business to a bigger shop with several varieties of garments. She joined MCDT because she did not have to give collateral in order to access loans. She stays with her husband in a rented house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy  more long skirts for sale

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en: Claudio is a 46-year-old man from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is married with three children, ages 3-18. Farming rice has been his source of income for his family for fifteen years now. He wants to give his kids a better future. That is the very reason why he and his wife are working hard on his farming business and are requesting a loan to improve the yield. The loan will be used to buy fertilizer so he can have a better income from his crops. His profit will be used to finance his children’s schooling and to provide for future savings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo is a 45-year-old man from Talibon, Bohol. He is married with four children. His eldest is 20 and the youngest is 14. 

For 10 years now, Cirilo has been in the business of farming rice, operating a restaurant, and transporting passengers with his motorcycle. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, cooking oil, and meat. His income provides food for his family and for his children’s education.

Cirilo hopes that in the coming years he will be able to continually support his children’s schooling until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, cooking oil, and meat.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arlene is 38 years old and has two children who are in school. Arlene has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. Arlene has been in this business for five years. Arlene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell recyclable materials business in the Philippines. Conchita requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more recyclable materials to sell. Conchita has been in this business for the past 12 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more recyclable materials to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. Imelda is married and has business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.

Imelda requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her fruit and vegetable stand.

Imelda has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her fruit and vegetable stand

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
Santa Maria  es un grupo que está en su  ciclo 7 del programa de comité de Mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. También forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están esforzándose por mejorar sus vidas y superar su pobreza.
Zunilda es parte de este grupo, ella es una persona que con su esfuerzo y su empeño está saliendo adelante, y por medio de su modesta librería está luchando por mejorar y poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de libros, cuadernos, lápices y demás. También agradece por esta oportunidad que todas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Santa Maria group is in its 7th term with the Women's Committee program, where every woman is committed to working hard and helping each other to get ahead. They are part of a poverty elimination program, in which everyone strives to improve their lives and rise above poverty.

Zunilda is part of this group. Through her hard work and dedication, she is getting ahead, and with her modest bookstore, she is fighting to improve and aid her family. She is requesting this loan to invest in books, notebooks, pencils, and more. She is grateful for this opportunity that everyone is receiving.

loans.use: buy books, notebooks, and pencils for her bookstore.

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
Santo Domingo es un grupo casi nuevo, está en su segundo ciclo del programa de comités, ellas se unieron con el propósito de poder ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en equipo.
Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 9 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que deben seguir trabajando por mejorar. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Librada, quien vende prendas variadas, y por medio de ese esfuerzo diario lucha por poder sobresalir e ir mejorando su situación de pobreza. Se debe destacar también el trabajo de la asesora por medio de las capacitaciones.
Pide Librada de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, como ser camisas, remeras, pantalones y demás, para poder seguir con sus ventas, mejorar sus ingresos e invertir en su plan de negocios.
texts.en:
The Santo Domingo group is nearly new, in just its second term with the committee program, where all are united in the goal of helping each other by working as a team.

They are making a push to eliminate poverty in a group where nine members fall below the poverty line; that is to say that they must continue working to get ahead. One member is Librada, who sells a variety of clothing. Through her daily efforts, she is fighting to be able to get ahead and she keeps improving her situation in poverty. It is also necessary to point out the role of the advisor in the ongoing training.

Librada is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of clothing, such as shirts, tees, pants and more, which she will use to continue with her sales, increase her income, and invest in her business plan.

loans.use: buy shirts, tees, pants, and more for resale.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is 35 years old and married with three children.

Rodelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, coffee, etc.

Rodelyn has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Rodelyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials like net, hook, thread, etc., for her fishing business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 11 years. She earns more income from buy-and -sell ready-to-wear clothing.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials like net, hook, thread, etc.

loans.name: Lloni Fernando

texts.es:
Lloni es un hombre pujante y trabajador, con 28 años de edad, es casado y padre de un hijo de 1 año de nacido. Hace algún tiempo se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, pues produce y vende maní caramelizado en diferentes presentaciones, trabaja desde la comodidad de su casa y cuenta con el apoyo de su madre y su esposa; aprendió la actividad por medio de la observación con un amigo que también realizaba esta labor, todo lo que produce lo vende de manera ambulante o en diferentes tiendas de los barrios y sectores aledaños.
Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en el crecimiento de su negocio, pues requiere comprar un quemador, un sartén grande y materia prima al por mayor (maní, azúcar, pasas, entre otros); esto le permitirá aumentar su producción para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada de fin de año, en la que existe mayor afluencia de personas en todas las calles de la ciudad debido a los diferentes eventos navideños que se realizan, dándole la oportunidad de vender más productos y mejorar los ingresos.
Lloni manifiesta que su principal anhelo es continuar con la acreditación y el fortalecimiento de su negocio para darle permanencia en el tiempo y que le garantice una rentabilidad mayor para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Lloni is a strong and hardworking man of 28 years of age. He is married, and the father of a one year old child. For some time he has worked as an independent trader, producing and selling caramelised peanuts in different concerns, working from the comfort of his home and he counts on the help of his mother and his wife. He learnt the business by shadowing a friend who also worked in the same line of business. Everything that is produced is sold on the road in different shops in the surrounding neighbourhoods and regions.

He is currently requesting a loan in order to invest in the growth of his business. He needs to buy a burner, a large frying pan, and wholesale raw material goods (peanuts, sugar, raisins, etc.) These will allow him to increase production to meet the increased demand during the end-of-year season which sees a greater influx of people in the city streets due to the different Christmas events that take place. This gives him the opportunity to sell more products and improve his revenue.

Lloni notes that his main desire is to continue with the development and strengthening of his business, in order to give him a long-term business, ensuring higher returns, which will give his family a better quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: to buy a burner, a large frying pan, and wholesale raw material goods (peanuts, sugar, raisins, etc.)

loans.name: Tambi Emmanuel

texts.fr:
Mr TAMBI EMMANUEL est un étudiant en classe de Master II à l’ESTPO. Il est marié et père de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 18ans et le moins âgé a 11ans. Tous vont à l’école.
Il est à l’ESTPO depuis 05ans.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures à l’ESTPO.
Il ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. TAMBI EMMANUEL is a second-cycle Master’s student at ESTPO. He is a married father of three. The eldest is 18 and the youngest is 11. They all attend school. He has been at ESTPO for 5 years. Mr. TAMBI EMMANUEL wants to finance his higher education at ESTPO. He hopes to ensure his children’s tuition and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to finance his higher education at ESTPO.

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr:
Mr BOUBACAR est un étudiant en classe de Master II à l’ESTPO. Il est célibataire sans enfant.
Il est à l’ESTPO depuis 04ans.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures à l’ESTPO.
Il ambitionne être un ingénieur spécialisé en génie civil.
texts.en: Mr. BOUBACAR is a second-cycle Master’s student at ESTPO. He is single and has no children. He has been at ESTPO for 4 years. Mr. BOUBACAR wants to finance his higher education at ESTPO. He hopes to be an engineer specializing in civil engineering.

loans.use: to finance his higher education at ESTPO.

loans.name: Many

texts.en:
Many is 21-year-old and single living in a rural village of the Prosat Balang district, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been working in one company for two years. She is able to earn about US 3.66 per day from her job, yet she can save about US 1.66 each day after daily expenses. 

Many is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is asking for an education loan to pay for her university’s tuition fee, faulty of Accounting. She hopes that this loan will provide financial support for her so she can focus on her studying and obtain a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her university’s tuition fee

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Mong Russey district of Battambang province, Hun is aged 26 years and married. She has one child who is still in school. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and selling fish for five years. The current business earns her family about 45,700 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Hun has been with VisionFund for one cycle and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family to have sufficient food and her children’s education. Now she is applying for another loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to use a portion of it to spend on buying more fish to resale. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Bur's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Bur is a 40-year-old married mother of six children, three of whom are still in school. Rice farming, watermelons, and beans have been the main sources of income for her family for 20 years; and to better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband catches fish. Together, they can earn about 41,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and manage to save about 25,000KHR each day for future needs.

Bur’s group consists of five members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely repaid the loan. Past loans have helped Bur better support her family members. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Bur, who is the leader, wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor. With this loan, she hopes to grow her crop fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Saroem's Group

texts.en:
Saroem is 49 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She takes care of four dependent children. Rice farming and sesame growing are the primary sources of her family’s income. To make a living and to add more income, her husband also works for others for a fee. She has been in this business for ten years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 46,000KHR per day and save about 25,000KHR each day for the future needs.

This is the fifth microloan for Saroem with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Saroem will use her portion to pay for labor fees in harvesting a rice field and use part of it to buy seeds for sesame growing. She hopes to make a larger crop on her farmland.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees in harvesting a rice field

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro desde pequeño siempre ha tenido la meta de ser alguien importante, de tener un buen sustento para la familia ; por esa razón ha querido estudiar cocina ya que es una de las cosas que mas le gusta hacer en los tiempos libres, después de que salio del colegio sus padres no tenían un buen sustento económico para mandarlo a estudiar cocina en una universidad, así que encontró en campoalto un lugar de aprendizaje accesible  y no demasiado caro, aunque hay ocasiones que no tengo para pagar completo las mensualidades.
En la cocina ha aprendido demasiadas cosas que le van a servir en el momento que empiece a laboral en un ambiente de trabajo, aunque siempre digan que la cocina se voy a esclavizar porque hay demasiado trabajo en un día eso no le importa ya que cuando uno hace lo que realmente quiere se divierte y lo hace con esfuerzo y no se estresa tan fácilmente, y espera que  en unos años este trabajando en un buen restaurante haciendo lo que realmente le gusta que es cocinar y seguir su sueño de chiquito que es ser alguien importante.
texts.en:
Ever since he was little, Alejandro has wanted to be someone important, someone who could provide for his family. This is why he's wanted go to culinary school, since cooking is one of the things he enjoys doing the most in his spare time.  After high school, his parents couldn't afford to send him to culinary school, which is how he found CampoAlto, a place of accessible learning that wasn't too expensive - although there are still times that he can't entirely pay his tuition.

In studying cooking, he has learned so many things that will serve him well when he enters the work force. They say that you stay very busy in cooking because there is so much work to be done in a day, but it doesn't matter since when you do what you really love, it all seems fun and you don't get too stressed. Alejandro hopes to be working in a good restaurant in a few years, doing what he loves best: cooking and pursuing his boyhood dream of being someone important.

loans.use: attend culinary school and become a chef.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other family members.

She has been operating a restaurant in a market for three years, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of Uganda Shs 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to be able to stock dried beans and peas, maize flour, cooking oil, wheat flour and to replace leaking saucepans. Her challenges include transportation fares. Her dream is to accumulate profits that will enable her to purchase land and build a home. She joined MCDT because of their good customer care. She stays in a rented house with access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy dried beans, peas, maize flour, cooking oil, wheat flour and to replace leaking saucepans.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a 64-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. For seven years now, she and her husband have operated a fishing business to earn an income. Whatever her husband catches, she sells in the community for a profit. She is asking for 15000 PHP to buy fish nets, floaters and nylon that will help support their business. She knows that their tools need to be replaced for them to be more productive in their fishing.

Her income provides food for her and her husband as well as pays for household bills. In the future, she hopes to have savings and a better income from their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, floaters and nylon

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other family members.

She has been a hairdresser for ten years, working six days a week from her home. She also does outside catering as another source of income. 

She has requested a loan of Uganda Shs 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to stock more weaves and cosmetics. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to open a branch for hairdressing. She joined MCDT because she lacked enough capital to have a meaningful business. She and her husband stay in their house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To  buy weaves and cosmetics.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is a 50-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with three children, ages 9, 11 and 14. Beatriz's husband is a farmer and sometimes also works as a carpenter. For 12 years now, she has been farming rice to augment their income to provide for their children. Like most mothers, she wants her children to have a life quite different from hers. She realized that she could do better with her farming if given financial assistance. She requested a loan to be used to buy seedlings, pesticides, and fertilizer and pay for labor. The extra income that she can get from this will be used for her family’s daily consumption and her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, pesticides, and fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Kerema

texts.en:
Kerema is 46 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Kerema works very hard to provide for them.

Kerema runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Kerema has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, coffee, noodles, canned goods, vinegar, sugar, etc. 

Kerema would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ketut

texts.en:
Ketut is an artist from Bali who specializes in creating detailed hand-carved wood sculptures. Ketut is ill and would like to hire people to help in his workshop. Ketut has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story: "It was my older brother, Made, who taught me to carve sculptures. I saved until I had enough to start my own workshop, and now I'm able to offer employment to other carvers from my village. Balinese culture and tradition inspire my artwork. As the son of a master carver, it is easy and enjoyable for me to transfer my imagination into my work. Through my art I do hope to provide a good life and a better future for my family, especially for my child." "I am now sick and need additional artisans to help me create the sculptures. I have many unfinished statues but, because I am sick, only my wife is helping me and we are running out of stock. It is taking a long time to carve the sculptures, especially because, besides preparing and doing finishing on our designs, now my wife also has to take care of me. I am requesting a loan to help me hire people to do the finishing of my sculptures. Thanks so much to all of you who are supporting my family and me in this difficult time." Use the link below to view Ketut's hand-carved sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1724

loans.use: to hire people to help in his workshop

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 60 years old and married with three children. Marcelina works very hard to provide for them.

Marcelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell.

Marcelina has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, etc. 

Marcelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sheineh

texts.en:
Sheineh is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Sheineh is 27 years old and has three children who are in school.

Sheineh has a direct-selling Tupperware products business in the Philippines. Sheineh requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more Tupperware products to sell to her customers.

Sheineh has been in this business for 5 years. Sheineh would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more Tupperware products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

Melissa requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

Melissa has been in this business for two years now.

Melissa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Pastorita De Jesús

texts.es:
Pastorita ha sido ama de casa desde que se casó, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia pero, hace 7 años, la vida le dio un duro golpe tras la muerte de su esposo quedando sola a cargo de sus 4 hijos; desde entonces decidió trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía por catálogo pues era responsable de llevar la carga económica del hogar y necesitaba generar los recursos para hacerlo. Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja sola todos los días y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productiva como comerciante.
Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (perfumería, cremas corporales, cosméticos, accesorios, entre otros), esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de navidad, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.
Pastorita manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y dar educación a todos sus hijos, para verlos convertirse en profesionales, para que tengan un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Pastorita has been a housewife since she was married, always attentive to the care of her family, but seven years ago her life was hit hard as a result of the death of her husband, leaving her alone to look after her 4 children. Since then she decided to work as an independent trader.
