She started to sell catalogue merchandise because she had the burden of home expenses and needed to create an income in order to meet these costs. Her customers are neighbours, family and friends in her region. She works alone every day and her work provides her with the advantage of being able to look after her family, but at the same time she also manages to be productive as a trader.
She is currently requesting a loan to buy wholesale stock (perfumes, body creams, cosmetics, accessories, etc.) These will allow her to stock up with more variety of goods in order to meet the demand that increases during the Christmas season, resulting in better income for her family.
Pastorita notes that her greatest desire is to be able to continue financially supporting her family and to provide education for all of her children, allowing her to see them become professionals and to give them a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to buy wholesale stock (perfumes, body creams, cosmetics, accessories, etc.)

loans.name: Nogoye

texts.fr:
Madame Nogaye, mariée et mère de 3 enfants évolue dans le secteur du commerce il y a de cela 4 ans. Son commerce qui consiste à vendre des céréales comme du mil et de l’arachide ; mais aussi elle gère un petit restaurant. L’objectif du crédit est d’acheter le mil et l’arachide, de le stocker pendant que le prix est bas et de le hausser pendant la période où la denrée se fera rare. Elle dispose pour cela d’un magasin chez elle aménagé pour cela.
Madame est prise entièrement en charge par son époux, ses seules dépenses vont envers ses parents, dés qu’elle peut, elle les aide dans les charges de leur maison.
Ayant un terrain, Nogoye a comme vœu de construire sa propre maison et de la mettre en location pour maximiser son profit.
texts.en: Mrs. Nogaye, a married mother of three, has been evolving in the business sector for the last four years. Her business consists of selling grains like millet and peanuts, but she also manages a small restaurant. The objective of the loan is to buy millet and peanuts, store them when the price is low, and to raise it when it becomes a rare commodity. She is positioned for this with a store at her home equipped for this. Mrs. Nogaye is entirely taken care of by her husband. Her only expenses are those for taking care of her parents: as soon as she can, she helps them with their house expenses. Having some land, Nogaye has the wish to build her own house and to have it where she can maximize her earnings.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and millet to resell, as well as some food for her mini restaurant

loans.name: Omar

texts.fr:
Omar, âgé de 20 ans est un jeune qui évolue dans le secteur du commerce. Il a appris le métier avec son père, pour qui il vendait depuis 2004, ce dernier possédant une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires divers. En 2011, il a démarré sa propre activité, avec la vente de céréales : mil, arachide et aussi de foin. Il commence sa journée à 7h et la termine à 21h.
Omar vit avec ses parents mais aucune dépense ne lui est obligatoire. Seulement, il peut remettre un peu d’argent à sa mère. Sa seule charge est la location de sa cantine.
Étant jeune, Omar rêve d’avoir sa propre maison et d’appuyer ses parents pour la gestion de leurs besoins.
texts.en: Omar, 20, is a young man evolving in the business sector. He learned this trade with his father, for whom he has been selling since 2004, and the latter of which owns a shop where he sells diverse food products. In 2011, he launched his own business, selling grains: millet, peanuts and also hay. He starts his day at 7am and finishes at 9pm. Omar lives with his parents but has no obligatory expenses. He only has to repay a little of his money to his mother. His only responsibility is the location of his cafeteria. Being young, Omar dreams of having his own house and supporting his parents and managing their needs.

loans.use: to buy millet and peanuts to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Elizabeth tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera,  jefa de hogar , tiene 2 hijos, y vive con su madre una adulta mayor con problemas de salud y su hijo menor que es estudiante de arquitectura. Ella siempre ha apoyado a su hijo, ayudándole a pagar sus estudios que está por concluir;  Esto gracias a su actividad comercial, que inicio hace más de 20 años;  tiene una amplia trayectoria con Fundación Mujer, este es el octavo crédito que solicita y en los anteriores nos ha demostrado una excelente moral de pago.
Inicia su actividad  cuando su segundo hijo estaba pequeño y se le dificultó trabajar fuera de la casa como siempre lo había hecho, es entonces cuando un hermano le facilitó 350 mil colones, para iniciar sus primeras ventas de perfumes y bolsos que ella después se los reintegró.
En este momento su negocio requiere capital de trabajo para reforzar su inventario con más bolsos y perfumes. Los créditos anteriores le permitieron consolidar una cartera de clientes importante y ahora ella es reconocida en su comunidad por la calidad de sus productos y buen trato a los clientes. También es importante mencionar que Doña Elizabeth genera un empleo a su hermana quien le distribuye la mercadería y le cobra.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 61 years old, a single mother and head of her household. She has two children. She lives with her mother who is a senior with health problems. Her youngest son is a architecture student. She has always supported her son and helps him pay his tuition so he can finish his studies. She can do this thanks to her retail business which she started 20 years ago. 

She started her business when second son was young and it was difficult to work outside of of her home as she had always done previously. Then, her brother lent her 350,000 colones to make her first perfume and purse sales. Afterward, she repaid him. 

Now, her business needs funds to increase her inventory with more purses and perfumes. 

She has a good history with Fundación Mujer [Woman Foundation]. This is her eighth loan and with the previous loans she has demonstrated a excellent manner of payment. 

With the previous loans, she was able to develop a portfolio of customers. Also, it is important to mention that Elizabeth created a job for her sister who distributes the merchandise and is paid.

loans.use: to buy purses and fragrances for retail sale

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is married. She is 44 years old and lives in Camanga Dumalinao ZDS. She has a sari-sari store that sells goods and dry goods. She has run this business for five years. 

Eva requested a loan to buy goods and dry goods for her store. She has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Eva hopes to have a big Sari2x Store in her town.

loans.use: to buy goods and dry goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married with three children. She is 35 years old and lives in Camanga Dumalinao ZDS Philippines.

Emma raised a pig to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. She has requested a loan to buy new piglets.

Emma has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to have her own poultry.

loans.use: to buy new piglets.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is an artisan from Peru who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and natural gemstones. Luis has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story: "My childhood was spent appreciating natural beauty, like the Pacific Ocean with its colorful fish, blue waters, sand, rocks and sunsets. In the Andes, I came into contact with the culture of my ancestors, the Inca. Then I visited the Amazon rainforest. I began designing jewelry and then went on to craft everything I see in silver and precious stones. Some of my friends tell me I'm a dreamer. I tell them that the only way to create is first to dream." "Thank you so very much for encouraging me to try new designs - I feel proud of what I am achieving and it's all thanks to you. My family and my community feel the same way. And thanks for this microcredit, because it is helping my business grow with the new designs and finishes I have created." Use the link below to view Luis's handcrafted silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5549

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and natural gemstones

loans.name: Mareth

texts.en:
Mareth is 61 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling noodles for more than 10 years, earning approximately $10 per day. Two of her children are employed in a rice mill. They make an income of $9 daily. 

Due to lack of funds, Mareth is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and help her children earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house

loans.name: Maximino

texts.es:
El señor Maximino esta casado con la señora Bernarda, viven en un  barrio no muy lejano de la ciudad de Itá, tienen hijos aun en edad escolar.
Maximino se dedica a la compra y venta de todo tipos de muebles como ser roperos, placares, sillas, camas, cómodas, meza para planchar y otros, sus ventas las realiza al contado o a crédito, tiene clientes en las ciudades de Guarambaré, Nueva Italia, Villeta, Itaugua, Ypacarai y alrededores, tiene una clientela formada. Comenta que su esposa también trabaja y se esfuerza en su pequeña despensa que tiene en su casa.
Maximino pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de roperos, placares, camas y otros muebles para la venta, lo cual le ayudará a seguir luchando y mejorando en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Maximino is married to Bernarda, and they and their school-aged children live in a neighborhood not far from the city of Itá. Maximino is in the business of buying and selling all kinds of furniture, such as wardrobes, lockers, chairs, beds, couches, ironing tables and more. He makes sales in cash or on credit and has established customers from the cities of Guarambaré, Nueva Italia, Villeta, Itaugua, Ypacarai, and other nearby places. He said that his wife also works at her job running a small pantry out of their home.

Maximino is requesting this loan to invest in various furniture for later resale, which will help him continue to fight to improve his enterprise.

loans.use: buy wardrobes, lockers, bed, and other furniture for sale

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
Bacilia junto a un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales; ella se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las plantas industrializadoras de leche del departamento de La Paz. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar ya que cada una tiene ropa para cubrirse del frio, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

Ella vive en casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de San Juan de Circa, de La provincia Aroma del Departamento de La Paz a dos horas de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz; cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado criollas las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector.

El sueño de Bacilia es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos. Asi, el crédito que solicita ahora es para la compra una vaca lechera para incrementar su producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Bacilia along with a group of people from the same community decided to farm and raise animals; she raises dairy cattle to produce milk which she sells to one of the industrial milk plants in La Paz department. The first step she made was to not tether the cows nor keep them enclosed far from pasture where they like pasture now that each has a blankets to cover them from the cold, nor does she cut the horns so the calves have their naturally shaped horns, and they receive fresh and high quality food, thus keeping the cows in good health.

She lives in her own home located in the San Juan De Circa community in the Aroma province of La Paz department, two hours from La Paz city; she has various heads of cattle that required great care given the weather conditions of the area.

Bacilia's dream is to increase her heads of cattle and protect their good health. The loan she seeks now is to buy a milk cow to increase her milk production and improve her income and quality of life.

This is the first time she seeks a loan from IMPRO and the first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow in order o increase milk production and thus increase income.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es parte de un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad donde decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales.
Ella se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las plantas industrilizadoras de leche del departamento de La Paz. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar ya que cada una tiene ropa para cubrirse del frio, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

Juana vive en casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de San Juan de Circa, de La provincia Aroma del Departamento de La Paz a dos horas de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz; cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado criollas las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector

El sueño de Juana es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, para lo cual ahor solicita un crédito para la compra de una vaca lechera para incrementar su producción de leche, precautelando la buena salud de sus animales.Asi mejorará sus ingresos y calidad de vida.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Juana is part of a group of people from the same community that decided to work the land and have livestock.
She has dairy cows that produce milk, she sells the milk to the industrial plants that process milk in La Paz.  The first step she took was to free the cows so that they weren't away from the grass that they like to be at, they have clothing to stay warm, she doesn't cut their horns either, she wants them to give birth naturally so that the food they produce is fresh and of great quality, keeping her cows in good health.

Juana lives at her own house, located in the community of San Juan de Circa, in the province of Aroma, department of La Paz, two hours from the city of La Paz; she has several heads of cattle that need better care due to the weather conditions of the area.

Juana's dream is to have more heads of cattle, for which she now needs a loan to buy a dairy cow to increase her milk production, taking care of the good health of her animals.  This way she will improve her income and quality of life.

This is the first time that she requests a loan to IMPRO and the first time with KIVA.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase her milk production and improve her income.

loans.name: Veltran

texts.es:
Veltran es casado, tiene tres hijos , vive en casa propia la misma se encuentra ubicada en  Arajllanga  de la provincia Aroma, departamento de La Paz.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundaria. El se dedica junto con su esposa  a la produccion de queso y entrega leche a una de las plantas industrilizadoras de leche de La Paz diariamente. 
 El crédito lo requiere para compra de un par de vacas lecheras  para así poder tener mejores ingresos al producir más leche y quesos.
El sueño de Veltran,  es tener varias vacas lecheras  y tener  mejores ingresos.
Es la primera  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Veltran is married with three children. He lives in his own house in Arajllanga, which is located in the province of Aroma and the department of La Paz. He studied to the secondary school level. Along with his wife, he makes a living by producing cheese and delivering milk to an industrial milk plant in La Paz on a daily basis.

He needs this loan to buy a few milk cows to have a better income by producing more milk and cheese. Veltran's dream is to have many cows and to have a better income. This is the first time he is applying for a loan with Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a few dairy cows to increase his production of milk and cheese.

loans.name: Sawe Mutiara Indah Group

texts.en:
Ayu Ketut and the members of Sawe Mutiara Indah Group received their new loan. The loan use continues to be for purchasing piglets and feed and for renovating their barns. Ayu Ketut will use her loan to purchase 2 superior piglets for fattening. Ayu Ketut and her husband are hard workers. Every day they spend their time in their garden (maintaining crops), at their kiosk, and on their pigs.

The Sawe Mutiara Indah members hope MUK will continue to support them with loans until they have enough savings to provide their own capital to run their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase 2 superior piglets

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos está estudiando para poder salir adelante y por medio de sus estudios poder ser alguien en la vida y también poder ayudar a su familia.
La carrera que está siguiendo es la de análisis de sistemas, en lo cual le está yendo muy bien pues es un alumno que se esfuerza.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, que le permitirá estar cada vez más cerca de su meta y seguir creciendo.
texts.en: Carlos is studying so that he can move forward and be someone in life, helping his family by way of his studies. He is studying systems analysis, which is going very well because of his efforts. He is applying for a loan which he will use to pay his university tuition. This will help him to get closer to his goal and to continue growing.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong is the oldest child in his family. His parents are carpenters and the woman sitting beside him in this picture is his mother. Neither of Luong’s parents finished secondary school and the monthly income of his family is only 15,000,000 VND. Luong is currently studying at Bacha College of Technology (http://caodangbacha.edu.vn/), and would be the first member in his family to have college degree. Besides, as the oldest child, he is eager to graduate and start to earn money to support his family. Furthermore, Luong hopes that his younger brother would emulate him and become a better student. 

Luong is requesting a 15,300,000 VND loan to buy necessary studying tools, such as a computer and books, to complete his course with the best result. His loan will help him have a greater chance to change his life and improve his family’s living condition. Luong also appreciates the support from every donor in the world for their kindness and hopes that they would come to visit Vietnam to understand more about the people and culture.

loans.use: to buy necessary studying tools, such as a computer and books

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal is 30 years of age. She is a married woman and has two children. She plans to enroll them to school soon. For nearly 14 years, Sophal has been growing rice with her husband. They have their own plot of land located not far from their home. As the family’s needs are increasing, every day they work hard to ensure that they will have an excellent harvest and can generate a higher income.

Since Sophal doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, she is unable to help her family members improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. For this particular reason,  she has requested a loan of USD 1,000 to build a household latrine. The water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate, has helped to encourage Sophal to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman and a mother of three children form Bien Unido, Bohol. She earns a living through her variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood. Erlinda has been in the business for more than 30 years now. This is the main source of her income. Her husband works as a farmer.

Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of goods to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients, and other items. With this loan, she will be able to improve her store, thus attracting more buyers and customers. In the future, Erlinda hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of goods to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients, and other items

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is married with three children. Leny is 44 years old and lives in Taguima, Tudela, Philippines.

Leny is a farmer and operates the rice land of someone else to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to buy more farm inputs.

Leny has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Leny hopes to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 48 years old and lives in Brgy. Catagan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with two children. She has been engaged in this business for almost five years.

She has a requested loan to purchase additional stock of vegetables. Caridad has been a member of PMPC for one year and six months. In the future, Caridad hopes to improve her livelihood in order for her to provide more services for her clients.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is married, with five children. She is 40 years old and lives in Aguada, Ozamiz City, Philippines.

Myrna had a sari sari store to earn a living and she has had this business for two years. Now she has requested a loan to buy feeds for her pigs.

Myrna has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for five years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Madame Adama, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 2 sont scolarisés : l’un fait le CE2 et l’autre est à la garderie d’enfants. Adama fait du commerce qui consiste à vendre des tissus. Activité qu’elle a démarrée il y a seulement 1 an. Elle fait de l’ambulant et possède une clientèle parmi ses voisins du quartier et aussi en ville.
Adama est active et grâce à son activité, participe à la dépense quotidienne.
N’ayant pas duré dans l’activité, elle aimerait bien, la développer et la diversifier, acquérir un grand espace et devenir une grande commerçante dans sa zone.
texts.en: Mrs. Adama is a married mother of four, two of whom attend school: one is doing the CE2 and the other is in daycare. Adama has been selling fabrics for only a year. She is a street vendor and has a clientele made up of neighbors and those from the city. Adama is active and thanks to her business, helps with the daily expenses. Having not been in this business for long, she would like to develop and diversity it by acquiring a big space and becoming a big seller in her area.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabrics to resell.

loans.name: Mbeugou

texts.fr:
Chauffeur de profession, Mbeugou conduit un camion depuis 2000. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants dont le plus âgé a 7 ans.
Mbeugou travaille pour un particulier qui lui a remis un camion et lui demande un versement hebdomadaire ; en contre partie, il lui paie un salaire moyen de soixante cinq mille francs par mois. Son travaille consiste à transporter du poisson dans des zones un peu éloignées du pays. Comme c’est de longues distances et que c’est du poisson frais qu’il transporte, il est tenu d’avoir un véhicule en état. C’est pourquoi d’ailleurs, il sollicite ce crédit pour faire quelques réparations du véhicule.
Mbeugou s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de la famille. 
Si le marché est bon, il peut mettre un peu d’argent de coté qui n’a rien n’à voir avec son versement hebdomadaire. Seulement a comme ambition, de se chercher un véhicule à titre personnel, de travailler pour soit même et de construire sa maison.
texts.en: A driver by profession, Mbeugou has been driving his truck since 2000. He is a married father of three, the eldest of whom is 7. Mbeugou works for a private individual who gave him a truck and asks for a weekly payment; on the flip side, he pays him an average salary of 65,000 francs per month. His work consists of transporting fish to rather far areas of the country. With the long distances and since he’s transporting fresh fish, he needs to have a vehicle in good condition. This is why he is seeking a loan to make some vehicle repairs. Mbeugou handles the daily expenses of his family. If the market is good, he can save a little money that has nothing to do with his weekly payment. He hopes to one day own his own vehicle, to work for himself, and to build a house.

loans.use: to repair his truck.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Âgé de 36ans, Kossi revend des friperies au marché. Il a démarré en 2007 et s'approvisionne au marché de Hédzranawoé. Pour améliorer son commerce, il fait une première demande pour atteindre son objectif. Le profit l'aidera à agrandir son activité et assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en: Aged 36, Kossi sells used clothing at the market. He started this in 2007 and stocks up at the market in Hédzranawoé. To improve his business, he is seeking a first loan to reach his goal. His profit will enable him to grow his business and ensure his family's self sufficiency.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
With her prior loan, Carmelita was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her loan also helped in her gardening business and she bought gardening materials and supplies such as seed and fertilizer. The income from her business is assisting with her everyday expenses at home. She continues to work to provide for her needs.
 
Carmelita is requesting another loan for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Carmelita dreams that her business will continue to be successful and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to sell

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 62 years old. She is widowed, with three children.                                  

To earn a living, Lorelie has a business selling bibingka (rice cakes). She earns about PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Lorelie has requested a loan to buy additional raw ingedients for her bibingka business. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for six years. 

In the future, Lorelie would like to have more sales and food processed to sell to her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingedients for her bibingka business

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more ready-to-wear merchandise for her business, which has been running for fifteen years now. Her income from the business is helping their family with their everyday expenses. She is working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy ready-to-wear merchandise, such as ladies' clothing, to expand her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Tessie dreams to be more successful in business, and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ready-to-wear merchandise, such as ladies' clothing, to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Basilica

texts.en:
Basilica is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Basilica is 35 years old, and has one child who is in school.

Basilica has a food vending business in the Philippines. Basilica requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, juice, margarine, etc. for her food production business.  Basilica has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Basilica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, juice, margarine, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosa works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising poultry. Rosa is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Avelina works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Avelina is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat and fish for her restaurant business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat and fish

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 36 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene tres hijos vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Recinto Desvió De los Amarillo perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES se encuentra ubicada el  recinto Desvió de los Amarillos, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, una bomba para fuigar y evitar las plagas y enfermedades, además alimento para los animales balanceados de crianza y de engorde. 

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es seguir trabajando para obtener mas ganancias y dar todo lo necesario a los hijos, le gusta mucho trabajar y caminar por el campo.
texts.en:
Carlos, 36, is in a relationship and has three children. He lives with his wife and children in the precinct of Desvió De los Amarillo, located in the canton of Ventanas and the province of Los Ríos.

He belongs to the Pequeños Agricultores ("Small Farmers") communal bank, which is also located in Desvió De los Amarillo. The bank's members work in agriculture and livestock.

Carlos makes a living in agriculture by planting corn and raising farm animals such as chickens and pigs. With this loan he will be able to buy supplies such as fertilizer, manure, and a pump to spray his crops to prevent infestation and disease. He will also buy balanced feed to raise and fatten his animals.

He makes his purchases in the city of Ventanas.

His dream is to keep working so that he can earn more money and give his children everything they need. He greatly enjoys working and walking in the countryside.

loans.use: fertilizer, manure, a pump to spray his crops to prevent infestation and disease, and balanced food to raise and fatten his animals.

loans.name: Hoeng

texts.en:
Hoeng, age 43, is a local villager from Kampong Thom province, where she has three hectares and farms rice. This is the business that she has had for around 5 years. 

Hoeng has never borrowed from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before but now she is seeking a loan for education. The loan will be used to pay the school fees for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor degree specializing in information technology. She has high hopes for her son to get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Chanthou is 34 years old, married, and has six children. She and her husband have worked very hard for years to support their family by farming rice in the local area and working for others for a fee. Their current business earns them about 33,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 12,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

This is the fourth loan for Chanthou with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Chanthou will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland, and use a portion of it to spend on harvesting rice. She hopes to get more crop from her rice paddy in order to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, 27, is married, has two children, and resides in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To support the family, she has been growing rice and sesame for 10 years while her husband works as a paid worker to gain more income to better support the family. Together, they can earn about 32,000 KHR per day and can save about 12,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Mom has been with VisionFund for three cycles and she completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. She and her group member are applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR respectively. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Rahayu Group

texts.en:
After completing the first loan cycle smoothly, Rahayu Group wants to apply for another loan from Kiva. The group has grown to 17 members, each having a different business. The members are opening a coffee shop, running food stalls, producing milkfish presto ( smoked milkfish cooked in a pressure cooker) and opening a children's game business. 

Group "Rahayu" is in the outskirts of the coastal tourist area of Srandil Beach. With this loan from Kiva, all members hope to raise more capital to increase the types of food they sell, add to the content of the shop with snacks for the kids, and to buy more sophisticated tools to produce more milkfish presto.

Rahayu Group is headed by a mother who is opening a coffee shop with children's games. Sumarsih (A), as the leader, has three children who are still in school. Her husband is a farmer. For Sumarsih (A), these loans are significant, especially for her family and the members of the Group Rahayu. She hopes, with this loan, she can raise capital to add to the coffee shop some kind of children's games. Sumarsih (A) also hopes that all the members can live better and be more energized again in developing their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more children's games for her coffee shop

loans.name: Brenda Janneth

texts.es:
Brenda de 24 años es una joven con mucho dinamismo y entusiasmo, junto a su compañero de hogar se dedica al cultivo de café mientras él no está en su trabajo formal. De su relación tienen 2 hijos quienes son menores de edad y aun no estudian. Desde hace mucho tiempo Brenda conoce los procesos que conllevan al buen crecimiento, desarrollo y sobre todo el buen sabor del grano ya que sus padres quienes son agricultores por vocación familiar le enseñaron a muy temprana edad como se llevaba a cabo dichos procesos. El terreno que ambos trabajan es propio gracias al esfuerzo por ambas partes y otra parte del terreno en herencia de sus padres el cual está ubicado en la misma comunidad donde ellos habitan muy cerca de su casa de habitación.
Sus planes para el futuro poder tecnificar y ampliar sus cultivos de café sembrando una mejor y mayor calidad de producto para ofrecer a sus clientes variedad que ayude a generar mayores ingresos para su familia y hogar. Sus sueños mejorar la calidad de vida para sus hijos, ofrecerles una oportunidad de estudiar completa para que se puedan preparar a nivel universitario graduándose de carreras con demanda y oferta de empleo o para que ellos puedan crear sus propias empresas. 
Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento para invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas y la limpieza que incluye la mano de obra calificada para la misma ya que de esa forma ella mantendrá sus cosechas limpias de maleza, plagas entre otras.
texts.en:
Brenda is 24 years old. She is a young woman with a great deal of dynamism and enthusiasm. Together with her domestic partner, she works in the cultivation of coffee while he is not at his regular job. They have two children together, who are both still minors, and are not in school. For a long time Brenda has known the processes that lead to good growth, development and, above all, good flavour of the grain, since her parents were farmers, from a family of farmers. They taught her at a very early age how to carry out such processes. The land on which they work is their own thanks to both of their efforts. The other part of land is inherited from her parents and is located very close to her home in the same community where they live.
Her future plans are to introduce technology and expand their coffee crops, planting a better and greater quality product in order to offer variety to her clients and helping her to generate greater revenue for her family and home. Her dreams are to improve the quality of life for her children, to offer them an opportunity to study fully, so they can obtain a university education and graduate, and follow careers that offer employment, or so that they can create their own businesses.
Today she has requested a loan in order to buy agricultural and cleaning supplies, including skilled manpower for the same reason, allowing her to keep the crops clean of weeds and pests.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help grow their coffee crops

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Adela is 43 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Adela has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines. Adela requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

Adela has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Adela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a Peruvian clothing designer and weaver. She would like to stock up on silk, cotton and alpaca wool for her shawls, scarves and accessories. She also plans to buy equipment for dying the yarn in her workshop.

Raquel has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is her story:

Raquel, who works alongside her husband, Gregor, is dedicated to preserving Peruvian textile traditions. "What draws us to weaving is the opportunity to work with natural fibers by rescuing ancient Inca weaving techniques. We love to see the transformation of loose yarns into garments and accessories. We help an Andean community by employing weavers on traditional looms who then help us finish each piece by hand."

"I am very grateful to all of you who collaborate with this cause. This microcredit will help us to continue growing and developing our art, and be able to be at the vanguard with our designs. We want to please all of our shoppers. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Raquel's alpaca accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5826

loans.use: to buy more silk, cotton and alpaca wool for her shawls and accessories

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a wood carver from Ghana. He would like to expand his workshop.

Abdul has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"I always knew I wanted to paint, but wasn't sure I could make a living out of it, so I looked into other fields too. I observed master carver Musa at his workshop for a period of time, then I picked up a log of wood and started carving out a mask as I had observed him doing. This surprised Musa and he was willing to help me perfect the skill. I developed a love for this new art, and that's how I eventually became a master carver too!"

"I want to thank all of you who are helping me. The last loan I received did such a lot of good! Now I'd like to expand my small workshop. This money will help me to achieve my target."

Use the link below to view Abdul's hand-carved African masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7253

loans.use: to pay for improvements to his workshop

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
Reina junto a un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales; ella se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las plantas industrializadoras de leche  del departamento de La Paz. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar ya que cada una tiene ropa para cubrirse del frio, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

Ella vive en casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de San Juan de Circa, de La provincia Aroma del Departamento de La Paz a dos horas de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz. Reina cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado criollas las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector.

El sueño de Reina es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.
El crédito que solicita es precisamente para la compra de un par de vacas lecheras para así mejorar sus ingresos al producir más leche para venta.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Reina along with a group of people from the same community decided to farm and raise animals; she raises dairy cattle to produce milk which she sells to one of the industrial milk plants in La Paz department. The first step she made was to not tether the cows nor keep them enclosed far from pasture where they like pasture now that each has a blankets to cover them from the cold, nor does she cut the horns so the calves have their naturally shaped horns, and they receive fresh and high quality food, thus keeping the cows in good health.

She lives in her own home located in the San Juan De Circa community in the Aroma province of La Paz department, two hours from La Paz city; she has various heads of cattle that required great care given the weather conditions of the area.

Reina's dream is to increase her heads of cattle and protect their good health. The loan she seeks now is to buy a pair of milk cow to increase her milk production and improve her income and quality of life.

This is the first time she seeks a loan from IMPRO and the first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a pair of milk cows to increase milk production and thus improve profits.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: María Esther es una jovencita de 28 años que lucha a diario para superarse en la vida con sus estudios, siendo este su principal instrumento para su desarrollo personal, cuenta con e l respaldo de sus padres para sus gastos universitarios. Es egresada de la carrera de contabilidad pública y finanzas, para el cual solicita el apoyo de crédito para el curso de titulación, con que podrá optar en el mercado laboral por un empleo digno que le permita desarrollarse profesionalmente y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en: María Esther, 28, fights every day to overcome in life by way of her studies. Her degree is her main instrument to develop as a person. She has her parents' support for her university expenses. She has finished her degree in public accounting and finance. She has applied for a loan to pay the fees for her degree title to be registered. With this degree, she will be able to find a decent job in the labor market which will allow her to develop professionally and support her family.

loans.use: to pay for her degree title to be registered.

loans.name: Willy Vell

texts.es:
Willy Vell tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura de frutales, arroz, café entre otros, comercio de los mismos y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de chofer en una empresa de la zona que traslada pasajeros Pomahuaca – Pucará y viceversa, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa, para renovación de Licencia de conducir y de esta manera seguir brindando este servicio para generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Willy Vell, 34, lives with his daughter in the district of Pucará. His town is characterized by its warm climate. The people work in agriculture by growing fruit, rice, and coffee to sell, among others. They also raise livestock. The town is located two hours away from the city of Jaén in the northern mountains of Perú.

Willy Vell works as a driver for a company in his region which transports passengers from Pomahuaca to Pucará and vice versa. He has applied for a loan of 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to renew his driver's license. He will then be able to continue offering his services to earn an income for his family.

loans.use: to renew his driver's license.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
Patricio tiene 50 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos y esposa en el distrito de Pomahuaca , su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo y venta de cacao, las ventas lo realiza en su distrito desde hace 15 años, también se dedica al cultivo de arroz, es un padre emprendedor ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para invertir en el cultivo de cacao y mantenimiento del mismocon la compra de abono y de esta manera tener una buena producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Patricio is 50 years old. He lives with his children and his wife in the Pomahuaca district. Its people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock raising. It is located two hours from the city of Jaén, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He raises and sells cacao. He has been selling it in his district for 15 years. He also grows rice. He is an entrepreneurial father. He has applied for a loan of 1000 PEN to invest in his cacao planting, maintaining it with the purchase of compost, and in this way having a good production to offer his customers and generating better income for his family.

loans.use: to maintain his cacao planting with the purchase of compost

loans.name: Gladis Violeta

texts.es:
Gladis Violeta tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería casado, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en este mismo distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, cuyes, cerdos, entre otros, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera ofrecerlos a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Gladis Violeta is 23 years old, lives with her two children in Oyotún district, whose population is dedicated to agriculture, business, raising cattle. She has two children and lives with her family in the same Oyotún district, in a rural area.

She raises and sells animals such as ducks, guinea pigs, pork, among others. She has asked for a loan of 500 nuevos soles to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals and in this way offer them to her customers generating greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 22 years old, married to a farmer, and has two children. She buy and sells vegetables, too. She wanted to increase her income but has insufficient funds to buy more vegetables to sell. 

She is now asking for additional revolving capital of PHP 3,000 to buy eggplant, cabbages, potatoes and beans. She hopes to sell more vegetables and gain more income, too. Someday, Jonalyn hopes to save funds for her children’s future expenses at school.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, cabbages, potatoes, and beans to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 46 years old and married with eight children and six of whom are currently in school. 

Elsie is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Elsie has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Elsie has been raising livestock for eight years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is married, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Virgilia is 30 years old, and all three children are in school.

Virgilia has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Virgilia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Virgilia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en:
Romelyn is 40 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Romelyn is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to pay for her laborer's salaries to harvest her sugarcane.

Romelyn has been farming sugarcane for six years and also earns additional income from food-vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for her laborer's salaries to harvest her sugarcane.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Phalla, 29, is married and resides in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She has three children, two of whom are in school while one is too young for school. For the last five years, she has been farming rice and growing sesame and working for others for a fee. She earns about 22,000 KHR per day to meet the family's needs.

Phalla has been with VisionFund for one cycle and she successfully paid back the loan which helped her improve her standard of living. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Phalla, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy pesticide and seeds for her sesame field, and spend a portion harvesting her rice field.  She hopes to make an income from the current business so as to expand her farmland.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and seeds for her sesame field and on harvesting her rice field

loans.name: Sem's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Battambang province’s Mung Russey district, Sem is 41 years old and married. She has four children. The main source of her family’s income is from farming rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn a daily income of 30,000 KHR to support her family and she can save about 18,000 KHR per day for future needs. 

This is the sixth loan for Sem with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans and now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to harvest a rice paddy and use a portion of it to spend on buying pesticides and seeds for her sesame farming. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds for her sesame farming, and use a portion to harvest a rice paddy

loans.name: Soern's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Soern is 29 years old, married, and has three children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and work for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 10 years, she manages to earn about 46,000 KHR per day and can save about 25,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is a group loan for Soern’s group of two who are female and Soern is a fourth cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for harvesting rice and to buy sesame seeds for farming. She hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sesame seeds for farming and to pay for harvesting rice

loans.name: Nav's Group

texts.en:
A 41-year-old married mother residing in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Nav has two children to take care of and earns a living through farming rice on three-hectare of farmland. Sometimes, her husband works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for ten years, she can earn about 43,000 KHR and can save about 24,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Nav has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She has successfully used the past loans to better her living conditions. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Nav, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy sesame seeds for farming and to harvest a rice field. She hopes to make more crops from her farmland to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy sesame seeds for farming and to harvest a rice field

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun, 35, lives in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, and she is married with six children. The family’s main sources of income are from farming rice and fishing. Having been in this business for 16 years, she is able to earn about 27,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day; however, she can save about 17,000 KHR after daily expenses. 

Oun has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and completely paid back the loan, which has helped her relieve her family burden and improve her livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to spend on harvesting the rice field. She hopes to make more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to spend on harvesting the rice field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Borey Cholsa district of Cambodia, Kun is aged 45 years and married with four children. She and her husband are hardworking farmers who earn a living through farming rice and raising pigs. The current business earns her about US $20 per day to meet the family’s needs.

Kun just began with VisionFund for this loan cycle. Now she is applying for an education loan to pay for her son’s school fee to study English literature. She highly hopes that this loan will enable her to send her son to university and also help her son to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s school fee to study English literature

loans.name: Kon

texts.en:
Kon is aged 63 and widowed. She lives in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, and she has four children. To make a living, she has been farming rice and planting beans and watermelon for 43 years. She can earn about 54,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
She has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and plowing for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and plowing for her farmland

loans.name: Heb's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of two children, Heb is aged 47, living in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. To support her family, she and her husband farm rice and plant cucumbers. Having been in this business for twelve years, she is able to earn about 31,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Heb is in her seventh cycle with VisionFund and she completely paid back the past loans which has helped her relieve the family’s burden. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes this loan will enable her increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Memot district, Sokhim is aged 30 years and married with three children. The main sources of family’s income for ten years are growing cassava and selling grocery items. The current business earns her about 100,000 KHR per day. However, she can save about 40,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Sokhim has been with VisionFund for four cycles. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. Now she is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resell

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Damabe district, Vanny is 40 years old and married. She has five children. She is a farmer who grows cassava and supplements the income by selling grocery items. Having been in this business for almost twenty years, she currently can earn about 55,000 KHR per day. 

This is a microloan for Vanny with VisionFund and she is in her sixth microloan with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more grocery items to resell and use a portion of it to spend on her farming business. She hopes to make more income from her business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resell

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Nat, aged 31, living in a rural village of the Dambae district, has two children. She and her husband are farmers who have been growing cassava for 13 years. The current business earns her about 35,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Nat has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to grow more cassava so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en: Mr. Battulga, 33 years old, lives with his wife, daughter and son in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been installing state number plates onto automobiles since 2011. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home. Their children go to high school. In the last two years, his family began building a house but due to lack of cash, the building work stopped.  So he is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. As a result, his family can live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Marelith

texts.es:
Marelith, de 36 años de edad, está casada con Hipólito quien es agricultor y tiene 02 hijos de 17 y 07 años de edad con quienes vive en su casa propia. Marelith se dedica a la venta de plátanos y frutas al por mayor y menor, Tiene una chacra de 14 hectáreas en donde tiene todos los productos que pone a la venta, de manera continua realiza la cosecha programada de sus cultivos con ayuda de un trabajador que contrata temporalmente y todo lo obtenido lo ofrece en su puesto que tiene en el mercado principal de la ciudad y en donde trabaja todo el día. Tiene su puesto desde hace 05 años pero desarrolla este oficio desde muy joven, se inició ayudando en otros puestos, ahora tiene su propio establecimiento y ahí trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo y su hijo mayor quienes la apoyan en la carga y el transporte de la pesada mercadería. 
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener un ingreso económico que le da la tranquilidad de poder brindarles a sus hijos todo lo necesario, se siente cómoda con su labor ya que conoce muy bien el ritmo del trabajo, comenta que tiene muchas ganas de seguir ampliando su negocio es por eso que ahora desea complementarlo con la venta de algunas verduras que son más solicitadas por el público. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1500, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá compra de verduras como cebollas, papa y tomate y en la producción de sus frutas regionales.
texts.en:
Marelith is 36 years old and married to Hipólito who is a farmer. She has two children who are 17 and seven years old and live with her in their own house. Marelith works selling plantains and fruits both wholesale and retail. She has a 14 hectare [34.5 acre] field from which all of the products grown go up for sale. She harvests her crops regularly with the help of a seasonal worker. Everything they harvest is sold at her stand in the main city market where she works all day. 

She has had this stand for five years but began her job when she was very young. She began by helping other stalls, but now she has her own establishment where she works with the help of her husband and eldest son. They help by carrying and transporting heavy goods.

She likes her job because it allows her to make an income and confidently afford her children with everything necessary. She feels comfortable with her work as she knows the rhythm of the job well. She says that she hopes to continue growing her business. For this reason, she wants to supplement her sales by offering various vegetables often requested by the public. 

She is asking for 1500 Peruvian Nuevo Sols and is very happy to know that she has the financial support to continue to increase her working capital. She also promises to pay her installments in a punctual manner. This loan will be used to buy vegetables such as onions, potatoes, tomatoes and to produce local fruits.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and produce local fruits.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario nació en la ciudad de Pilco – Grande y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 58  años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos.

Mario se siente alegre por el apoyo brindado y por el préstamo porque le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio, él sigue con la agricultura, a la ganadería y a la crianza de animales menores, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas. 

(La comunidad de Pilco – Grande está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Mario was born in the city of Pilco - Grande and still lives there. He is 58 years old, in a common law relationship, and has seven children.

Mario is happy with the assistance he received. His previous loan was helpful because it helped to increase his business capital. He continues to engage in farming, breeding cattle, and raising small animals. Mario is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

The community of Pilco - Grande is located in the District of Huayllabamba, which is in Paucartambo Province in the Department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.fr: Âgée de 34ans, Sonia revend des vêtements au marché. Elle s'approvisionne au marché. Pour améliorer son commerce, Elle fait une seconde demande pour atteindre son objectif. Le profit l'aidera à agrandir son activité et assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille. Mariée, elle a 02 enfants scolarisés.
texts.en: Thirty-four years old, Sonia resells clothing at the market. She gets her supplies at the market. To improve her business, she is making a second request to meet her objective. The profits will help her to expand her business and to ensure the nutritional self-sufficiency of the family. Married, she has 2 children in school.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
Lucinda tiene de 35 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo y esposa en el Centro Poblado de Piquijaca una zona rural del distrito de San Felipe, esta comunidad está ubicada en la carretera Corral Quemado, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante el comercio de preparación de alimentos, siendo sus principales clientes los transportistas, su población también se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, ubicado en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica al comercio tiene una bodega ubicada en su propio domicilio desde hace 04 años, es conocida por el buen servicio que brinda ya que cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería arroz, aceite, azúcar, leche entre otros para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Lucinda is 35 years old. She lives with her son and her husband in the population center of Piquijaca, a rural zone in the district of San Felipe. This community is located on the Corral Quemado highway, which has allowed it to develop through the sale of prepared foods, the principal customers being the truck drivers. Its population also works in farming and livestock raising. It is located two hours from the city of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

She works in commerce. For four years she has had a store, which is located in her own home. She is known for the good service that she offers, as she has a considerable clientele. She has applied for a loan of 2000 PEN to purchase merchandise such as rice, oil, sugar, and milk, among other items, to stock her business and in this way offer her customers [a greater selection],generating greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 21 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en una zona rural de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi trasladando a sus pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad, desde hace más de dos años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando el servicio de una manera segura, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 21 years old, lives with his parents in a rural area of Cayaltí, whose population works in farming, business, and raising livestock, in an area located two hours north of Chiclayo city, on the northern coast of Peru.

He provides service in public transportation with his own motortaxi, transporting his passengers to different areas of their communities. He has had this business for more than two years. He has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to perform maintenance on his vehicle and in this way continue providing service in a safe and regular way, generating greater income for his family.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Jose Segundo

texts.es:
José Segundo tiene 54 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, desde hace más de 15 años su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de cerdos y pavos para incrementar su negocio y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes para generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Segundo is 54 years old and lives with his family in Oyotún district, whose population is dedicated to agriculture, business, raising cattle. She has two children and lives with her family in the same Oyotún district, in a rural area.

He raises and sells animals such as ducks, roosters, hens, and chickends for more than 15 years. The business is located at his home. He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 nuevos soles to buy pigs and turkeys to increase his business and in this way offer his customers more in order to generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and turkeys.

loans.name: Sreynet's Group

texts.en:
Sreynet is 26 years old and married. She is the mother of one child. To make a living, she and her husband have been selling rice soup and grocery items and sometimes working for others for a fee. The current business earns them about 90,000 KHR from their current business, yet they can save about 30,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

Sreynet’s group consists of two female members who live in the same village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a second cycled client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sreynet, who is the leader, will user her portion to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to make more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resell

loans.name: Jeannessa

texts.en: Jeannessa is married, has two children, and helps her husband in managing their own motorcycle transport business while her husband does fishing as their main source of income. She earns enough from this business for their family's needs, but recently, she had an illness for which she needed financial help.  Without hesitation, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC where she has been a member for a year for her medical check up costs . She is hopeful that she will be able to pay this loan from the returns of her business. In the future, she wants to make a better living for her family.

loans.use: to pay for medical check up costs

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en: Cherry Mae is a single entrepreneur and also works for a private company. She planned to work as an OFW to earn more income to improve her living and to enable her to support her family. Before leaving, she had to repair her vehicle for her family to use it safely. As a member of GDMPC for more than seven years, she had no doubts to apply for a loan to repair her existing vehicle. She hopes to repay this loan from her income and wants to have a better living with her family in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to her existing vehicle

loans.name: Ngoem's Group

texts.en:
Aged 45 years, Ngoem is a rural villager from the EK Phnom district earning a living through planting cassava and growing rice. These are the main sources of the family’s income, and he has been in this business for 12 years. He has four children. The current business earns him about 95,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day, yet he can save about 40,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Ngoem’s group consists of three members who are all males. He is a client in his third loan cycle with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, and completely paid back the loans, which have helped him better support his family. Now he's leading his group to apply for a loan, and Ngoem will use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend on land plowing. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his crop yields and sell for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Doña Dominga tiene 44 años de edad, ama de casa y agricultora en una relación de unión libre que junto a su compañero de hogar quien también es agricultor tienen 3 hijos quienes ayudan en las diferentes actividades a desarrollar en el campo. Desde muy temprana edad se dedica a la agricultura especialmente la siembra y cultivo de café ya que en su familia es una vocación y por lo tanto único medio de ingresos para el fortalecimiento de la economía en su hogar. El terreno que ellos trabajan es propio el cual fue obtenido una parte por herencia de sus padres y el otro con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo por varios años ubicado cerca de su casa de habitación.
Los planes para el futuro es poder tecnificar sus cultivos de café, ampliar más sus cultivos mediante la compra de más tierra y sembrar una variedad de café para ofrecer a sus compradores y satisfacer la demanda insatisfecha. Sus sueños y esperanzas para con sus hijos, mejorar su calidad de vida, ofrecerles un patrimonio digno para que en el futuro cuando ellos falten puedan tener un lugar donde trabajar y generar ingresos para su hogar.
Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abono y pago de mano de obra para mantener limpios sus cultivos de café de maleza, plagas, entre otros que son perjudiciales para dicho rubro.
texts.en:
Doña Dominga is a 44-year-old housewife and farmer in a common-law marriage. She and her partner, who is also a farmer, have three children who help in the different work they do in the fields. Since a very young age, she has worked in farming—especially planting and growing coffee, since that is her family's line of work—so that is her only way of earning money to strengthen her household finances. They own the land that they farm, which is close to their residence; they obtained one part through an inheritance from her parents and the other through a great deal of effort and hard work over several years. 

Her plan for the future is to be able to modernize her coffee growing, increase her crops through the purchase of more land, and to plant a variety of coffee plants to offer her buyers and satisfy demand. Her dreams and hopes are to improve her family's quality of life and to provide her children with a worthy inheritance so that in the future when they are no longer around, her children will have a place to work and generate income for their households. That's why today she has requested financing from the COMIXMUL cooperative for the purchase of agricultural supplies like fertilizers and soil amendments as well as to pay for manual labor to keep her crops free of weeds, disease, and other threats.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and soil amendments and to pay for manual labor to assist with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Asghari

texts.en:
Asghari’s age is 55; she is married and living with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Asghari owns a small business of clothing at home. She purchases clothes from the market at a low price and sells them at a high price in her community. The ladies of the town like her garment collection and selection a lot. Her family members appreciate her for her efforts. 

Now the winter season is going on and due to the up-coming Christmas season, the demand has increased rapidly. She wants to buy clothes of the winter season to sell, but she does not have cash in hand due to household expenses.  

She requested a loan so that she can buy clothes of the winter season to fulfill the demand.She wishes for a bright future for her children and her dream to provide a better living standard and comfort to her family.

loans.use: To buy clothes of the winter season for resale.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Chnnag province’s Chol Kiri district, Sopheap, 41, has four children in total. Sopheap and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming and planting lotus for 15 years to make a living.

She has been with VisionFund for one cycle and she completely paid back the past loan. Now she is asking for another loan to pay for her daughter’s tuition for nursing studies.  She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her daughter in tertiary education until graduation and also that it will help to relieve her family's financial burden so she can sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition

location.town: Kampong Chnang Province, Chol Kiri District

loans.name: Loynie

texts.en: Loynie is a single, young entrepreneur who works as a store attendant and operates her own sari-sari store in her home at Doña Consuelo, Ozamis City. She personally assists and manages her store on weekends. When she's on duty, her mother, with whom she stays, watches over her store. She earns well from the business and has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, which she used for the business. Recently,  she took a new loan to buy additional goods to sell. She is determined to successfully improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Emilyn
