texts.en: Emilyn, age 32, is married to a tricycle driver and blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a retail store in her village for almost three years. With this business, she's earning a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her daily profits are usually spent on the school fees and allowances of her children. Due insufficient funds to use in her store, she would like a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase beverages, canned goods, noodles, chips, and breads to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, canned goods, noodles, chips, and breads to sell.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Byambasuren is 48 years old and lives with her husband and son in a relative's house rent-free in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband Ganbat is 54 and works at a local company as a driver. Her son has graduated from college and is now looking for a job.
Byambasuren is a hardworking and diligent lady who started her own business selling clothes in a rental stall at the local market in 2003. She has just started selling used clothes in a rented basement room close to the crowd to increase her sales and profitability. She has a dream of expanding her business into a big clothing shop. She is now requesting loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of second hand clothes to resell in her shop.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is 28-year-old, single man who lives together with his parents. He earns a living by breeding cows and cattle, and sells their milk and milk products as well as meat to local butchers. Elchin is a very positive man and he has five years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how to look after cattle. 

He earns about 180 AZN a month from this business. Elchin is requesting a loan for 1,000 AZN to buy two beef cattle and one milk cow. This is going to be his first loan.

loans.use: to buy two beef cattle and one  milk cow

loans.name: Neciforo

texts.en: Neciforo raises livestock, primarily pigs, for sale.  He has been in this business for many years, earning enough for the family, and was able to repay his previous loan successfully. He used his previous loan to improve his piggery business. Recently, he borrowed a new loan to purchase more piglets to raise. Neciforo hopes to improve his income in order to provide a better living for the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en: As a way of generating income, Edwin runs a small eatery within his community.  Together with his wife, they help each other in cooking and selling of meals and snacks.  They aim to offer more kinds of recipes to their customers but they don't have enough capital. For this reason, Edwin is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fresh meat, fish, vegetables and other ingredients they need to make meals to sell in the community. Through this loan, they are hoping that someday they will further improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat, fish, vegetables and other ingredients

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 41-year-old married man from a small village near Tulkarm City. He lives with his wife and eight kids, five sons and three daughters. Ibrahim works in the construction field. He has a good job but it is not stable due to the low demand in the winter. Ibrahim also works as a farmer on his land. He uses green houses to ensure better quality for the crops. He sells his products in the local market. 

Ibrahim took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy the needed materials to build new green houses. This will help him to develop his farm and increase productivity. Ibrahim appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy the needed materials to build new green houses

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en: Modesto is married, has two children, and manages his own farm for a living. He has been in farming for more than twenty years, growing corn, coconut and other root crops, and sells them in town to earn an income. He has been a member of GDMPC for more than ten years and recently decided to borrow a loan to repair his vehicle which he uses in transport his farm produce. He hopes to earn more returns from his farm and provide a better living for the family in the future.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle which he uses to transport his farm produce

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie is married with one child and works in a private company to help her husband earn income for the family.  In addition to this, she plans to establish a vegetable garden in a vacant lot nearby to earn more income.  

She has been a GDMPC member for more than five years and recently decided to borrow a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase vegetable seedlings, fertilizer and cover land preparation costs.  

She is hoping to gain more income to improve the quality of life for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seedlings, fertilizer and cover land preparation costs

loans.name: Gonzalo Francisco

texts.es:
Gonzalo Francisco tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en El Caserío La Granadilla, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus paisajes verdes, su relieve es accidentado lo que le ha permitido tener diversos pisos ecológicos para la agricultura, su población se dedica al cultivo de café, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a cinco horas de la ciudad de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café de la variedad catimor, desde hace más de tres años, también se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, es un joven emprendedor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café y de esta manera tener una buena producción de café para ofrecerlo y así generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Gonzalo Francisco is 23 years old. He lives with his parents in the village of La Granadilla, in a rural zone of the district of Santo Tomás. It is a community that is known for its green landscapes. Its terrain is rugged, which allows it to have various ecological levels for agriculture. Its population works in growing coffee, commerce, and livestock raising. It is located five hours from the city of Cutervo, which belongs to the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He has been growing coffee of the Catimor variety for more than three years. He also raises and sells cattle. He is a young entrepreneur. He has applied for a loan of 2500 PEN to purchase compost to maintain his coffee plantings and in this way have a good production of coffee to offer and thus generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost to maintain his planting of coffee

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: El señor Hugo tiene 55 años de edad, su esposa falleció hace varios años dejándolo al cuidado de sus hijos, con los que vive en alquiler, logro estudiar hasta el bachillerato y actualmente  trabaja con un vehículo, solicita un crédito para la compra de muebles(camas y una mesa) ya que los que tiene son antiguos y algunos están deteriorados o muy maltratados, por ello quiere cambiarlos para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Hugo is fifty-five years old. His wife passed away several years ago leaving him to care for their children. He lives with his children in a rental property. He managed to study up until high school. Currently, he works with a vehicle. He is applying for this loan to buy furniture (beds and a table) since what he has is old and some of his furniture is deteriorated or very worn. For this reason, he wants to replace them to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beds and a table.

loans.name: Martha Delinda

texts.es:
Martha Delina tiene 20 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Nueva Arica, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores cerdos, patos, cuyes, desde hace tres años, su esposo se dedica a brindar servicio de labores agrícolas, son una familia emprendedora,Martha ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de saldo para regargas de teléfonos móviles y una segunda parte para la compra de de pollos para posteriormente ofrecerlo a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Martha Delina is 20 years old and lives with her husband in Nueva Arica district, whose population is dedicated to agriculture, business, and raising cattle, which is located two hours north of Chiclayo city on the northern coast of Peru.

She raises and sells small animals such as pigs, ducks, guinea pigs for three years. Her husband provides agricultural labor services. They are a hard-working family. Martha has asked for a loan for 1000 nuevos soles to invest in buying rechargeable mobile phone prepaid cards and a second part of the loan will be to buy chickens to then sell to her customers and in this way generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone prepaid cards.

loans.name: Sayuni Group

texts.fr: La cliente Regina est une commerçante  et membre du groupe  d’affaires « Sayuni », entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 72 ans, veuve et mère de 4 enfants, tous mariés. La cliente est une vendeuse des épices (aie, noix de muscade, cube Maggy, sel iodé, arachides, oignons, feuille de laurier, etc.). Elle installe sa marchandise à son domicile devant son enclos, dans une avenue animée. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari (lors de son vivant).Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 15kg d’aie, 4 paquets de noix de muscade, 5 paquets de cube maggy, 1sac de sel, 10kg d’arachides, ½ panier d’oignons et 1 tat de feuilles de laurier. Ainsi, elle souhaite la construire une maison et préparer l’avenir de ses fils. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment poste conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The client Regina is a shopkeeper and member of the business group "Sayuni". She is an entrepreneur, dynamic, 72 years old, widow and mother to 4 children, who are all married. The client is a seller of spices (garlic, nutmeg, Maggy cubes, iodized salt, ground nuts, onions, bay leaves, etc.). She sets up her merchandise at her home in front of her enclosure, in an animated street. She started her business with the first capital received from her husband (at the time he was living). Later, she benefitted from a loan from the MFI Hekima. She has been in this business for 4 years. This new loan will help her to buy 15kg of garlic, 4 packages of nutmeg, 5 packages of Maggy cubes, 1 bag of salt, 10kg of ground nuts, ½ a basket of onions and lots of bay leaves. Thus, she hopes to build a house and plan for the future of her sons. In the end, she hardily thanks Hekima for the empowerment of entrepreneuring non-bankable women; during this time there are conflicts in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 15kg of garlic, 4 packages of nutmeg, 5 packages of Maggy cubes, 1 bag of salt, 10kg of ground nuts, ½ a basket of onions and lots of bay leaves.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Soklai's Group

texts.en:
A married mother living in a rural village located in the Damabe district of Kampong Cham province, Soklai is 28 years old and has one kid. Soklai is a farmer who grows cassava. Having been in this business for ten years, she is able to earn about 47,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Soklai is a fifth-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past loans have helped her improve her livelihood. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cassava and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to grow more cassava so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cassava

loans.name: Sal

texts.en:
Sal, 46, lives with her husband and four children in a village of Kampong Cham province’s Srey Sonthor district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost ten years and they supplement the family’s income by selling mats. She is able to earn about US $7 per day to meet the family’s need.

This is the first loan for Sal with VisionFund. She is asking for a loan to pay for her daughter tuition to study economics. She hopes this loan will enable her daughter to obtain a higher education background so that she can get a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition to study economics

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Srey Santhor District

loans.name: Emm-E-Kalsoom

texts.en:
Emm-e-Kalsoom is 36 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using his three-wheeled rickshaw. A few months ago, he purchased a new rickshaw on installments.  He has been paying installments successfully since the beginning, but with the passage of time it has gotten difficult to pay.

For this reason, Emm-e-Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can pay all the payment installments that are due. This will help him to generate income. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Emm-e-Kalsoom thanks Kiva and the field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for all the payment installments due on her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Sreyneang's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Sreyneang is 24 years old and married. To make a living, she has been growing cassava for six years. She earns about 27,000 KHR per day to support her family.

Sreyneang is a third cycle client with VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans which helped her provide her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sreyneang is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to make more income from cassava in order to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 39-year-old housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her one son and two daughters. Her husband has owned a hotel for 10 years, which is the only source of income for their family. 

Saima has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase materials like flour, rice, legumes, vegetables, etc, for the hotel.

She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them and will bring a positive change to their monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase materials like flour, rice, legumes, and vegetables for the hotel.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 54-years old lady; and spends her life with her husband and three daughters.

She is taking a loan for her daughters, because all of her daughters are experts in the art of embroidery, and knit very fine bridal dresses. 

Due to high demand, they are facing a shortage of material and are unable to knit fine embroidery. Therefore, Rukhsana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can reduce the shortage of embroidery raw material. Through this amount she will buy inventory of threads, fancy cloths, precious stones, sequins, and pearls of various colors. Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery material for knitting embroidery

loans.name: Sainjargal

texts.en:
Sainjargal is 31 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Sainjargal has been working as a sales manager since 2012. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home looking after their infant. He is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 (MNT) to buy a plot of land. The land will be used for growing vegetables, breeding domestic animals, and building his dream house. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn has been helping on her farm for more three years, earning well for the family. Her farmland produced such an abundant harvest with her efforts and investment that was able to send her children to school and successfully repay her previous loan from GDMPC. She used this loan for farm inputs. Aside from farming, Merlyn and her husband are engaged in a transportation services business to earn more income. To buy new tires for their vehicle, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Paz Y Bien Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Paz  y Bien” conformada por 07 socios responsables y unidos. Guadalupe es separada y tiene 04 hijos, 01 de ellos aún dependiente.  A sus 58 años Guadalupe ha llegado a cumplir con algunos de sus sueños como apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios y mantener su negocio. Actualmente cuenta con una bodega en su vivienda. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para seguir invirtiendo, la cual comprará abarrotes, bebidas y panetones para ofrecerlos por campaña navideña. Seguir trabajando positivamente es su mayor anhelo. El grupo “Paz y Bien”  está agradecido con los inversionistas Kiva y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Guadalupe es la primera del lado izquierdo,  viste polo celeste con rayas blancas  y casaca fucsia.
texts.en: The group “Paz  y Bien” is made up of 7 responsible, united members. Guadalupe is separated and has 4 children. One of them is still dependent on her. At 58 years old, Guadalupe has been able to achieve some of her dreams, like helping her children with their studies and maintaining her business. She currently has a small store in her home. She is requesting the loan to continue investing in her business. She will buy groceries, drinks, and Christmas pastries to offer for the holiday season. Her greatest desire is to continue working positively. “Paz y Bien” is grateful for the Kiva investors, and the group's members promise to continue working hard. Guadalupe is the one on the left in the blue and white striped shirt and pink sweater.

loans.use: to buy groceries, drinks,and Christmas pastries.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is a 55-year-old married woman from Bethlehem city. She is a mother of nine children; seven sons and two daughters. For the past two years, Majida has been working in a sewing workshop she owns. One of Majida's daughters works with her.  This is the only source of income for the family. Majida would like to develop her business since she has an increasing demand for services, due to the high quality she produces.

Majida took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more textiles for her sewing workshop. By taking this loan, Majida will be able to increase her productivity, and also her income. 

Majida appears in the photo in her sewing workshop

loans.use: to buy more textiles for her sewing workshop

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 56 years of age, married, and blessed with four children. She has owned and managed a retail store for home products for almost twenty years. With this business she's earning a net income of PHP 5,000, and she has saved her income for future emergencies. Due to financial constraints, she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to purchase kitchen utensils and home appliances to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can be able to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and home appliances to sell.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 42-year-old man, married, and a father of four children. He is a dairy farmer and has been in this business for five years now. He gets a monthly income of 45,000 shillings.

This will be Fredrick's fifth loan with VisionFund Kenya and he plans to use the entire loan to buy a dairy cow. He wants to educate all of his children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 31 years old, married to a tricycle driver, and blessed with two children. She has been a vegetable vendor at the public market for almost fourteen years and earns a net income of PHP 1,000 daily. She usually spends her income on their food and children's school allowances. Due to a lack of capital, she would like to ask for a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to purchase eggplants, bitter gourds, and tomatoes to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve and expand her business to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase eggplants, bitter gourds, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Céline's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans la même localité. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Céline, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 44 ans. Céline n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Céline est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Justin. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Céline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les besoins de sa famille, Céline vend depuis quinze ans des condiments, des vivres et divers articles à son domicile. Céline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire, Céline ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people who live in the same area. This is the second time that the group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to raise the level of their business.

Céline, the representative of the group (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) is 44 years old. She did not attend school. She is married to a shopkeeper named Justin, and together they have six children, all of whom attend school and are in their care. Céline lives together with her husband and children. The couple is responsible for the various expenses of the family.

In order to provide for her needs and those of her family, Céline has been selling spices, food articles, and various items from her home for the last fifteen years. She stocks up at a market in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers and to increase her business turnover, Céline, along with the other members of the group, are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Their previous loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase food items and vegetable oil

loans.name: Nonvignon-Gbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON-GBE est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans la même localité. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Pélagie, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 52 ans. Pélagie est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Antoine. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pélagie vit seule avec ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Pélagie vend depuis vingt ans du maïs, de la farine de blé et des sacs de charbon de bois à son domicile. Pélagie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour diversifier son activité, Pélagie ensemble avec les membres du groupe NONVIGNON-GBE sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Nonvignon-GBE group is made up of three people who live in the same region. This is the third time that the group is requesting the financial assistance of ALIDé, in order to raise the level of their business.

Pélagie, the representative of the group (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) is 52 years old. She is married to a welder named Antoine. Together they have four children, all of whom attend school and are in their care. Pélagie lives alone with her children. She and her husband together provide for the needs of their family.

In order to provide for her needs and those of her family, Pélagie has been selling wheat flour and bags of charcoal from her home for the last twenty years. She stocks up at a market in Benin.

In order to meet the needs of her customers and to diversify her business, Pélagie, together with the other members of the Nonvignon-GBE group, is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. Their previous loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a single entrepreneur who has been running a general store for more than six years earning a good living. She has been a member of GDMPC for more than a year.  To boost her store sales, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more grocery goods to resell. She hopes to improve her business, and have a stable income for a better living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is forty years old, married to Milka and is the father of three children.  He is a dairy farmer in Nyathuna, in the outskirts of Kangemi, and has been in this business for five years now.  He earns a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Walter's third loan with KADET LTD.  He plans to use the entire loan to buy a dairy cow.  In the future he wants to be a successful business man.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cow

loans.name: Bella Rosa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Bella Rosa works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling rice.  Bella Rosa is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, spices, chips, etc. for her general store.

Bella Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, spices, chips, etc. for her general store

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz, una mujer campesina de 40 años de edad, vive felizmente casada con su esposo y sus 5 hijos, a quienes ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Siempre ha sido un ama de casa ejemplar, pero hace 10 años aprendió de su esposo, a realizar todas las labores del campo, con el ánimo de mejorar los ingresos familiares, pues la situación económica era difícil. Por ello decidió comenzar a cultivar flores y, las cosechas que recolecta son vendidas en la plaza de mercado, así genera recursos para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. 
Su empuje, tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante y sobrepasar los diversos obstáculos que se le presentan, especialmente debido a los altos costos de los insumos y al cambio climático que afecta sus cultivos; sin embargo siempre busca alternativas que le permitan seguir avanzando; por ello se motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (larvicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, entre otros), así podrá continuar con sus cultivos y tener una cosecha más productiva, generando mejor nivel de ganancia.
Beatriz manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es ampliar sus cultivos y tener la oportunidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, además desea brindar una educación de mejor calidad a todos sus hijos, para que se forjen un futuro más próspero.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 40, is from the countryside and lives happily married with her husband and their 5 children. The family has gotten ahead with much effort from Beatriz.

She has always been an exemplary house wife but ten years ago she learned from her husband how to work the fields with the aim of improving the family income because they were in a difficult economic situation. Therefore, she decided to begin to grow flowers and the harvests that she collects are sold in the market square so that she can generate income to help her husband with the household costs.

Her drive, tenacity and perseverance have enabled her to succeed and overcome the numerous obstacles that she has encountered, especially the high cost of supplies and climate change that affects her crops. Nonetheless, she always looks for alternatives that allow her to progress. For that reason she is asking for the help of a loan that she will invest in the purchase of farming supplies such as larvicides, pesticides and insecticides at wholesale. With this loan she will be able to continue with her crops, have a more productive harvest and generate a higher level of profits.

Beatriz said that her greatest desire is to expand her crops and have the opportunity to improve the living conditions of her family. She also hopes to provide a better quality education to all of her children so that they can have a more prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as larvicides, pesticides and insecticides at wholesale.

loans.name: Norma Germania

texts.es:
Norma tiene 34 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con su esposo y con sus hijos, de 15, 13 y 9 años. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama ASOCIACIÓN MONTUBIOS VENTANILLA NORTE se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Ventanilla Norte, perteneciente al cantón ventanas, se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Norma se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años y realiza comidas rápidas. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en el Comercial Montenegro y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar. 
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es prosperar en la agricultura y sacar adelante a su familia.
Le gusta trabajar con su familia.
texts.en:
Norma is 34 years old. She lives in free union with her husband and their children, ages 15, 13, and 9. She lives in Ventanas canton in the province of Los Rios.

The solidarity group is called Asociación Montubios Ventanilla Norte. It is located in the North Ventanilla district, which belongs to the Ventanas canton. It works with agricultural and livestock raising activities.

Norma has worked in agriculture, planting corn and rice, for several years, and she makes fast food. She buys her supplies in the Montenegro store in Ventanas, and she sells her products in the market in the same place.

The loan that she has applied for is to purchase compost and fertilizers to plant corn and rice. The loan will help her to increase her income for the use of her family and to invest. Her dream is to prosper in agriculture and to raise her family.

She likes to work with her family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Nona

texts.en: Nona is a 27-year-old married woman. She lives in the Senaki district. She lives with her husband, daughter, and father-in-law. Her husband works as an artisan of sanitary installations and generates approximately 100 GEL monthly. Nona's father-in law is a guard in a kindergarten. Nona is unemployed at the moment, in spite of having a high education. There is a high unemployment rate in the region. So, she decided to start a clothing and home product trading business with the loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Nona received the credit in the framework of the joint initiative, Kiva and Credo - Startup Program, that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of 650 USD, she will purchase clothing and other home products at wholesale prices and sell them door-to-door in her community, Senaki and nearby villages. It is obvious that the job is hard for Nona, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for her family, as their income will be significantly increased. Regards to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to start a clothing and home product trading business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase two balls of "pagne" (traditional cloth)

loans.name: Robeena

texts.en: Robeena, a 31-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, two sons, and three daughters. One son and two daughters are studying and her husband is an auto mechanic. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Robeena is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She herself is a tailor and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. Robeena has requested a loan from KIVA partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for her family's future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Moon

texts.en:
Moon is a 41-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children.
Moon requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to buy cardboard for making shoe boxes. In fact, she is making shoe boxes along her children and sells them to the shoe manufacturing companies.

Now, she wants to open a new shop for her son so that he can sell shoe boxes widely, but she is short some capital needed for basic requirements and purchasing cardboard. 

Moon seems very happy after receiving this loan; she is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cardboard for making shoe boxes

loans.name: Blaise

texts.fr: Blaise est un homme de 28 ans, célibataire et père d'un enfant. il possède et gère une boutique de vente de produits alimentaire dans un quartier de la ville depuis 1 an et 4 mois. il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des produits alimentaire tels que les sac de riz, huile de palme, boissons hygiénique et autres produits de première nécessité afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans son activité pour l'agrandir d'une part et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille d'autre part
texts.en: Blaise is a 28 year old man, single and father to one child. He has owned and managed a shop selling foodstuffs in a neighborhood of the town for 1 year and 4 months. He is requesting this loan to strengthen his stock of merchandise by buying foodstuffs such as bags of rice, palm oil, hygienic drinks and other absolutely essential products in order to satisfy his clientele and increase his turnover. The profits generated will be partly reinvested in his business to expand it and partly used to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Dashdondov

texts.en:
Mrs. Dashdondov is 47 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a Ger (a traditional nomadic yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her husband, Batsaihan, is 49 and runs a wooden furniture manufacturing business at home with his wife. Her younger two children attend a local secondary school. 

Dashdondov has been working as a saleswoman for years, and now she has started running her family business of wooden furniture manufacturing at home with her husband. She got her daughter to work at the store where she used to work. They have received a lot of orders from local customers and now need 2,500,000 MNT to purchase materials and inventory to meet the orders on time. They are hardworking, positive and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase materials and inventory to meet the orders on time

loans.name: Karina Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Karina es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí soltera y madre de un hijo. Tiene 37 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería y venta de mercadería. Inicio su negocio con unos ahorros que tenía, y con el apoyo de sus familiares. Su meta próxima es aumentar los productos que ofrece a sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para la compra de: Ropa, Zapatos y útiles escolares. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda porque podrá surtir su pulpería con más productos y así obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es establecer una distribuidora que tenga todo tipo de productos.
texts.en: Karina is native to the city of Estelí and is a single mother of one son. She is 37 years old. She has a commercial profession, she works in a convenience store for a living and sells merchandise. She began her business with some savings that she had and with the support of her family. Her next goal is to increase the products that she offers to her clients. She requests the loan for the purchase of clothes, shoes, and school supplies. She estimates that the loan will be helpful because she will be able to supply her convenience store with more products and that way earn more. Her future plan is to establish a wholesale business that has all type of products.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes, and school supplies.

loans.name: Uwezesho Group

texts.en:
SCOLASTICA, who is in her mid 30's, is a widow with two children, who are still in school.  She has been running a general store business for two years now.  She works from 7 AM to 11 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be SCOLASTICA's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy dry foods like sugar, maize flour, baking flour, beans, bar and powdered soaps, and other shop products for resale. She has managed to pay back all of her previous loans successfully. Scolastica used her business profit to cover school fees and household expenses. Scolastica will use this loan to increase the general store inventory and meet her customers' demands. She dreams of being able to improve her general store shop. 

Scolastica will share this loan with her loan group" UWEZESHO " which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the general store inventory and meet his customers' demands.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella desea seguir participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negocio, ella continúa con los negocios de venta de frutas, ganadería y agricultura, ella vende frutas de las más populares que crecen por la zona Challabamba que son las manzanas y los duraznos. 

Sebastiana en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más frutas como por ejemplo manzanas.
texts.en: Sebastiana thanks the Kiva investors for the loan and feels content because of their support. She hopes to continue participating in this project because it helps her to increase her business's capital. She also feels motivated to continue working in her business. Sebastiana is continuing her business selling fruit, ranching, and working in agriculture. She sells the most popular fruits that grow in the Challabamba area, such as apples and peaches. Sebastiana needs this current loan to buy more fruit, such as apples for example.

loans.use: to buy fruits such as apples to sell.

loans.name: Ayaba Henriette Ursule's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de six personnes qui vivent dans la même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe Ayaba Henriette Ursule,(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 45 ans. Ayaba Henriette Ursule a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau primaire. Ayaba Henriette Ursule est mariée à un certain Francis. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Ayaba Henriette Ursule vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de ménage. Pour ce faire, Ayaba Henriette Ursule vend depuis vingt ans du maïs et des sacs de charbon de bois dans sa région. Ayaba Henriette Ursule s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour renforcer son activité, Ayaba Henriette Ursule ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of six people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the second time they are requesting the financial assistance of ALIDé, in order to raise the level of their business. 

The representative of the group, Ayaba Henriette Ursule (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) is 45 years old. She only attended school through the primary level. Ayaba Henriette Ursule is married to a man named Francis, and together the coupld has four children, all of whom attend school and are in their care. 

Ayaba Henriette Ursule lives together with her husband and children, and the couple provides for all of the needs of the household. In order to accomplish this, Ayaba Henriette Ursule has been selling corn and bags of charcoal in her region for the last twenty years. She stocks up at a market in Benin.

In order to meet the needs of her customers and to grow her business, Ayaba Henriette Ursule, together with the other members of her group, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase corn and charcoal

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 47 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. 

Flordeliza runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar and eggs.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, including shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 35, is married and has four children. Three of her children are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for four years now and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is 33 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Sheryl works very hard to provide for them.

Sheryl runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as coffee, sugar, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Sheryl has been in this business for two years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as coffee, sugar, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, etc

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 38 years old and married with seven children.

Erna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, coffee, noodles, etc.

Erna has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Erna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, coffee, noodles, etc

loans.name: Purisima Del Rocio

texts.es:
Purisima tiene 39 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene tres hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Recinto Desvió De los Amarillo perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES se encuentra ubicada el  recinto Desvió de los Amarillos, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Purisima se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, además alimento para los animales balanceados. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es obtener un terreno para seguir sembrando , le gusta mucho festejar las fiestas del patrono del recinto y fin de año.
texts.en:
Purisima is 39 years old. She lives in a free union relationship and has three children. She lives with her husband and their children in the Desvió precinct of Los Amarillos, which belongs to the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Rios.

She belongs to the solidarity group "Pequeños Agricultores" (Small Farmers), which is located in the Desvió precinct in Los Amarillos, which is part of the Ventanas canton. It works with agricultural and livestock-raising activities.

Purisima works in agriculture, planting corn and raising barnyard animals such as chickens and pigs. With the loan, she will be able to buy supplies such as fertilizer, compost, and insecticides to avoid pests and diseases, as well as balanced feed for the animals. She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas.

Her dream is to obtain a parcel of land to continue planting. She very much likes to celebrate the fiestas of the patron saint of the district and the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and insecticides to avoid pests and diseases, and also to buy balanced feed for the animals

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Meet Irene, a farmer and mother of four children residing in Kisii, Kenya. She loves farming, because it is her main source of livelihood. She produces and sells bananas and maize. Her challenge in farming is climate change, because her produce is affected by harsh weather.

Irene chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, because the organization offers loans at a low interest rate and provides better services that suit the needs of small-scale farmers.

This loan will enable Irene to purchase a dairy cow, thus begin to sell milk. This will mean more income, which will help her sustain her family and also pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ouindinmanegde Group

texts.fr:
Mme BINTA est la représentante du groupe OUINDINMANEGDE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 02 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend des plats plastiques  depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au  marché de Sankaryaaré. Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes. 
Elle veut s’acheter  10seaux en plastiques, 20 de plats en plastique.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices afin d’acquérir une parcelle. Elle ambitionne  étendre les limites de son  activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madam Binta is the representative of the group Ouindinmanegde. She is doing well. Married, she is mother to 3 children. The oldest is 12 years old and the youngest is 3 years old. Two go to school.

Madam has been selling plastic dishes for 5 years. She gets her supplies at the market in Sankaryaaré. Her customers are women and men. She wants to buy herself 10 plastic buckets and 20 plastic dishes.

Madam wants to save her profits in order to obtain a plot of land. Her ambition is to expand the limits of her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy herself 10 plastic buckets and 20 plastic dishes.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 36-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of two children.

For many years her husband has been successfully running a business selling milk in his community.  Over time, he has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk.  He also sells butter and cheese to generate extra profit.  He has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to his family's income.  His business is good enough for him to lead a decent life. 

For the growth of business, he wants to buy more milk to sell and use for the production of cheese, butter, etc., but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy more milk. Therefore, Samina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more milk. 

He hopes to get an increase in the production capacity which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She thanks Kiva and her field partner, BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy more milk to sell and to use for the production of cheese, butter, etc

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Eizabeth, habitante de un humilde barrio de Managua, es madre de dos hijos por quienes se preocupa a diario para que no les falte lo esencial en la vida, la alimentación y estudios, para ella es muy difícil no contar  con el apoyo del padre de sus hijos, siendo ella soltera se gana la vida con su pequeña pulpería que tiene situada en su casa de habitación, este crédito que solicita es para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio  con granos básicos, pollo, carne, lácteos,  verduras, embutidos entre otros. Para contar siempre con productos para venderle a su clientela, de esta manera garantizar sus ingresos para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en: Elizabeth lives in a modest neighborhood in Managua. She is the mother of two children. She cares for them every day so they receive the food and studies they need. It is very difficult for her not to have the help of her children's father. Since she is single, Elizabeth makes her living with a small general store in her house. Elizabeth is requesting this loan to continue investing in her business by buying bulk grains, chicken, beef, dairy products, vegetables, and sausages, among others, to always have products to sell to her customers. In this way, she will guarantee her income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy dry grains, chicken, beef, dairy products, vegetables, and sausages, among other foods.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: To have an additional source of income, Felisa engages in the buying and reselling of rice in her local community. She aims to improve her business and increase her income in order to satisfy her family's necessities and support the education of her children. Due to financial burdens, she is asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy more stock of rice to sell. She is hoping that her loan will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chimène Djivèdé Laurinda's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Chimène Djivèdé Laurinda(dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Fortuné. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Chimène Djivèdé Laurinda a très peu fréquenté l'école. Chimène Djivèdé Laurinda vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison.  Pour ce faire, Chimène Djivèdé Laurinda vend des tissus et des chaussures à son domicile depuis une vingtaine d'années. Chimène Djivèdé Laurinda s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité, Chimène Djivèdé Laurinda s’associe aux autres de son groupe pour solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: This group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Chimène Djivèdé Laurinda (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 35 years old and is married to a certain Fortuné. The couple has three children, all in school and under their care. Chimène Djivèdé Laurinda went to school very little. Chimène Djivèdé Laurinda lives together with her husband and her children. The couple takes care of the different household responsibilities together. To do this, Chimène Djivèdé Laurinda has been selling fabric and shoes from her home for about 20 years. Chimène Djivèdé Laurinda gets her supplies in a market in Bénin. With the goal of strengthening their business, Chimène Djivèdé Laurinda joined the others in her group to request a third loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric and shoes.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra helps her husband manage their own motorcycle transport business to earn a living. Her husband is the one who uses their motorcycle to carry passengers and baggage to earn income for the family. 

Alejandra has been in this business for five years, earning enough to pay for school expenses for her four children. She is borrowing from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative to purchase tires and spare parts to provide better services. 

In the future, Alejandra wants to have another motorcycle to expand their business.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a 48-year-old man, married to Mary, and a father of four children. He repairs and sells electronics in Kwambira, on the outskirts of the town of Limuru. He has been in this business for 13 years now and he receives a monthly income of 16,300 shillings.

This will be Alexander's sixth loan with KADET LTD; he plans to use the entire loan to buy electronics such as DVD players, TV sets, etc. In the future, he wants to educate his children and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy electronics such as TV sets, DVD players, etc

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: To have another source of income, Joel engages in a hog-raising business in his community. He is 38 and married, but doesn't have children. Despite that, he wants to become financially stable and successful in life. He plans to expand his pigpen and raise more pigs to sell. Having insufficient capital, he is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy additional piglets as well as feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for his hogs. He is hoping that someday, he will further improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets as well as feed, vitamins, and vaccines for his hogs

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 46 years old and married with seven children. With four of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Leonarda runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to sell, such as soap, milk, canned goods, eggs and spices.

Leonarda has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, such as soap, milk, canned goods, eggs and spices.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 37 years old and married with five children.

Liza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, vinegar, noodles, etc.

Liza has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Liza aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, vinegar, noodles, etc

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Arlene is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials such as nets, wood, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials such as nets, wood, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio is 41 years old and is from Getafe, Bohol. He is married with a 10-month-old child. He has a Sari-sari store where he sell noodles, egg, canned goods, toiletries, and seasoning. He is also engaged in fishing. Bonifacio needs additional capital to buy merchandise such as coffee, canned goods, noodles, bath soap, shampoo,  and sugar.

He hopes that he will be able to expand his business with the help of the loan. In the future, he plans to send his child to school.

loans.use: to buy coffee, canned goods, noodles, bath soap, shampoo, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyne's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, du nom de Jocelyne, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de renforcer le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Jocelyne âgée de 33 ans, a très peu fréquenté l’école mais a appris la coiffure. Activité qu'elle exerce depuis cinq ans à son domicile et par la technique de distribution. Jocelyne est mariée à un certain Rock. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jocelyne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges de ménage sont assurées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Jocelyne vend également des produits de coiffure et des mèches. Jocelyne s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de satisfaire la demande de leur clientèle, Jocelyne ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, by the name of Jocelyne, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. With the goal of strengthening the level of their business in order to better meet the demands of their clientele, this group is asking for the financial support of ALIDé for the first time. Jocelyne, 33 years old, barely went to school but she learned hairstyling, a business which she has run for five years from her home and by delivery. Jocelyne is married to one Rock. The couple has three children, all in school and in their care. Jocelyne lives together with her husband and their children. The household expenses are taken care of by the couple. In order to do this, Jocelyne sells both hairstyling products and hair extensions. Jocelyne stocks up in the market of Benin. With the goal of strengthening their business and meeting their customers' demand, Jocelyne together with the other members of the group is asking for her first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, hairstyling products and jewelry.

loans.name: Luis Americo

texts.es:
Luis Américo tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Pucará, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando arroz, café, maíz, frutales y comercio de los mismos y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio como chofer en una empresa de la zona por más de 10 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para tramites de renovación de Licencia de conducir y de esta manera seguir brindando el servicio generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Américo is 40 years old. He lives with his wife in the district of Pucará. It is a community characterized by its warm climate. Its people work in ranching and agriculture, cultivating and selling rice, coffee, corn, and fruits. Pucará is located two hours from the city of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region, in the north of Peru.

Luis Américo has offered his services as a chauffeur in an area business for more than 10 years. He has requested a loan of 500 Nuevos Soles for the steps to renew his driver's license. This way, he can continue offering the service and generating income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for the steps to renew his driver's license.

loans.name: Mergeline

texts.en:
Mergeline is 46 years old and widowed with three children.

Mergeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, bread, etc.

Mergeline has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from buy and sell vegetables and food vending.

Mergeline aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Daisy has been in this business for 8 years. Daisy earns additional income from raising pigs.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en: Kishwar is 37 years old. She lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a mason by profession. He has been constructing buildings and houses for many years. He is very expert in his art. He has been constructing a lot of beautiful buildings in his career. He uses tools such as a brick trowel, a buttering trowel, a pointing trowel, a hammer, a chisel, a jointer, a chisel and a level, which have been wearing out. He wants to buy new tools and a grinder machine to continue his construction work but he does not have cash in hand. Therefore, Kishwar requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband could buy tools and a grinder machine for construction.

loans.use: to buy a grinder machine and tools for masonry work.

loans.name: Haltar

texts.en:
Mr. Haltar is 44 years old and lives with his wife and 4 children in a Ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Zavhan province of Mongolia. His older son is enrolled in university and 2 other children attend the local high school. The youngest son goes to kindergarten. 

He used to be a herder living in countryside but recently moved to the province center to get closer to his children's schools. He started his business in 2009 by making traditional shoes and clothes at home with his wife. He is planning to expand his business in the future. He has purchased a second-hand Russian truck and also runs a transportation service business during summers. 

He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase materials and other inventory to meet clients' orders before Lunar New year.

loans.use: to purchase materials and other inventory to meet clients' orders before the Lunar New year.

loans.name: Edralin

texts.en: Edralin, age 44, is married and blessed with one child. He has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost ten years and is earning a net income of 200 PHP daily. His daily profits are usually spent on school allowance for their daughter. He would like to request a loan from these generous lenders amounting to 9,000 PHP to purchase beverages, canned goods, and rice grains to sell at his store. He's hoping that his loan request will be granted so that his business will become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, canned goods, and rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Amour B Group

texts.fr: Le Client Mulongesha est un brave commerçant, d’une expérience de 8 ans président et membre d’une Association d’Affaires «Amour B», entrepreneur dynamique, âgé de 40 ans et père de 8 enfants, tous étudient. Le client est vendeur de divers habits (Tissu et pagne) et sociétaire d’un magasin. Il installe ses marchandises dans une avenue mouvementée de la ville. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 100 pièces de tissu. Il démarra ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu de ses parents. Dans l’avenir, Il souhaite accroitre son capital et être grossiste, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux hommes et femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment post conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Our client Mulongesha is a hard-working  vendor with eight years of experience. He is the leader a of the "Amour B" business group he belongs to. He is an energetic entrepreneur, 40 years old, and the father of eight children, all of whom are in school. He sells various outfits (a variety of fabric, including traditional West African "pagnes" ) and is the co-owner of a warehouse. He displays his wares along a lively city street. He is seeking a loan from Hekima to expand his business. [He] will buy 100 sets of fabric. He launched his business with the funds received from his parents. In the future he would like to grow his capital, become a wholesaler and provide for the education, clothing and food of his children. [He] thanks Hekima for its help in  granting loans to male and female entrepreneurs who do not have access to traditional banking, especially at this time following an armed conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 100 sets of fabric.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Laura Raquel

texts.es:
Laura tiene 58 años de edad estado civil casada, vive con su esposo y sus hijos de 19, 23, 9 años. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama ASOCIACIÓN MONTUBIOS VENTANILLA NORTE se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Ventanilla Norte, perteneciente al cantón ventanas, se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Laura se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquímicos Briones y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado a fomentar mi economía. Su sueño es tener una vivienda digna para vivir.
Le gusta viajar con su familia.
texts.en:
Laura is 58 years old. She is married and lives with her spouse and their children. Their children are 19, 23, and 9 years old. Laura lives in the Ventanas canton in the province of los Ríos. The solidarity group ASOCIACIÓN MONTUBIOS VENTANILLA NORTE is located in Recinto Ventanilla Norte, belonging to the Ventanas canton. The people work in agriculture and livestock. 

Laura works in agriculture, harvesting corn and rice. She buys her products in Ventanas in Agroquímicos Briones and sells them in the market there. 
Laura is requesting this loan to buy manure, urea, liquid fertilizers to grow corn and rice. The loan will help her to improve economically. Laura’s dream is to have a decent home to live in. She likes to travel with her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en: Agustin is faithful man. He always keeps in his mind that he is nothing without God. He shares that he has difficulties in financial matters but he is doing his best in his daily activity. Agustin runs a rice farming business in his village. He has four children, three are working as soldiers while his only daughter and his grandchild are living with him. Agustin needs to work hard and to meet their needs. Due to financial constraints, he would like to request a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for the labor cost in his farming business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for the labor cost in farming.

loans.name: Glenmar

texts.en: Glenmar is aged 32. He is a simple farmer with a happy family. He has been planting rice crops in his rice fields for almost ten years and earned PHP 10,000 to PHP 15,000 every cropping. He wants to increase his rice production to meet his children’s daily needs. He is now asking for a loan amount of  PHP 20,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides and to pay for the cost of labor. Hopefully his fields will yield better crops and he can save for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides and to pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Mariatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes, qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Mariatou âgée de 42 ans est divorcée avec deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Mariatou a un peu fréquenté l'école. Mariatou vit seule avec ses enfants. Les différentes charges du ménage sont supportées par Mariatou. Il y a près de dix huit ans Mariatou vend tissus et des foulards par la technique de distribution, ce qui lui permet de répondre aux besoins de ses enfants. Mariatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Mariatou ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en: This group is made up of three people, who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Mariatou, aged 42 years old, is divorced with two children, both in school and in her care. Mariatou barely attended school. Mariatou lives alone with her children. The different household expenses are borne by Mariatou. For nearly 18 years, Mariatou has sold cloths and headscarves by delivery, which allows her to respond to the needs of her children. Mariatou stocks up in the market of Benin. In the quest of satisfying her clientele, Mariatou, together with the other members of her group, is asking for her first loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to better respond to their customers' demand.

loans.use: to purchase cloths and headscarves.

loans.name: Juliette's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe,  nommée Juliette, âgée de 36 ans (celle dont la main est levée sur la photo) a très peu fréquenté l'école. Juliette est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de François. Le couple à quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Juliette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont assurées par le couple. Juliette a très peu fréquenté. Il y a près de cinq ans Juliette du pédicure manucure dans sa région,  ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Juliette désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Juliette ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe, sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group is made of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Juliette, aged 36 years old (the one with her hand raised in the photo) barely went to school. Juliette is married to a mechanic by the name of François. The couple has four children, all in school and in their care. Juliette lives together with her husband and their children. The different household expenses are taken care of by the couple. For about five years, Juliette has been doing manicures and pedicures in the region, which allows her to meet the needs of her family without great difficulty. With the concern of better responding to the demands of her clientele, Juliette wishes to strengthen her business. In order to do this, Juliette, together with the other members of the group, is asking for a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish and fake nails.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es un hombre de 59 años de edad, él realizo sus estudios de educación básica hasta el 6º grado, el motivo por el cual no continuo sus estudios fue, porque en aquella época su familia pasaba por una seria crisis económica motivo por el cual opto por trabajar la agricultura y ganadería con su padre, el cual dedico toda su vida a dicha actividad. Con el tiempo fue adquiriendo experiencia y fue independizandose de sus padres de manera tal que sintió la necesidad de formar su propio hogar y fue donde conoció a la que ahora es su esposa y se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar, es padre de 5 hijos  de los cuales lo primeros dos ya son independientes y ya tienen sus propios hogares.

Isabel trabaja la agricultura y ganadería, también se dedica a prestar servicio con una picadora de forrare para ganado, en la cual lo contratan para procesar residuos de de maíz, de caña y de sacate que luego es convertido en alimento para el ganado. El aprendió esta prestación de servicio de su papá, porque él trabajaba de la misma forma. Actualmente, se dedica a la misma prestación de servicio motivado por las ganancias y por el apoyo laboral que le dan sus hijos, ya que es una buena fuente de ingresos para el sostén de su familia.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  una nueva maquina picadora, ya que la que actualmente tiene ya se encuentra en malas condiciones por el desgaste ocasionado por el trabajo que se realiza frecuentemente. Ademas, otra parte del dinero sera utilizado para dar el mantenimiento preventivo y correctivo del motor, de esta manera dará un mejor servicio a las personas que le contraten para dicha actividad.

Los metas que el señor Isabel tiene para un futuro, son las de poder adquirir una maquina para fabricar concentrado para ganado y otros y apoyar a sus últimos 3 hijos hasta que puedan completar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Isabel is fifty-nine years old. He completed the sixth grade. The reason why he didn't continue his education is because his family was going through a serious financial crisis during that time. This was also the reason why he choose to work in agriculture and animal husbandry with his father, who dedicated his entire life to these activities. He steadily gained experience and started to take care of himself over time in such a way that he felt it was necessary to start his own home. That was where he met the woman who is now is wife; she manages the household. Isabel is the father of five children; his two oldest children are now independent and have their own homes.

Isabel works in agriculture and animal husbandry. He also offers services with his chaff cutter; people hire him to process crop residues, such as corn, sugarcane, and straw, into animal feed. He learned this trade from his father who worked in the same way. Currently, he offers this service because of the earnings and the support that his children give him since it's a good source of income to support his family.

The loan that is he applying for is to buy a new chaff cutter; the one that he currently has is in poor condition due to the wear caused by its frequent use. In addition, another portion of the loan will be used to provide preventive and corrective maintenance for the motor. In this manner, he will be able to provide a better service to those who hire him.

Isabel's future goals are to acquire machinery to make concentrated animal feed and support his youngest three children until they could graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy a new chaff cutter.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is 36 years old and a farmer who is very eager to overcome his poor living conditions. His main objective nowadays is to increase his yield this next crop season to sustain his family's needs. In addition, to make his farming business a viable source of income and realize his dream, he is requesting additional capital of PHP 12,000 to buy pesticides and fertilizers to care for his farm. He hopes that with these farm inputs, he can grow plenty of crops to improve their living situation.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Dashmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dashmaa is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their traditional nomadic yurt in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her husband Gerelt-Od runs a microbusiness in town. Her two children are age under six. Her older son has enrolled in primary school this year and her daughter attends local kindergarten.

Dashmaa has been working as hairdresser for last 10 years in town and has already established her good name among the clients. She is a talented and hardworking lady who dreams about opening her own hair and beauty salon in the future. She is now requesting loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase shampoo, spray, and other materials and tools to continue her business and please her clients.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, spray, and tools to continue her business

loans.name: Olamvy

texts.en: Olamvy is a wonderful woman. She is married and has some children. One of her children is not an adult. Olamvy is a business woman who sells oil. She sells her goods in a local market. Olamvy has been busy with this business more than 5 years. Olamvy’s husband helps her with managing the business. She wants to increase working capital and develop her business. She is asking for a loan of 10000 TJS to buy oil. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy oil to sell

loans.name: Ramatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Ramatou (celle dont la main est levée sur la photo)est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à un cuisinier du nom de Donatien.
