Le couple à trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. C'est pour cette raison que Ramatou vend de la nourriture (riz et pâte de maïs accompagnés de sauce) à son domicile depuis quinze ans. Ramatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin.  Cette activité lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté, à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Ramatou et les autres membres de son groupe, sollicitent pour une première fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: This group is made up of three people, of which the members reside in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Ramatou (the one with her hand raised in the photo), is 45 years old and married to a cook by the name of Donatien. The couple has three children, of which some are in school and all are in their care. The couple lives together with their children. The various family expenses are borne by the couple. It is for this reason that Ramatou has sold food (rice and corn meal accompanied by sauce) from her home for fifteen years. Ramatou stocks up in the market of Benin. This business permits her to support her needs and those of her children without great difficulty. Ramatou and the other members of the group are asking for the financial support of ALIDé for the first time, in order to strengthen their working capital and to better respond to the demands of their clientele.

loans.use: to purchase rice, corn, vegetable oil, and wood coal.

loans.name: Nafissa's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Nafissa (celle dont la main est levée sur la photo)est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Bachirou. Le couple a sept enfants, dont certains scolarisés et quatre à leur charge. Nafissa a très peu fréquenté l'école. Nafissa vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par Nafissa et son mari. C'est pour cette raison que Nafissa vend divers produits ( boîtes de conserves, des savons, des pâtes alimentaires) à son domicile et par la méthode de distribution depuis huit ans. Nafissa s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. En vue de répondre favorablement à la demande de leur clientèle, Nafissa ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, sollicite pour la première fois l’appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Nafissa (the one with her hand raised in the photo), is 41 years old and is married to a driver by the name of Bachirou. The couple has seven children, of which some are in school and four are in their care. Nafissa barely attended school. Nafissa lives together with her husband and their children. The diverse expenses of the family are borne by Nafissa and her husband. It is for this reason that Nafissa has sold various products (cans of preserves, soaps, and pastas to eat) from her home and by delivery for eight years. Nafissa stocks up in the market of Benin. In order to respond favorably to the demand of their clientele, Nafissa, together with the members of her group, is asking for the financial support of ALIDé for the first time.

loans.use: to purchase various products (cans of preserves, soaps, and pastas to eat).

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single lady of thirty who has two children, Mary sells animal feed, does dairy farming, and sells agro-vet products. She has been in this business for four years now, and she gets monthly income of 12,000 KES.

This will be Mary's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy animal feed to sell, as well as one dairy cow. In future, she wants to educate her children and raise her their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and one cow.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 30 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more snack foods, sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries to sell. 

Emily has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns income from selling pre-paid mobile load.

Emily aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods, sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en: Rubelyn helps her husband earn an income by operating a service-based business while he works as a backhoe operator. She has been providing transportation and motorcycle rental services in their village for eight years. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to repair her motorcycle. She used a portion of her income from the business to improve their farm, which is their main source of income. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Tseesuren

texts.en:
Mrs.Tseesuren is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband Togoldor is 44 and runs a small auto repair and car wash business on their plot of land. Her two children attend local schools. 

Tseesuren and her husband started their car wash service business on their plot of land in 2004. They have been improving the service over the years. They have expanded their business operations with tire repair with an XacBank loan in 2013. Tseesuren and her husband have been pleased with their clients over the years and now need 1,500,000 MNT to replace their old car wash equipment to continue providing their business to earn a living. Tseesuren and her husband are very hardworking people who are raising their children to be hardworking and good people.

loans.use: to replace their old car wash equipment

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en: Miraluna has been working on her farm to make a living. Aside from producing crops, she sells the harvest in the market in town and she earns well from this. She has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, which she used for fertilizer for the farm. To offer more farm products in town, she had to buy more root crops and other vegetable to sell. She took another loan from GDMPC micro credit to finance her business. Miraluna hopes to generate more income in order to pursue her plan of repairing the family house, which will allow the family to experience better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more root crops for sale

loans.name: Jacqueline's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Jacqueline (celle dont la main est levée sur la photo) est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un certain Valérien. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jacqueline a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau primaire. Jacqueline vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par Jacqueline. Pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et à ses propres besoins, Jacqueline vend depuis sept ans des fruits, des plastiques et divers produits dans sa région. Jacqueline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de répondre favorablement à la demande de leur clientèle, Jacqueline ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, sollicite pour la première fois l’appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Jacqueline (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is 31 years old and is married to a certain Valérien. The couple has four children, all in school and in their care. Jacqueline went to school until primary school. Jacqueline lives alone with her children. The various expenses of the family are borne by Jacqueline. To be able to support her own needs and the needs of her children, Jacqueline has sold fruits, plastic bags and various products for seven years in her region. Jacqueline stocks up in the market of Benin. In the goal of responding favorable to the demands of her clientele, Jacqueline, together with the members of her group, is asking for the financial support of ALIDé for the first time.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bags, fruits and various products.

loans.name: Suna

texts.en:
Suna is a 28-year-old differently abled man living in Odisha, a state in Eastern India. For the past five years, he has been running a bicycle repair shop in the center of town and uses the income to support his wife and only child. It is the only shop of its kind in the area and the five surrounding villages all depend on him for their bicycle repair needs. 

A disease Suna had early in his life left his left leg crippled, which makes it more difficult for him to work, so his father and brother still pitch in to help with family expenses. They all live together in a house not far from the shop.

Now Suna wants to further develop his shop so that he can better support his family to become more independent, especially as his father ages. Specifically, he wants to buy the latest tools, tires, tubes and other cycle parts. However, his disability has made it difficult for him to qualify for traditional financing, even though his business is in very good condition for its size. He is thrilled to have found out about People’s Forum and Kiva and is excited to be asking for a 20,000 INR loan for this expansion.

loans.use: To purchase the latest tools, tires, tubes and other cycle parts

loans.name: Farid

texts.en:
Farid is 27 years old and is from the village of Khakhalajvari. He is single and lives with his mother, two brothers, and sister-in-law. The family earns a living with agricultural business and cultivates the plot of land where potatoes and beans are grown. Farid sells his harvest among local retailers. Moreover, he breeds one milk cow and two sheep. On grazing season, when his cow is milked well, Farid’s mother makes cheese for selling as well as family consumption.
In order to generate more income and improve the standard of living for his family, Farid is requesting a startup loan. With the amount, he plans to buy a car and start working as a driver. Specifically, he will carry passengers from his district to Baku (the capital city of Azerbaijan). Farid is Azerbaijani and his district is mainly settled with people of the same nationality, so the demand of his service will be high in the region. 
Farid will earn a good income and ensure better living conditions for his family members.

loans.use: to buy a car and carry passengers from his district to a neighboring country.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 45 años de edad, casada, tiene 6 hijos: tres hombres y tres mujeres; actualmente vive junto a su familia en  la Aldea San Jorge, Sololá
Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de bisutería (artículos elaborados con mostacilla) lo cual vende tanto en el mercado de su comunidad como a los turistas que visitan los lugares cercanos a su comunidad (Panajachel); esta actividad la aprendió desde muy pequeña ayudando a sus amigas a elaborar los artículos que hoy en día vende. A través de esta actividad que es muy demandada y con buenos precios ella obtiene los ingresos que necesita para cubrir  los gastos personales y familiares. Tiene 24 años realizando esta actividad.
Ella quiere mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia por lo cual está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda.
María sueña con tener una casa completa y de buena calidad para que su familia tenga un lugar digno para vivir.
texts.en: Maria is 45 years old, married, and has 6 children: 3 men and 3 women; she currently lives with her family in the village of San Jorge, Solola. She works making and selling costume jewelry (items made with beads) that she sells in her community market as well as to tourists that visit areas close to her community (Panajachel); she learned how to do this when she was very young and was helping her friends to make the items that she now sells. Through this activity, that is in high demand and has good prices, she earns the money that she needs to cover personal and family expenses. She has been doing this for 24 years. She wants to improve her family's quality of life and that is why she is asking for a loan of 3,000 GTQ for the purchase of construction materials to make improvements on her home. Maria dreams of having a home that is complete and high-quality so that her family has a decent place to live.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for making improvements on her home.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo has been cultivating his farmland for 30 years. At his age of 59, he aims to have plentiful yields so he can improve his living conditions and educate his children. With his commitment and determination to keep his farming business productive, Danilo is seeking a loan of PHP 10,000. This loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Having these farm inputs are very important in performing farming activities. He hopes to get the said amount of loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Dechingavaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dechingavaa is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a small house in the Tolgoit area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Batsuh works at a local company but his work is seasonal and he is now staying at home. Her two children attend the local public school. 
Mrs. Dechingavaa has been running a butcher shop at a rental stall of the local market for the last five years. She has a lot of experience and knowledge on running a butcher shop. As a result, she has her own regular customers. She is planning to purchase a secondhand car for her husband to run a taxi service business during the winters when it is his off-work season. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of meat products to resell at her stall when it is the high season of the year because the Lunar New year is coming.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of meat products to resell at her stall when it's the high season of Lunar New Year.

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es:
ALCIRA es una joven de 18 años, hija mayor de cuatro hermanos  en su familia que por motivos económicos dejo sus sueños de realizar estudios  superiores ya que recientemente salió de la secundaria y tuvo que trabajar junto a uno de sus familiares como ayudante en un taller de costura, con el crédito ella comprara un kiosko cerca de la universidad de la población de  Warisata donde ella vive,ubicada a una distancia de tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz, y podrá vender entre otras cosas hot dogs hamburguesas y otras comidas rápidas, y así poder ayudar a su familia que se mantiene gracias a la producción de leche.


El sueño de Alcira es tener su capital propio y tener un negocio donde pueda tener ingresos suficientes para mantenerse económicamente.
texts.en:
Alcira is a young woman who is 18 years of age and the oldest of four siblings in her family. Due to financial reasons, she had to abandon her dream of pursuing higher education. She recently left high school in order to work with one of her relatives as an assistant at a sewing workshop.

With this loan, she plans to buy a kiosk near the university in the town of Warisata where she lives. This community is located three hours away from the city of La Paz. Alcira will be able to sell other things such as hot dogs, hamburgers, and other types of fast food. She also helps to support her family by producing milk.

Alcira dreams of having her own capital and having a business where she can earn sufficient income to support herself financially.

loans.use: to buy a kiosk where she can sell food.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marialyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load.  Marialyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, etc for her general store business.

Marialyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods, and noodles

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 29-year-old lady married to David and a mother of two children who are five years old and six months old, respectively. She has operated a general shop in Narok town for the last three years, making a monthly income of approximately KES 15,000. 

Faith learned about VisionFund Kenya from her colleagues in business. She has applied for her third loan after successfully paying back the previous loans. She will use the funds to purchase cereals to sell. She plans to use the anticipated profit to expand her business. 

Faith's hope is to grow her venture to a highly profitable one and attain financial stability.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Wenifreda

texts.en:
Wenifreda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 
She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like wood, paints, and bamboo for the maintenance of her fishing business.
Wenifreda has been in this business for 13 years. Wenifreda earns more income from raising pigs.
Wenifreda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like wood, paints, and bamboo for the maintenance of her fishing business.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 34-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan; she has a daughter.
Her husband owns a flower shop in which he sells flowers of various kinds, including roses, rose petals, garlands, and buque. His main profession is to decorate the cars for marriage ceremonies, making garlands and buque. The flower-selling business is not a profitable business, and their family can hardly fulfill their needs. Now Christmas is about to come, but he does not have a sufficient stock of flowers to cope with the rapid increase in demand. 
Therefore, Bushra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more roses in bulk to make garlands and buque.
Bushra hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in the business and in their lives. Now she will be able to have more savings. Bushra has praises for the cooperation of Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy roses in bulk.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Kinondo, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast and borders Tanzania to the south. Inconsistent rainfall makes farming difficult and contributes to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food from the wild mangrove forest and local passion fruit plantations. Beekeeping is relatively new to the area, but many farmers are very interested in owning hives.

John is married and has two children. His wife is a teacher while he undertakes farming. He has been farming for six years and he is currently growing pawpaws on his farm. John is excited about beekeeping because it will earn him income and it requires little input.

This is John’s first loan with Honey Care. He is interested in working with Honey Care because they have very good training. John intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to repair his vehicle. John’s hope for the future is to expand his beekeeping project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: Lola de 37 años de edad, está casada con Daniel y tienen 02 hijos menores con quienes vive en su casa propia. Lola se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción, accesorios, entre  otros, para esto tiene un espacio acondicionado en su hogar, se dedica  a ésta actividad desde hace 04 años  el cual inició con su esposo, tiempo en el cual le ha valido para hacerse conocida, siendo su tienda una de las más concurridas de la localidad, ésta actividad lo realiza con la ayuda de su esposo. Trabaja todo el día y sus ganancias al final del día son muy alentadoras. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que su trabajo le permite sustentar los gastos que se genera en su hogar, le ha permitido  pagar los estudios de sus hijos los cuales son su principal inspiración de seguir trabajando para darles una mejor calidad de vida, además le gusta porque no trabaja con productos perecibles lo que le permite almacenarlo sin ningún problema. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.3000, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometida una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado  comprará mercadería para su tienda de ferretería principalmente comprará tubos de conexión para agua y desagüe y además complementará su negocio con la compra madera ya que sus clientes le exigen este producto.
texts.en: Lola is 37 years old, married to Daniel and they have two minor children who live in their home.  Lola sells building materials from an area set up in her home and she has been doing this for four years.  She started this business with her husband and has used the time to become well known.  Her store is one of the most visited in the area.  She does this with her husband’s help and works every day.  Her income at the end of the day is encouraging.  What she likes about her work is that it allows her to pay her household expenses and for her children’s educations.  Her children are her main motivation for working because she wants to provide them with a better quality of life.  She also likes that fact that she doesn’t work with perishable items so she can store items with no problems.  She is asking for a loan of S/ 3000 and is grateful to those who make it possible for her to continue with her goals.  She is also very committed to making her payments on time.  She will use the money to buy merchandise, mainly hardware, for her store.  She will buy water and sewage pipes, and lumber since her customers have requested it.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Chingis

texts.en:
Mr. Chingis is 27 years old and lives with his wife and a son in a small house in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife Munhzul stays at home herding their 10 cattle to produce organic dairy products while taking care of their newborn baby Dolgoon. 
Mr. Chingis has been running an animal pelt and other raw materials retail business in the local market since 2009. He purchases products from local residents and herders and sells to manufacturers in bulk. Mr. Chingis and his wife are very hardworking, caring and thoughtful people who take care of their family and newborn son. He is now requesting loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of animal pelts and other products at bulk for a lower price. Lunar New year is coming so households in Mongolia prepare a lot of meat-based food to host a Lunar New Year celebration for extended family and friends. As a result, the demand for animal pelts and other products increases this time of year.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of animal pelts and other products for a lower price.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Saret lives in a rural village of the Bakan district, Pursat province, which is well-known for rice producing and rice trading. Many farmers in the area grow different kinds of rice, cassavas, beans and other seasonal crops.  As other farmers in the area, Saret works in the agricultural business farming rice twice a year. Having been in this business for years, Saret is able to make a daily income of 6 USD per day. 

This will be Saret’s sixth loan cycle, and he plans to use it to build a household latrine at the back of his house. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Saret is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of his family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine at the back of his house.

loans.name: Enhee

texts.en:
Mr. Enhee is 47 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in their Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife, Horloo, has been running their family business of a butcher shop at a rental counter of the local market. His older two sons have married and live apart from them; his older two daughters are university students, and the youngest daughter is a local secondary school student. 

Enhee and his wife have been running the butcher shop business for more than a decade now and have a lot of experience and a network in the business. They have been running their business successfully and supporting their children with their education and families. Enhee is a hardworking, thoughtful and caring man who is now requesting a loan of 8,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase a large amount of meat products and organic dairy products to sell to local residents during the high season for the products.

loans.use: to purchase meat products and organic dairy products to sell to local residents

loans.name: Marlefe

texts.en: While working in a private company, Marlefe earns more income from her retail store in her village. She has been in her business for more than a year, and she successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. Currently, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. Hopefully, she wants to improve her business and save a portion of her profit for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenebat is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife, Munhtuya, helps him run their family business of a small cafeteria in a rented place. His older two children are graduated from university and live apart; his younger two sons attend university and secondary school, respectively. 

Erdenebat has started a Ger cafeteria close to the local market and has expanded its operation to now also sell groceries at the Ger cafeteria. He is a hardworking, optimistic and welcoming man who is planning on building a small workplace with help of his two older sons next summer to stabilize their business operations. 

He is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase a large amount of grocery products and inventory to continue running the business. Erdenebat supports their children's education and his family from his business profit.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of grocery products and inventory to continue running the business

loans.name: Juan Edilberto

texts.es:
Juan, necesita capital para invertir en la compra de un soldador de autógena, con lo que continuara equipando su negocio de manera que se le facilitara brindar una buena atención a sus clientes en su taller.
El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de herramientas para su negocio, sus ingresos aumentaron, tiene nuevos clientes, su economía es más estable y su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Juan needs capital to buy solder so he can continue to stock his business and can provide good customer service in his workshop.

He used the previous loan to buy tools for his business.  His income increased, he has new customers, his finances are more stable, and has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy solder.

loans.name: Dorali

texts.es:
Dorali, solicita un nuevo crédito para adquirir materiales con los que continuara elaborando sus diferentes productos de loza, comprara nacazcol, arcilla, barro y loza cruda.
Con el crédito anterior surtió de materia prima su negocio, lo que le ayudo para aumentar su producción, mejorar la calidad del producto así como también su economía con la que ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual y el estilo de vida familiar es mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Dorali is asking for a new loan to buy supplies so she can continue making her china products.  She will buy nacazcol, clay, and raw china.

She used the previous loan to buy supplies for her business and this helped her increase her production, improve the quality of her products, as well as her finances.  She has paid her debt on time and her lifestyle is much better.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Maria Nubia

texts.es: Doña Maria Nubia es originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración de piñatas y al negocio de una pequeña pulpería. Se siente agradecida con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que con el crédito anterior logro iniciar el negocio de su  pulpería. Solicita el nuevo crédito para comprar una vitrina y productos escolares. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener mejores ingresos y lograra sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Maria Nubia is from Managua and makes and sells piñatas.  She also has a small store.  She is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito because the previous loan helped her start her store.  She is asking for a new loan to buy a display case and school supplies.  She estimates that this loan will be very helpful and she will be able to increase her income and get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy a display case and school supplies.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is now 41 and a mother of three. Her poultry business is doing well. She has successfully paid back her previous loan. She has managed to put up a beauty salon with the proceeds from the poultry business. She has been advanced a third loan of KES 60,000, which will assist her in buying salon assets and accessories. She hopes that by diversification, the business this will raise more capital for expansion.

loans.use: to purchase beauty salon assests and accessories

loans.name: Ndèye Aissatou

texts.fr:
Madame Ndèye Aissatou, une dame de la soixantaine, a longtemps démarré son activité de commerce. C’est en 1988, quand elle était encore active au bureau qu’elle alliait le commerce avec son travail ; en cette période, elle vendait des draps de lit, des serviettes, des tissus… Elle a initié ses filles dans cette lancée et a même transféré son activité à l’une d’elle.Sur la photo, on voit encore un petit stock restant des tissus qu'elle vendait. Avec le crédit qu’elle sollicite, elle veut diversifier son activité en achetant des chaises en plastique pour les louer mais aussi de la vaisselle, des bâches en grosso modo, tout ce qui va dans les cérémonies.
Elle n’a plus de charges car ses enfants qui ont commencé à travailler ont pris la relève pour les dépenses de la maison.
Si elle a les moyens, elle créera un Groupement d'Intéret Economique(GIE)qui se spécialisera dans les organisations de cérémonies : baptêmes, mariages, réceptions, funérailles…
texts.en: Ms. Ndèye Aissatou, a woman in her sixties, has run her business for a long time. It was in 1988, when she was still working at the office, that she united her business with her work. During this period, she was selling bed clothes, napkins and clothes. She started off her daughters in the field and even transferred her business to one of them. In the photo, one can still see a small remaining stock of cloths that she was selling. With the loan that she is asking for, she wants to diversify her business by buying plastic chairs to rent them out, as well as dishes, tarps, and more or less all that goes into ceremonies. She has no more expenses because her children, who started to work, took over the expenses of the house. If she has the means, she will create an Economic Interest Group (EIG) which will specialize in the organization of ceremonies: baptisms, marriages, receptions, funerals.

loans.use: to purchase plastic chairs, dishes, and tarps to rent.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo, invertir en la compra de chivos para criarlos y engordarlos, de esta forma fortalecerá su negocio y continuara recibiendo los ingresos q necesita para cumplir con sus compromisos familiares.
Con el capital anterior pudo aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su economía con la que cancelo sus cuotas y da a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Wilfredo will invest in the purchase of young goats to raise and fatten. This will help to strengthen his business so that he can continue generating the income he needs to fulfill his family commitments.

With the capital from the previous loan, he was able to increase his sales. By improving his financial standing, Wilfredo was able to pay off his debts and provide a better lifestyle for his family.

loans.use: to buy young goats.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 51 years old and married with five children.

Lydia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, noodles, shampoo, soap, cooking-oil and other groceries.

Lydia has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Lydia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan lives in Kinondo, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.
Jonathan is single and has no children. He is a farmer. He has been farming for five years, and he is currently growing pineapples on his farm. Jonathan is looking forward to beekeeping as the bees offer security for pineapples from thieves.
This is Jonathan’s first loan with Honey Care. He is interested in working with Honey Care because they are prompt in their response to emergencies. Jonathan intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy rabbit stock. Jonathan’s hope for the future is to establish a commercial apiary.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is an agriculturalist in a predominantly cattle-keeping rural area in the western district of Uganda. He has been in the cattle business for seven years. He wants to stock cattle to sell during the Christmas season, but has the challenge of limited capital. He was however relieved when he heard about the low interest UGAFODE agricultural loan. He will now be able to buy the cows and make enough profit to take him through the festive season and then pay for his children's tuition early next year. He is hard working.

loans.use: To buy cattle that he will fatten and sell

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman lives in Makongeni, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees.

Suleiman is married and has two children. His wife is a housewife. Both he and his wife have been farming for 15 years and they currently have a tree plantation on their farm. Suleiman is looking forward to beekeeping as it will earn extra income for him.

This is Suleiman’s first loan with Honey Care. He is interested in working with Honey Care because they are very professional in their service. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy fishing equipment. Suleiman’s hope for the future is to establish a commercial apiary.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Kinondo, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.

Grace is married and has two children. Her husband is a hotelier while she undertakes farming. They have been farming for six years and they are currently growing pineapples on their farm. Grace is excited about beekeeping because of the benefits of pollination.

This is Grace’s first loan with Honey Care. She is interested in working with Honey Care because of its very good training. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to build a family house. Grace’s hope for the future is to establish a commercial apiary.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en:
Savorn, age 40, is married and has two children. She lives with her husband and her youngest child in her own home located in Ba Phnum district, Prey Veng, while her oldest daughter temporarily accommodates in Phnom Penh because of her work. To make a living, Savorn has owned and managed a retail store in her village for almost 10 years and earns a net income of $5.00 USD daily.

As it is her first loan, Savorn aims to invest in the purchase of solar home system to install on the top roof of her house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province. After this initial investment, Savorn will be able to gain access to clean energy, which she will use to support household appliances such as lights, TV and radio, so everyone in her family can even work or study at night. She is very thankful and is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a home solar system to install on the top roof of her house.

loans.name: Erdenesoyol

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenesoyol is 30 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in a Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife, Hurelmaa, works at a local gas station and recently went back to work from her maternity leave. His three daughters are aged under 5; the older two go to a local kindergarten, and the youngest baby daughter stays home during the daytime with her grandmother. 

Erdenesoyol has been providing taxi services as a business in town for last five years and is now well-known among his clients with his reliable and safe service. His car needs some spare parts changed in order to work properly with less consumption of gas. He is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase spare parts and get them installed in his car to continue his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and get them installed in his car to continue his business

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn, aged 30, is married and blessed with three children. She has had a vegetable vending business for almost one year and earns a net income of 250 PHP daily. Her profits are usually spent on school allowances for two of her children. 

Due to a lack of capital in her business, Emelyn would like to take out a loan amounting to 9,000 PHP from generous lenders to purchase bananas, bitter gourds, legumes, and string beans to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow so that she can be able to earn more income from it.

loans.use: To purchase bananas, bitter gourds, legumes, and string beans to sell.

loans.name: Viktoria

texts.en:
Viktoria is a freshman in an international and business law program. This is her story:

My name is Viktoria and I am from Osh, Kyrgyzstan. The most important thing for me is to be an active member of society. At home I worked for the Youth Organization of Osh, fundraising and organizing charity events. I loved the work because it made me feel like part of the community, and the energy I got from working with other people was amazing. Since then I have wanted to help people and constantly feel that I am making a difference for them. 

The other great influence in my life is my high school history teacher. She taught me a lot about the Kyrgyz people and their culture, which helped me to understand my community work in a different way. She also taught us about the history of our land and the relationship of the people with the land. This is why I want to study law, because law is an extension of those rules that come from the people and the land where they live. 

AUCA is the best university, where I can get a top notch education and where I will be able to gain all the necessary knowledge and skills and put them into practice. There are also a lot of opportunities to study in a foreign university, which is also a dream of mine, because I want to learn about other communities and people.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella desea seguir participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negocio, ella continua con la elaboración de panes y sigue participando en el banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca”, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar como por ejemplo  harina, manteca, mantequilla  y otras cosas.
texts.en: Elsa thanks the lenders for the [previous] loan and she is pleased with the support it gave her. She would like to continue participating in this project because it allows her to increase her working capital. She feels motivated to continue working on her business. Elsa is still baking bread and participating in the communal bank "Virgen de Chanca". She requires this loan to purchase, among other things, items such as flour, butter and lard.

loans.use: to buy, among other ingredients, flour, lard and butter.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: Don Marcos tiene 48 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Granada. Casado y padre de dos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y transportista, se dedica al negocio de pulpería y servicio de carga. Inicio en este negocio, como cultivador agrícola, de las ganancias obtenidas de las cosechas compro una camioneta para dar servicio de acarreo. Luego, con las ganancias obtenidas del acarreo iba comprando productos para su pulpería. Hoy en día cuenta con dos negocios que le han generado buenos ingresos. Su meta es seguir creciendo con el negocio. Solicita el crédito para ajustar en la compra de su camioneta para el negocio, y así transportar los productos para su pulpería. Estima que el crédito podrá asegurarse la transportación de su mercadería, y así cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Su plan futuro es mejorar las condiciones de su local.
texts.en:
Marcos is 48 years old and comes from the city of Granada. He is married and is the father of two children. His business is in sales and transportation. He has a small neighborhood store and provides cargo transportation services. He was a farmer, and initiated this business with the earnings he made from his harvests. He purchased a truck to provide hauling services. Then, with the earnings he made from hauling he began purchasing products for his market. Today he has the two businesses which have earned him good income.

His goal is to increase growing the business. He requests a loan to settle the outstanding balance on his business truck. In this way he will be able to continue transporting products for his store. He says that the credit will secure the transportation of merchandise to his store, which will allow him to meet the demand of his customers. His plans for the future are to improve the conditions of his store.

loans.use: to pay off the loan on a truck he uses to stock his business.

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en: Phorn is a young mother of little kids residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. For the sake of her family, she does rice cropping as the main source of income and raises pigs to supplement her income. She has been involved in these businesses for five years. Having never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, Phorn teamed up in a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire portion to pay for reaping fees. She hopes that she can gain a good yield and get a good income to continue her replanting season.

loans.use: To pay reaping fees

loans.name: Galbadrah

texts.en:
Galbadrah is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife, Dolgorsuren, stays home, taking care of the family while making traditional leather boots by order. His older son is 7 and a public primary school student; his younger son is 3 and goes to a local kindergarten. 

Galbadrah works at a local wood factory during the summer and at a local company as a fireman during the winter. He also helps his wife to manufacture leather boots at home during his off-duty time. He is a very hardworking, modest and caring man who is now requesting a loan of 450,000 MNT to purchase timber planks to fix the fences around the ger to improve his family's living conditions and safety.

loans.use: to purchase timber planks to fix the fences around his ger to improve living conditions and safety

loans.name: Buena Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal  Buena Esperanza está conformada por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Leon lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser responsable, trabajadores, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Yamileth y tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdos en pie, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y por encargo. Ella dedica a su negocio unas  8 horas diarias. el objetivo del credito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de un lote de cerdos en pie. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto por que ha sido la forma de vida de ella y de su familia. La asociación comunal agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Buena Esperanza" (Good Hope) consists of nine members, eight women and one man. They are responsible parents who have 15 dependent children among them. The members are originally from Leon, a place located in the western part of the country. They are known for being responsible, hardworking, and having the drive to succeed on a personal level. In their free time, they enjoy being with their children. Unfortunately, they were not able to finish any type of degree because they had to work at an early age.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to move forward, the group coordinator Yamileth has a business of raising and selling live pigs. She manages her business from her home. Yamileth spends about eight hours a day operating her business. The purpose of her loan is to invest it as operating capital so that she can restock her business by purchasing a drove of live pigs. Yamileth takes great pride in her business because it allows her to earn a living for herself and her family.

The Communal Bank is grateful to the Kiva lenders for providing assistance to people who have limited resources and come from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they are able to make a decent living.

loans.use: to buy live pigs that she can raise and sell.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase new fishing net for her fishing business.

Liezel has been in this business for six years. Liezel earns more income from raising pigs.

Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing net

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is 35 years old and married with three children who all attend school. He operates a general merchandise mobile shop, which he operates on various market days in Rukungiri District. The major challenges he is facing are weather and competition since there are many people who deal in the same business. He applied for 3,000,000 Shillings from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) with the purpose of completing his residential house that is under construction.

Benon decided to apply for a loan so he does not have to affect his business by withdrawing money from it to finish his house. He hopes that with the available funds, he is going to have his business running smoothly and finish his house at the same time.

loans.use: To complete construction of his house

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es:
Eliza, de 38 años de edad, está divorciada, pero vive con su hijo de 11 años de edad en la casa sus padres junto a sus hermanos. El trabajo que realiza Eliza, es la compra y venta de diversos artículos de uso del hogar y artículos personales como ropas y zapatos para damas y caballeros de diversos modelos y tallas. Los productos que mayor preferencia tienen entre sus clientes son aquellos que se usan en la cocina como ollas, utensilios de mesa, sartenes, baldes entre otros. También ofrece accesorios para los niños de la casa como juguetes didácticos que contribuyen al desarrollo de su inteligencia. Ha instalado su negocio en al casa de su padre. Trabaja en este rubro desde hace 09 años, antes trabajaba sola pero ahora lo hace con ayuda de su madre. Su horario de atención es desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Se siente contenta  ya que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones y gracias a su trabajo a salido de muchos apuros económicos, tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y poder ampliar su negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.2500 soles y agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir aumentando su negocio.
Con el monto solicitado comprará bandejas, baldes y artículos de cocina, entre otros para continuar vendiendo en su negocio para ésta temporada.
texts.en:
Eliza, 38, is divorced and lives with her 11-year-old son in her parents’ house together with her brothers.  

She buys and sells a range of household goods, along with men’s and women’s clothes and shoes of different sizes and models.  Her most successful items are those that are for use in the kitchen, such as saucepans, cutlery, frying pans, buckets and others.  She also sells things for children like learning games which can help their development.  

She has had this business, which she now operates from her father's home, for nine years.  She used to work alone but now her mother helps her.  She serves customers from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m.  She is happy with her work because it brings her a lot of satisfaction and has helped her improve her financial situation.  

She wants to continue and improve her business.  She is asking for a loan of 2500 nuevos soles and is grateful to those who help her with this loan to keep developing her business.  With the requested amount, she will buy trays, buckets and other kitchen utensils, among others to keep her business stocked this season.

loans.use: to buy trays, buckets and kitchen utensils for her business.

loans.name: Wilson Evangelista

texts.es:
Wilson tiene 51 años de edad estado civil Casado vive con la esposa y con sus hijo de 18, 14 y 8 años, Vive en el  Cantón Mocache provincia de los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama Juntos Triunfaremos se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jhon F. Kennedy 2, perteneciente al cantón Mocache cerca de Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Wilson se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del Cantón Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar una casa.
Le gusta trabajar y caminar.
texts.en:
Wilson, 51, lives with his wife and 3 children, aged 18, 14 and 8.  He lives in Mocache Canton in the province of Los Rios.

The communal bank is called ‘Juntos Triunfaremos’ and is located at number 2, John F Kennedy precinct, in the Mocache area near Ventanas.  They dedicate themselves to agriculture and livestock.

Wilson has been sowing rice and corn for several years.  He buys his products in Ventanas and then he sells them in the market in Mocache Canton.
He is asking for a loan to buy compost, urea, and liquid fertilizers to sow rice and corn.  The loan will help him to increase his income to help his family and to be able to invest.  

His dream is to buy a house.  He likes working and walking.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to sow corn.

loans.name: Meerim

texts.en:
Meerim is a freshman in the Journalism and Mass Communications program and this is her story:

My name is Meerim. I study in the Journalism program at AUCA. I am creative, communicative, and like to write short stories. My hobby is taking pictures and I am always interested in what is happening in the world around me. I always walk around with a camera, and never miss an opportunity to observe life through my lens.

There is no doubt that journalism is a field that is changing at an incredible pace. AUCA is a great place for me to learn, because it has all of the latest technology, so students can decide if they want to be very modern, or if they want to use more classic technology like film. There are also great professors that have a lot of practical experience, and work in the field.

One of the difficulties in achieving my goals is that my family cannot afford to send me to AUCA. I help by selling products in the market in my spare time, but it is not enough to pay for all of my tuition. The Kiva loan will ensure that I will be able to stay in school and get my education.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Ganbaatar is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife helps him run their family business of organic dairy products production and sales. His three children, all aged under seven, go to a local primary school and kindergarten respectively.

Ganbaatar started his family business of organic dairy products sales and production in 2008 with his wife. He also purchases large amounts of organic dairy products from other herders and stores them until winter, close to Lunar New Year, when the price goes up to the highest and he resells to local residents. He is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products from herders and sell to local residents at his stall. He is a hardworking, modest and friendly man.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products from herders and sell to local residents at his stall

loans.name: Yellow Group

texts.en:
Mariam is in her late twenties and married with three children in school.  She has been a food vendor for four years now.  She works from 5 a.m. to midnight daily, sells chips late at night, and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Mariam's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy a fair stock of food and has paid back her loan successfully.  She is happy with the loan.  She used the profit to pay school fees, buy a dressing table and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy a good stock of food to sell to more people and to buy a sack of Irish potatoes and cooking oil.  She dreams of opening a big food cafe.

Mariam will share this loan with the other member of her loan group, Yellow. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a good stock of food, including Irish potatoes and cooking oil to sell to more people

loans.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en: Bolor-Erdene, 21 years old, lives with her husband in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2011. Using her previous loan, she has purchased furniture such as a sofa and closet. Now she is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 MNT to buy a vacuum cleaner and washing machine. This will greatly increase the comfort of living in the ger. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who dreams about studying at a university and building her own house.

loans.use: to buy a vacuum cleaner and washing machine

loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en:
Gansuh is 36 years old and lives with his wife and son in their ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife Uuganbayar has just started a clothes retail business in a rental stall at the local market. His son Osohbayar is three and goes to a local kindergarten.

Gansuh works as an inter province part-time driver at a transportation service company. He also helps his wife to run their family business of clothes retail during his off-duty time. His wife used to work as a saleswoman and has experience in the business. Gansuh is now requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to pay his rental fee for six months to ensure his business stability. The Gansuhs are a hardworking and happy family.

loans.use: to pay his rental fee for six months to ensure his business stability

loans.name: Fe Ruina

texts.en:
To make a living, Fe Ruina operates a general store and also provides entertainment like video-k in their village. She has been engaged in this business for many years and she earns a good living. 

Fe Ruina had successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC, which she used in the business. She took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to expand her business using the profit she earns from this loan and to be able to send her children to school and finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 62 años de edad, está casada y tiene 04 hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad, vive en compañía de su esposo, 02 hijos y un nieto en su casa propia. Isabel se decica a la  venta de ropas y calzados para damas, caballeros  y niños, de diversas marcas y modelos que están a la moda, los cuales trae según el gusto y el pedido que su cliente, afortunadamente tiene buena acogida por su público y no ha tenido problemas al realizar la cobranza ya que su clientela son básicamente personas que trabajan en instituciones privadas y reconoce fácilmente a aquellos que demuestran responsabilidad. Todos los productos que venden son de reconocidas marcas de calidad a nivel mundial y eso le permite obtener buenas ganancias por cada venta. Lleva realizando este trabajo  por casi 05 años, trabaja sola y con mucha alegría. Se siente contenta  ya que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones, tiene las ganas de seguir trabajando y mejorar su negocio estableciendo poco a poco una tienda en su propia casa.
En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.2500, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometida a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado comprará ropa y calzados de varones y mujeres.
texts.en:
Isabel, 62, is married with 4 children who are now all adults.  She lives with her husband, two of their children and one grandchild in their own house.

Isabel sells shoes and clothes for men, women and children.  She offers a wide range of different labels and fashionable designs.  She selects clothes according to her taste and to customer demand.  She is lucky to have a good customer base and never has any problem chasing up payments.  This is because her customers work in private companies and easily understand those who appreciate responsibility.  

All her clothes are well-known labels and this means that she can make a good profit on each sale.  She has been doing this job for almost five years.  She works alone, but enjoys it this way.  She is very happy because this business has brought her a lot of satisfaction and she wants to carry on working to improve her business by gradually setting up a shop in her own home.

She is asking for a loan of 2500 nuevos soles and she is very grateful to those who can help her so that she can keep fulfilling her dreams.  She also is very committed to paying the loan off on time.  With the requested amount, she will buy clothes and shoes for men and women.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La señora Martha, es una humilde trabajadora que se desempeña como conserje en un colegio público, es soltera actualmente tiene a su cargo a su hija menor. Martha solicita el crédito para instalación de puertas y mejorar el piso de los cuartos, así ir mejorando el entorno de su vivienda.
texts.en: Martha is a hard-working and humble woman who works as a caretaker at a local school.  She is single and has a young daughter who depends on her.  Martha is asking for a loan to put in doors and improve the floor where the bedrooms are.  In this way, she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two wooden doors, sand, cement and tiles.

loans.name: Rahat

texts.en:
Rahat is 39 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children.

Rahat owns a beauty parlor; she is an expert in makeover services. Most of her clients belong to the neighborhood and her clients appreciate her services a lot. With the passage of time her beauty products have been diminishing and this time she wants to buy more beauty products for her beauty salon. 
Therefore, Rahat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she would be able to buy beauty products for makeover services such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion etc.

Rahat wants to establish a parlor in the main market in town to enhance her income in the future. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for makeover services.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 26-year-old married man. He has one 1-year-old child whom he supports. 

He was introduced to Kadet Ltd. by a Kadet officer. He has had a stationery shop in Timboni for one-and-a-half years. In his business, he earns a monthly income of 7,250 KES. He is taking his first loan of 15,000 KES which he intends to use to add stock to his business by buying ink, printing papers, and books. Patrick will use the anticipated profit to expand his business by making it a wholesale shop. 

His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to open another business and to educate his child.

loans.use: to buy ink, printing papers, and books to sell.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Alcides tiene36 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos y esposa en el Caserío Piedra Grande, del distrito de Pomahuaca, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El cuenta con un taller propio de carpintería, ubicado en su propio domicilio, donde se dedica a la fabricación de puertas, ventanas, sillas, mesas, cuenta con clientela considerable por el buen trabajo que realiza, también se dedican a la agricultura cultivando pan llevar como son maíz, yuca para su consumo.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de materia prima de su trabajo, adornos y maderas y de esta manera atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alcides is 36 years old, and he lives with his children and his wife in Caserío Piedra Grande, in the Pomahuaca district. His village works in farming, trade and livestock, situated two hours from the city of Jaén, which is part of the Cajamarca Region, in the northern highlands of Peru.

He has his own carpentry business, situated in his own home, where he works making doors, windows, chairs, and tables. He has many customers, due to the good work that he does. They also farm, growing staple food crops such as corn and yucca, which they eat.

He is asking for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy raw materials for his work, such as ornaments and wood, and thus serve his customers.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his work, such as wood and metal ornaments.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Leoncio es un señor de 42 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales  5 hombres son hombres  y 2 mujeres, vive junto a ellos en Caserío Monte Mercedes, Sololá.
El es agricultor, dedicado al cultivo de  papa, cebolla, maíz y frijol. Esta labor la realiza en la comunidad donde vive; a través de  esta actividad obtiene ingresos aceptables que le ayudan al sostenimiento de su familia. Lleva más de 25 años realizando esta labor con la ayuda de sus hijos más jóvenes quienes lo apoyan en todo el trabajo que requieren estos cultivos.
El quiere mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia por lo cual está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,500.00 para compra de piso cerámico 
Su sueño más grande es contar con una casa completa y de buena calidad para que sus hijos tengan un lugar digno para vivir.
texts.en:
Leoncio, 42, has five sons and two daughters.  He lives with them in Caserio Monte Mercedes, Solola. 

He is a farmer and he grows potatoes, onions, corn and beans.  He does this work in his own community and earns enough money to support his family.  He has been working this way for more than 25 years, and his younger sons help him whenever necessary.

He wants to improve the standard of living of his family and therefore he is asking for a loan of 5,500 quetzals to buy floor tiles.

His ultimate dream is to have a finished, good quality house so that his children have a dignified place to live in.

loans.use: to buy floor tiles.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria Antonieta agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella desea seguir participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negocio ella continua con la venta de cosméticos y participando con el banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca”. 

Maria Antonieta en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para continuar comprando mercadería como por ejemplo perfumes, colonias, aretes, cremas, pinta labios y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Maria Antonieta would like to thank the investors for the loan and is happy for the support she has received so far. She wishes to continue participating in this project, because it helps her to increase her business capital, and she also feels motivated to continue working in her business. She continues to sell cosmetics and participates with the community bank "Virgen de Chanca" (Chanca Virgin).

This time Maria Antonieta needs a loan to continue to buy merchandise such as perfume, cologne, earrings, creams, lipsticks and various other items.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics such as perfumes, colognes, earrings, creams, lipsticks etc...

loans.name: Miriam Cristina

texts.es: Miriam es una mujer emprendedora de 47 años, soltera, con dos hijos, su negocio es derivado del maíz como pinol, pinolillo, tamales rellenos, desde hace 10 años, lleva 9 ciclos obteniendo crédito en la institución. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de maíz, canela, clavo de olor, leña, maíz, cacao, dulce, azúcar, molida.
texts.en:
Miriam, 47, is an enterprising woman. She is single and has two children. She makes corn-based food, such as pinol [used for breading], pinolillo [a traditional drink in Nicaragua] and filled tamales. She has had this business for ten years and this is her ninth cycle with the institution.

Miriam is requesting a loan to buy corn, cinnamon, cloves, firewood, cocoa, sweetener and grind sugar.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as corn, cloves, cocoa, sugar and firewood.

loans.name: Ermalyn

texts.en:
Ermalyn is proud to say that she started her business because of ASKI. She sells small meals and snack food such as fish balls, hotdogs, and cold juice from an ambulant cart. 

She is married to a rice farmer and has two children. Ermalyn's husband manages their rice field and also drives their ambulant cart. She requests a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fish balls, hotdogs, and  ingredients to make sauces for her business. 

Ermalyn wishes to have another business as an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy fish balls, hotdogs, and ingredients to make sauces for her business.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus padres en el distrito de Zaña una comunidad que se encuentra cerca al valle del río Jequetepeque, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, su población también se dedica al comercio y ganadería a una hora con veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica al comercio de artículos de primera necesidad, su esposo brinda servicios musicales en una conocida orquesta local son una familia unida, Raquel ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ropa y regalos para su negocio y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes, generándole ingresos para contribuir con su familia.
texts.en:
Rachel is 31 years old and lives together with her husband and her parents in the district of Zaña. This is a community that is near the Jequetepeque river valley, which has allowed it to develop through agriculture, with its population also involved in trade and livestock. It is one hour and twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, in northern Peru.
Rachel has a business selling essential day-to-day items. Her husband provides music services as part of a well-known local orchestra. They are a close family. Raquel has requested a loan of 1000 Nuevos Soles in order to buy clothes and gifts for her business, in order to offer them to her customers, generating income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and gifts for her business.

loans.name: Twizigire Group

texts.fr:
Apollinaire fait partie du groupe  Twizigire  et habite à  Gitega. C’est une veuve de   35 ans.  

Il  fait le commerce de banane et de chevres depuis 10 ans. 

Il  est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter   une grande quantité de bananes et beaucoup de chèvres  à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.
texts.en:
Apollinaire, age 35, is a widow who lives in Gitega. She's a member of Twizigire Group.

For the past ten years, she's been selling bananas and goats. She's seeking her third loan from Kiva's partner, Turame.

She will use her Kiva loan to bolster her working capital and buy a large quantity of bananas and lots of goats to resell, in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy bananas and goats

loans.name: Cresenciano

texts.es:
Cresenciano tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el Caserío Chaupe una zona rural del distrito de Querocotillo, es una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Cutervo que se encuentra en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando maíz desde hace 15 años, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solcitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para su cultivo de maíz y pago de mano de obra para el mantenimiento del mismo y de esta manera tener una buena producción para ofrece a sus clientes, lo que le generara mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Cresenciano is 49 years old and lives with his wife in Caserío Chaupe, a rural village in the district of Querocotillo. It is a community that is involved in agriculture, commerce and livestock, located around two hours from the city of Cutervo, which is found in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He has worked in agriculture, growing corn, for the past 15 years. He has a substantial clientele and is requesting a loan of 2000 Nuevos Soles through our field partner Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy fertilizer to help grow his corn crop and to pay for labour for crop maintenance. This will help him to have a good crop yield to offer to his clients, which will generate greater income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to help grow his corn crop and to pay for labour for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude lives in Kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.

Getrude is married and has four children. Her husband is a teacher and she farms. They have farmed for twelve years. Getrude is excited about beekeeping for additional income and also because it will be a source of honey for medicinal use.

This is Getrude’s first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to expand her farming projects. Getrude’s hope for the future is to educate her children and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita is 29 years old and has one child. She lives in a rural community and buys and sells used TV sets and VCD players. She aims to make her business viable in order to increase her income and meet daily needs. Having inadequate capital, she asks for a loan of 13,000.00 PHP to buy additional  TV sets and VCD players to sell. She is patient and is determined to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional TV sets and VCD players to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe  BENKADI de l’association  MIIRIYA sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans et 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles à   OUAYERMA I, un des quartiers de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de commerce. 
Elles sont à leur première  prêt avec l’institution et sont à leur début de collaboration.
Les spéculations à vendre sont les  pagnes wax, farines, condiments etc.  Mme   AMINATA 1ère  personne à gauche de la photo compte acheter avec son prêt des pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et effectue ses ventes au comptant en détail et à crédit à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000 francs CFA par mois.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkadi subgroup of Miiriya are married women with an average age of 35 years and an average of 4 children each. They all live in traditional extended families in Ouayerma I, one of the neighborhoods of the third administrative region of Mali. The women are partnering with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better run their businesses.

The women are on their first loan with the organization and at the beginning of their partnership. They sell wax "pagne" (the traditional colorful cloth of western Africa), flour, spices, etc. 

Aminata, the first woman pictured on the far left of the photo, plans to use her loan to purchase wax "pagne" cloth. She stocks up in the area and makes her retail sales for cash and credit to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA. This will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Choeun's Group

texts.en:
Choeun is 48 years old and a citizen from Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She is a mother of nine children and supports four children that are either too young for school or are in school. For the sake of her dependent children, she grows rice and works for others to earn a decent income. She has had this business for a long time. 

Choeun is a third-time borrower and her joint fellow group member is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully repaid her previous loans which has enabled her to improve her living conditions and keep her children in school. 

As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the harvesting fee. She believes that the yield will double that of previous times and  she can earn a good income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay the harvesting fee.

loans.name: Deolinda

texts.en:
Deolinda is 40 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living as a coconut farmer in the Philippines. Deolinda wishes to borrow 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy coconut seedlings and other farming supplies.

Deolinda has grown coconut for 5 years and also earns additional income from growing vegetables.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut seedlings and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Disterio

texts.en:
Disterio lives in Kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rate.

Disterio is married and has twenty one children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have farmed for twenty seven years and currently grow sugar cane, maize, rice and sweet potatoes. Disterio is excited about beekeeping because it easy to manage.
