Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Eunice is married and has six children. Her husband works as a clerk at Kenya Seed Company, while Eunice farms full-time. She has a very diversified farm, and is currently growing maize, beans, avocados, and vegetables, as well as undertaking large-scale chicken  and livestock rearing. She is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper as it will be a good supplement to her income. 

This is Eunice's first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the income from her beehives to educate all of her children and retire comfortably.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives close to Kinondo, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees.

Peter is married, and has three children. He works as a taxi driver, while his wife farms their land, where she is currently growing pineapples. Peter is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper, as it will give him a source of honey for domestic use. 

This is Peter’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated by his hives to repair his taxi, which is currently in need of maintenance. His hope for the future is to buy another taxi that he can rent out, thus expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a married man with four children. He lives in a rural area and practices agriculture to earn income to meet the needs of his family and dependents. He is a hardworking man whose business is at times constrained by limited income and low turnover because of the rural setting. He would like a loan to buy cattle that he will fatten and later sell to earn increased profit. He hopes to have a big farm in the future.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Butterfly Group

texts.en:
Being married at an early age without attaining higher education taught Nengkhohat how the fittest survives in this world. She is raising six kids by selling vegetables while her husband is also a cultivator.  She is the featured borrower member for Butterfly Group and she is pictured with her hand raised. The group is comprised of five women members residing in a village which is about 62 kms from the main capital town of Imphal. 

Nengkhohat sells vegetables in the town market. She sells cabbages, cauliflowers, potatoes, bay leaves, beans, yams, chillies, coriander leaves, etc. She usually sells vegetables on the roadside because she also travels to other parts of the district to supply and sell vegetables. She is well-known for her punctuality and sincerity in the business among her circle of friends and colleagues. The generated income is small in amount and she finds it difficult to manage the family expenses. Her husband's income is irregular and undependable because it entirely depends on the work available. 

With the Kiva loan, Nengkhohat will purchase more vegetables to sell. She shares that if one buys them in large quantity, it is cheaper and it gives more opportunity to generate better profit. Her dream is to let her kids go to good schools and become successful persons. She does not want her kids to continue what she is doing as she says, it is unreliable and irregular income, moreover it takes a hard toil to be a vegetable seller.

The rest of the group members are all engaged in the vegetable-selling business.

loans.use: To purchase more winter vegetables and supply them in the nearby markets, generating income and savings to help her husband in constructing their house.

loans.name: Nora Yamilee

texts.es: Nora Yamile mayor de edad ,casada y madre de una niña que cursa la secundaria . Nora es propietaria de una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitación donde ofrece productos comestibles como: granos básicos,productos congelados ,medicina,dulces,jabones,detergente entre otros productos de consumo.También ofrece mercadería en general de ropa,zapatos y cosméticos.Este negocio lo tiene desde hace mas de 15 años y ha venido creciendo junto a clientes, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de otra localidad o distribuidoras de la zona, su jornada  diaria inicia desde muy temprano abriendo las puertas de su negocio para sus clientes, el objetivo de este crédito es para la compra de productos de consumo como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, detergentes entre otros al igual que mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa, cosméticos para cubrir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Nora Yamile agradece el apoyo que los intervencionistas kiva le han brindado para ir poco a poco mejorando su calidad de vida .
texts.en: Nora Yamile is married and is a mother to one daughter who is currently in secondary school. Nora owns a grocery store located in her home, where she sells consumable goods such as basic grains, frozen goods, medicines, sweets, soaps, detergent and more. She also sells general merchandise such as clothes, shoes and cosmetics. Nora has had this business for over 15 years and it has grown along with her number of clients. Nora buys on credit from the markets in other towns and area's distribution centres. Nora's day starts very early when she opens the doors for business. This loan will be used to buy consumable goods such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, detergent and more, as well as general merchandise, such as various styles of clothes and cosmetics to fulfil customer orders. Nora is grateful to Kiva investors who are helping her to improve her quality of life little by little.

loans.use: to buy and sell consumable goods and merchandise, such as basic grains, clothes, shoes, drinks and lots more.

loans.name: Tomasa Requilda

texts.es:
Tomasa Requilda tiene 63 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores en la parte posterior a su domicilio, Tomasa realiza esta actividad desde que se caso para apoyar con los gastos familiares, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y una segunda parte para arreglar su dormitorio y de esta manera tener un lugar agradable para descansar.
texts.en:
Tomasa Requilda is 63 years old and lives with her husband in the district of Oyotún, situated two hours from the city of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The locals work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

Tomasa Requilda makes a living raising small animals in the area behind her home. She has been doing this since she got married in order to help out with the family living costs. 

She has asked for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to buy balanced feed for fattening the animals and a second portion of the loan to make improvements to her bedroom so that she has a nice place where she can rest.

loans.use: to buy balance feed to fatten up the animals and to make improvements to her bedroom.

loans.name: Maknuna

texts.ru: Макнуна жизнерадостная женщина. Она пережила много тягости в жизни, несмотря на то что она еще молодая. Муж Макнуны бросил ее с маленьким ребенком и женился на другой. Она после развода вернулась в родительский дом со своим маленьким ребенком. Макнуна работает в государственной организации. Она хочет развевать свою карьеру и получать больше зарплаты. Однако для этого ей необходимо получить высшее образование, так как у нее средне-специальное образование. С такой целью Макнуна поступила в университет. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Maknuna is a cheerful woman.  Despite her young age, she has lived through many hard times.  Her husband left her and her new baby for another woman.  After the divorce, she returned to her parent's home with her baby.  Maknuna works in a government office.  She wants to improve her career and earn a higher income.  However, she needs to receive more education to achieve this goal because she only has a specialized secondary education.  With this goal in mind, Maknuna enrolled in university.  She is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to pay for her tuition.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her education

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 48 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

She has borrowed and paid back 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice and selling dried coconut meat. Leonida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc

loans.name: Kisima

texts.en:
Kisima is a forty-one-year-old lady, married, and supports a family of seven children between the ages of six and sixteen. She sells charcoal to earn a living for her family. Kisima has been in the charcoal business for the last ten years with an approximate monthly income KES 18,000.

She learned about KADET LTD from other women in the market. She has been advanced a first loan of KES 20,000 which she will use to buy charcoal for resale at a profit. 

Kisima will use the proceeds to start farming on her idle piece of land. She hopes to improve the living standards of her family by putting up a permanent house for them.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Napong

texts.en:
Napong, 60 years old, is married to Moses and the mother of six. For the last ten years, she has traded charcoal to earn a living, with a monthly income of KES 18,000. Napong learned about KADET LTD from some other women in the market. 

Napong has been issued with a first loan of KES 30,000, which she will  use to buy additional sacks of charcoal for resale. She will use the increased proceeds to repay the loan and to provide for the family's basic needs. Her dream is to see her children live healthy lives.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Zhenya

texts.en:
Zhenya is a hairdresser and lives in Armavir town with her family (her parents, brother, sister-in-law and nephew). Zhenya has been providing hairdressing and cosmetology services to locals from her house. Due to her kind and hard work with the clients, she has gained a good number of loyal clients.

The income that Zhenya gathers from providing this service is very important for covering her family's basic needs. Realizing the importance of the quality of service that she provides and the need of improving her space, Zhenya would like to ask for a loan. The loan will assist her in purchasing a hairdressing chair, hairdryer and mirror that she needs for her work. This will be a great improvement for her and her clients, and Zhenya will be able to provide better quality service.

Zhenya has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a salon chair, hairdryer and mirror for providing hairdressing service.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives outside of Magodi, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and borders Tanzania to the south. Inconsistent rainfalls make farming difficult and contribute to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food, from wild mangrove forests to the local passion fruit plantations. Beekeeping is relatively new to the area but many farmers are very interested in owning hives. 

Peter is married and has no children. He and his wife have been farming for fifteen years and are currently growing sweet potatoes and raising livestock on their land. Peter is excited to start beekeeping because it will give him another source of income for farm investments: he plans to use the proceeds from his hives to help construct a house for his animals. 

Peter's hope for the future is to build an irrigation system on his farm, enabling him to improve his crop yields.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Ishmael

texts.en:
Ishmael lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Ishmael is married and has eight children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for about five years now and they are currently growing maize, beans and local vegetables. Ishmael is excited about beekeeping because it will earn him extra income and it is an enterprise that is not labor intensive.

This is Ishmael’s first loan with Honey Care Africa. He intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. Ishmael’s hope for the future is to be able to successfully educate his children.

loans.use: To buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 37 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Noemi is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Noemi has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling nipa (woven palm frond) roofing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sanan

texts.en:
Sanan, 21 years old, lives in the Marneuli district with his wife and two infant children. Sanan’s wife earns a monthly income by selling cosmetics door-to-door among her community members. Sanan’s economic activity is his newly started tea-house in a rented commercial space. 

As his earnings are not enough to cover utilities and food costs, Sanan has decided to diversify the business and remodel his tea-house into a café, where doner and khinkali (Georgian traditional food) will be sold. Doner (kebab/sandwich/gyro) has become a very popular fast food dish in the last several years in Georgia. According to Sanan’s estimation, sales will be high. 

Sanan is requesting a loan to buy all the needed equipment such as a doner machine, oven, etc. He will also buy raw materials for making food. The income from the café will be a great support for the family as it will generate additional income. Sanan appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to start up a food cafe

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred lives in a small town close to Kitale. Kitale, located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Wilfred is married and has five children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They are currently growing maize, beans, sunflowers, bananas and vegetables, raising livestock and tending to fruit orchards on their land. Wilfred is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper, as it will provide "a source of honey which is good for my family’s health as well as an extra source of income from my farm."

This is Wilfred's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the income from the honey "to educate my children and live a better life in old age."

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Orif

texts.ru:
Ориф хороший семьянин у него 4 детей. Он жвет со своей семьей в поселке Адрасман. Он разводит и после откорма продает овец. Ориф занимается этим делом в течении 25 лет, и . Он очень усердно занимается разведением скота, потому что он хочет что бы его семья не чувствовала финансовые недостатки, хотя и денежных средств в его семьи недостаточно.
Ориф держит скот на своем дворе. Он откармливает их а когда они готовы к продаже продает их мясо местным мясникам. Люди испльзуют  баранину для изготовление традиционных блюд.
Это его второй кредит, на который он хочет приобрести скот. Он планирует продать мясо зимой в большом количестве. Ориф с оптимизмом смотрит  на получение этого кредита, потому что зимой больше людей потребляют мясо, в связи с праздниками и увеличения клиентов в ресторанах.
На полученный кредит Ориф планирует купить скот и увеличить свое стадо.
texts.en:
Orif is a good family man and he has four children.  He and his family live in the village of Adrasmon.  Orif raises sheep which he fattens and sells.  He has been in this business for 25 years and he works very hard at raising cattle because he doesn't want his family to feel any financial limitations, even though they don't have enough money.  Orif keeps his cattle at his home.  He fattens them up and when they are ready for sale, he sells their meat to local butchers.  People use lamb to prepare traditional dishes.

This will be Orif's second loan to buy cattle.  He plans to sell a large quantity of meat in the winter.  He is very optimistic about this loan because people use a lot of meat in the winter with all the holidays and increased traffic in restaurants.  Orif plans to use the loan to buy cattle and increase the size of his herd.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Oygul

texts.ru:
Ойгул является опытным фермером в селе Адрасман. Она живет со своим мужем и детьми. 
Чтобы заботиться о потребностях своей семьи , Ойгул занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота , в сельском хозяйстве, а также она с мужем  выращивают люцерны и травы , которая служит кормом для скота. Члены семьи Ойгул помогают ей  в ее ежедневных сельскохозяйственной деятельности, ее муж  и дети поочередно продают сельскохозяйственную продукцию на местном рынке .
  Ойгул и ее семья пасут свой скот на пастбищах  с другими стадами в течение лета , и к осени продают по дороже. С наступлением зимы Ойгул задумалась о необходимости приобрести пару голов скота и сделать зимний запас корма для скота. Для этого она хочет получить кредит и надеется на поддержку.
 Семья будет очень благодарна кредиторам в развитии  их бизнеса.
texts.en: Oygul is an experienced farmer in the village of Adramson.  She lives with her husband and children.  In order to provide for her family's needs, Oygul raises cattle on her farm and her husband raises lucerne and hay, which they use to feed to their cows.  All the members of the family help Oygul with her daily farm tasks and her husband sells their produce at the local market.  Oygyl and her family put their cows out to pasture in another field for the summer and sell them on at a profit in the fall.  This coming winter, she thinks it will be necessary to get another pair of cows and to make a winter's supply of food for their livestock.  To do this, Oygul needs a loan and she is hoping for support.  Her family will be very grateful for a loan to help them improve their business.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en: Emanuel has several successful years of experience operating a video production business, and he is looking to expand it by purchasing new equipment and opening a retail location. He is a repeat borrower of the Intersect Fund having paid back his previous loan in full and on time. He will use this loan to put down the security deposit on his new storefront.

loans.use: to open a retail location for his video production business.

loans.name: Roseland

texts.en: Roseland has ten years of experience as a hair stylist, and she is ready to take the next step in her career and open a salon. She hopes to run her storefront location in Sayreville, NJ, where she has already been operating. This loan will go towards the cost of the opening her salon.

loans.use: to open a hair salon.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Oyotún su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales de corral y a preparar comida para fiestas, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de animales menores patos, gallinas y compra de ollas para la preparación de comidas por temporadas de fiesta de promociones de los colegios de la zona.
texts.en:
Ana María is 35 years old. She lives with her children in Oyotún district. Locals work in agriculture, commerce and livestock. This place is located two hours away from Chiclayo, northern coast of Peru.

She works buying and selling farm animals and preparing food for parties. She has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] at Edpyme Alternativa to buy farm animals such as ducks and hens, and pots to prepare food, thinking of the graduation parties that local schools are having during this season.

loans.use: to buy farm animals and pots to prepare food.

loans.name: Lily Group

texts.en:
Hoikhonei believes in tolerance and hard work. Sustaining a family with a meager source of income is undeniably difficult for anyone but it is harder for Hoikhonei whose work site is about 5 kms away from the village. She walks there at the break of dawn to collect charcoal, comes back the same 5-km route back to the village, and boards a mini truck with her charcoal at the top of the mini truck off to the town market to sell the charcoal. She is the featured borrower member for Lily Lom and she is pictured with her hand raised.

The group is comprised of five hard-working women who all reside in a village which is about 15 kms from the town. The town is 62 kms from the capital town of Imphal. The group usually contributes an equal share and they took the land from the village chief on rent for a period of one year, so that they can cut down firewood and burn it to make charcoal. When the charcoal is ready to be sold, Hoikhonei walks every day at the break of the dawn to collect the charcoal from the charcoal-firing sites, carries the charcoal sack on her back, and walks to the village. Only occasionally does a vehicle ply that route; if one gets lucky, then one gets a ride. Otherwise, walking is the only option. From the village, Hoikhonei travels to the town market with the charcoal and sells it.
	
With the Kiva loan, Hoikhonei will contribute her share for taking the land on rent and start burning charcoal. She is sure to earn a good amount of money since charcoal is in great demand during winter season and the price is high unlike in off seasons. She says, she will also be able to pay new admissions for the kids without worrying where to get the money as she can sell her charcoal like hot cakes in this season. She thanks Kiva and says, do continue your co-operation with WSDS and make our life a happier one.  She is glad for the support and believes that this may bring success in life. She says, “Thank you, Kiva!”

The rest of the group members are also engaged in the charcoal business.

loans.use: To take a portion of land on rent, cut wood, and burn charcoal for selling to support the family and kids' education

loans.name: Weedor

texts.en:
Weedor lives in Paynesville North Area, a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketers,” traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

Weedor is married and has 4 children, aged between 7 and 20, who are currently living at home and in school. Weedor has owned her own shop selling rubber dishes such as tubs, buckets, baskets, pans, bowls, etc. for the past 8 years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more rubber dishes for her business. 

On average, Weedor works from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. at her business. She started her business with help from her mother. Weedor transports her merchandise by bus. She cites less stock as her biggest challenge. Weedor's favorite part of her business is the flow of customers. In the future, she would like to build a modern house. Weedor is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes for her business.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah lives in a small town close to Kitale, in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Monicah is married and has six children. Both she and her husband work as farmers and are currently growing maize, beans, guava and avocado and rearing livestock. Monicah is excited to become a beekeeper because it will supplement their farm income and because she also likes honey. Monicah's hope for the future is to educate her children so that they can live a better life than her.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: To make a living, Lilia operates a retail store and grows vegetables in her garden. She earns well from both her businesses and she has successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC that she used in buy goods to sell. Recently, she took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Lilia wants to build a house and help her grandchildren finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer has been farming for nine years to make a living. She earns from her farm and has successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). To improve the farm more, she took out a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase organic fertilizer. Being a member of GDMPC, she improved their quality of living. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Msingi Group

texts.fr: Kitendwa  est vice-presidente dans la banque villageoise Msingi. A 54 ans, elle est mariée à un homme d’affaire et ensemble ils ont 8 enfants qui vont tous à l’école.  Elle installe ses marchandises au marché central depuis plus de 30 ans. Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit pour acheter 3 cartons de rame de papier à 66$,  1 carton de lampe à pétrole à 50$, 10 cartons de papiers hygiéniques à 120$, 2 cartons d’ampoule à 46$ et 18$ servira de transport. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise et devenir grossiste. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir facilité la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kitendwa, age 54, is vice president of the Msingi village bank. She's married to a businessman and they have eight children together, who all go to school.

For more than 30 years, she's been selling her products at the central market. She's seeking a new loan to buy three boxes of paper ream costing $66, one box of kerosene lamps costing $50, 10 boxes of toilet paper costing $120, and two boxes of light bulbs costing $46. $18 will be used to cover transportation costs.

She hopes to expand her business and become a wholesaler. She thanks Kiva's partner, Hekima, for making it easier for her children to attend school.

loans.use: to buy paper reams, kerosene lamps, toilet paper, and light bulbs

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 34-year-old married man from Rafah city.  He lives with his wife in a very simple house in the city.  Wisam works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low salary. This is the only source of income for the family. Wisam and his wife would like to buy all the needed stuff for the home to improve the family's living conditions. 

Wisam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his home.  By taking this loan, Wisam will be able to provide clean water for his kids.

Wisam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en: To make a living, Lani operates a general store in their village. She has been selling grocery goods for five years. She earns well from her business but her stock was not enough to earn more. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to expand her business in order to gain more income for the family in future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Eustaquio

texts.en:
Eustaquio is from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. He sells a variety of items and that earns him an income of Php 20,000 a month. This is how he supports the needs of his seven children. He joined PMPC in 2011, after hearing all the benefits that the Cooperative extends to its members, especially for their financial needs and insurance. 

Eustaquio has come to PMPC for a loan of Php 30,000 to restock the inventory of his 'buy and sell' business. He hopes to repay his obligation in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to restock the inventory of his 'buy and sell' business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia is 57 years of age. Having four children with a loving husband, she lives in Biasong, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. Her husband is working at a city government office. Mrs. Virginia has been running her tailoring shop for almost 20 years. She is a hardworking mother – by running her tailoring shop she helped her two daughters graduate from college and now her daughter has a job and helps her with their daily needs.

Mrs. Virginia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) since 2009. She has had a previous loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which she used to add more material to her tailoring shop. Now Mrs. Virginia wants to expand her tailoring shop, so she took out a new loan of 20,000 PHP. To improve her living situation, Mrs. Virginia used her new loan to expand her tailoring shop. She is praticing herself to be thrifty and save more income for her future needs.

loans.use: to pay for materials for her tailoring shop expansion

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis es un campesino de 60 años de edad, casado y padre de 5 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo y mucho trabajo. Nació en una familia humilde que siempre se dedicó a realizar las labores del campo, gracias a ello obtuvo los conocimientos que hoy en día le permiten ser propietario de un cultivo de maíz que tiene en un lote arrendado en una vereda cercana a su hogar; cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado al jornal con el que trabaja de lunes a viernes y, la cosecha que recolecta es vendida en el centro de acopio del municipio donde reside.
Actualmente solicita el crédito como alternativa para seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, el dinero será invertido en la compra de abonos, riegos, pesticidas y  semillas de papa, insumos que requiere para seguir cuidando su cultivo actual y para incursionar en la siembra de papa y así diversificar su labor y abrirse camino en un nuevo mercado; así espera tener una cosecha mucho más productiva y mejorar los ingresos que percibe a la hora de vender el producto.
Luis manifiesta que su motivación es el amor que siente por sus hijos, por ello sueña con tener la posibilidad de ofrecerles una educación de calidad para que se forjen un futuro más exitoso y próspero, además desea disfrutar su vejez de manera tranquila al lado de los que ama.
texts.en:
Luis is a 60-year-old farmer.  He is married with five children who he has raised with a lot of hard work and effort.  He was born into a humble family that had always made a living working the land.  Thanks to this, he gained the knowledge that today allows him to own a corn crop on a lot close to his home.  He has the support of a day-worker who helps him out Monday to Friday.  The harvest is sold at the collection center in the city where he lives. 

He is currently requesting a loan to continue strengthening his business.  The money will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers, irrigation supplies, pesticides, and potato seeds, items that he requires in order to continue caring for his current crop and to start off planting a potato crop.  In doing this, he will diversify his work and open the path to a new market.  He hopes to have a much more productive harvest and to improve his income.

Luis says that his motivation is the love that he feels for his children.  He dreams of offering them a quality education so that they may have a more successful and prosperous future.  He also hopes to enjoy his old age in a calm manner alongside those he loves.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, irrigation supplies, pesticides, and potato seeds.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas lives and works outside of SIndo, in Homa Bay county.  Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Dorcas is married and has three children. Both her and her husband work as farmers, and are currently growing beans, maize, kale and lentils on their land, as well as rearing dairy goats, cows and poultry. Dorcas is excited to start beekeeping because the bees will help pollinate her crops. 

This is Dorcas’ first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her hives to pay school fees for her children and start sunflower farming. In the future, she hopes to save up enough money to buy additional land.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Honey Care has offered farmers in the area a chance to purchase year-old beehives that have been repaired and re-waxed, and many individuals opted to buy these cheaper hives instead of new ones.

Joseph is married and has two children. His wife works as a businesswoman, while Joseph runs a restaurant. In their time off they both farm their land, where they are currently tending to tree plantations. Joseph himself likes beekeeping because it represents a “sustainable use of forests.”

This is Joseph’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his hives to buy restaurant equipment. His dream for the future is “to establish a 3 star restaurant financed by bees.”

loans.use: to buy apiary materials and refurbished beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Mepukori

texts.en:
Mepukori is 42-years-old and married. He supports a family of fifteen members. He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last seventeen years with a monthly income of KES 15,000. Mepukori learned about KADET LTD from some other farmers in his neighborhood. 

He is servicing his sixth loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD and this will facilitate him in preparation of the farm and purchase of inputs.

He hopes to use anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His dream is to improve his families' living standards and educate his children

loans.use: to prepare land for cultivation and purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali and his wife live in Tangerang, a city located about 30 minutes from South Jakarta. Tangerang is known as one of the satellite cities of Jakarta, where many factories of various industries are located. Ali manages several businesses, such as a small stall called a "warung" that sells snacks and drinks, and a mobile phone center that sells mobile phones, mobile phones accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, mobile phone service, and bill payment service. Ali joined Ruma because he's interested in Ruma's products. 

Since he joined Ruma a month ago, Ali has made around $150 - $152 per day in sales, just from selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for his customers. As his business continues, he would like to take out a loan for working capital from Kiva in order to boost these transactions, especially on weekends when more people tend to come to his stall. He hopes that he will be able to improve his business and seek more business opportunities. In the photo, he is sitting in his stall. Ali thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Buenos Aires, cuentan con los servicios básicos en su domicilio, es una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la elaboración de adobes y ladrillo de manera artesanal, para posteriormente ofrecerlo para la construcción de viviendas, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de calaminas para mejorar su casa debido a que se aproximan las lluvias.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 40 years old, lives with his wife in the district of Buenos Aires, and they have basic services in their home.  It is in a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce, and livestock, which is located in the Morropon Province in the Piura Region on the north coast of Peru.

He earns a living making adobe and brick by hand to then offer for housing construction.  He has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy corrugated iron panels to improve his house because the rainy season is approaching.

loans.use: to buy corrugated iron panels to roof in his home.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Residing in Samrong Torng district of Kampong Speu Province, Sim is the father of four children and is in his late 40s.  Nowadays, he needs to support all of his kids as they are still in school. To cover the basic needs of his family, he works as a vet and his wife is a grocery seller.  He has been with his occupation for ages and it has returned him around 10 USD per day. He has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past three loans with a successful repayment.  The positive impact of his past loan has helped him and his family to live in proper living conditions and to keep his kids in school. For this cycle, he is applying for an education instead of a business loan as he wants to cover the school fee for his daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor degree at a local university. He hopes his daughter will get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: To cover the school fee for his daughter

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Yelitsa Katherine

texts.es:
Yelitsa Katherine tiene 19 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que pertenece a la Provincia de Morropon, ubicado en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de cerveza desde hace dos años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cerveza en mayor cantidad para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yelitsa Katherine is 19 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Buenos Aires district which belongs to the province of Morropon, in the Piura region on the north coast of Peru. The locals work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

For the last 2 years she has made a living selling beer, with her business based in her home. She has asked for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy beer in bulk to stock her business so she can generate a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy beer in bulk to stock her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a divorced woman with two school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over two years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 29 years old. She is divorced and has a child. Jamila is dedicated to her farming business, growing crops and pomegranates on her own land. In order to contribute to improving her family's living standards, she has worked hard from early morning till late evening over the past year. She lives with her parents, siblings, and her child.

 Jamila would like to develop her agricultural business, which is why she is asking for a loan in the amount of 5000 Somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for new planting season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers to develop her agricultural business

loans.name: Gazi

texts.en:
Gazi is a 52-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and kids, three sons and one daughter, in a very simple house in the city. Gazi works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low salary. This is the only source of income for the family. Gazi and his wife would like to buy all the needed things for the home to improve the family's living conditions.
 
Gazi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his home. By taking this loan, Gazi will be able to provide a clean water for his kids.

Gazi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 26-year-old single young man from Rafah city.  He lives with his family in a very simple house in the city. Mahmoud works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low salary. This is the only source of income for the family.  Mahmoud  would like to buy all the needed stuff for the home to improve the family's living conditions. 

Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his home. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to provide clean water for his family.

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home

loans.name: Dem

texts.en:
Dem is a 63-year-old widow and mother of nine children and a resident in Srey Santhor district of Kampong Cham province. Currently, two of her children still rely on her, one of whom is studying in university. 

To support the daily cost of living, she plants rice on two hectares of farmland as a main source of income. She has been in this business for ages, earning about USD 8 per day. She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, but she is taking an education loan to cover the school fee for her daughter, who wants to study in accounting. She hopes her daughter can fulfill her dream of an academic skill so that she can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's school fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Srey Santhor District

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad is a 45-year-old hardworking housewife. She is the mother of three daughters and three sons.
 
Her husband owns a vegetable business that is the only source of income for his family. He purchases a variety of fresh and seasonal vegetables from the field and sells them in the main market. 

Now he has newly hired a shop for selling vegetables. He needs to purchase vegetables for his shop. For that, his wife, Irshad, has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to buy initial stock to sell. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to increase his net income. Irshad will save the profit for future needs or medical expenses of her children.
 
Irshad prays for the success of her husband’s business. She is feeling relaxed and happy after taking the loan.

loans.use: To buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es: Primitiva agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella desea seguir participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negocio, ella continua participando en el banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” y con el negocio de venta de comestibles, ella continua con la tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio donde expende sus productos y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, aceite y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Primitiva is grateful for the lenders and for the loan.  She is very happy with the offered support.

She hopes to continue participating in this project because it has helped her to grow her business capital.  She feels motivated to continue working in her business.  She still participates in the communal bank "Virgen de Chanca" with her home-based grocery store where she sells her goods.

At this time, she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise, including sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, oil, and other products.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en: Adolat is a 56-year-old woman who is married and has three children.  Her husband is a kind man who tries to help her with all deals. He is a pensioner. Adolat began her sewing business 38 years ago because she needed the money.  She provides her services in her home. Thanks to her good services, she has managed to gain many customers.  Since she has had her business, her family’s quality of life has been improving. She wants to develop her business further but she needs to buy a new sewing machine. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for increasing working capital

loans.name: Dante

texts.en: Dante is separated with two children.  He manages his own rice farm for a living.  Aside from this, he also runs a motor transportation services business to aid his income from farming.  He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer in order to boost his farm.  He is hopeful to gain more returns from his farm and use it to improve their living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo owns and operates a business making and serving a different variety of snacks, specializing in buco delights. He has been doing this for more than five years. His income is good and was able to repay his previous loan from GDMPC successfully. 

Recently, Arturo borrowed a new loan to purchase ingredients to make buco delights. He is hopeful to gain more returns to save money for the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make buco delights

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina tiene 50 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en una zona rural del distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores pavos, patos ,cerdos y gallinas en la parte posteriro a su domicilio, su esposo brinda servicio de mano de obra calificada en la empresa azucarera de la zona, Marina ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta amnera ofrecer a sus clientes a un buen precio, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Marina is 50 years old. She lives with her husband in a rural area in the Cayalti district. Residents make a living in agriculture, commerce, and ranching. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on Perú's northern coast.

She makes a living by raising and selling small animals like turkeys, ducks, pigs, and chickens in the rear part of her home. Her husband is a skilled laborer in the area's sugar industry. 

Marina has requested a loan of 2,500 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed to fatten her animals so that she can offer her customers a good price, which will generate better profits for her family.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed to fatten animals.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
María tiene 52 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con el esposo. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama ASOCIACIÓN MONTUBIOS VENTANILLA NORTE se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Ventanilla Norte, perteneciente al cantón ventanas, se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
María  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, líquidos  fertilizantes. El préstamo le ayudado para cambiar el estilo de vida de la familia. Su sueño es tener un carro.
Le gusta compartir con su familia.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old. She is in a common-law marriage with her husband. She lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. The communal bank is called "Asociacion Montubios Ventanilla Norte" and it is located in the Ventanilla Norte precinct, which belongs to the Ventanas canton. Residents work in agriculture and livestock.

María works in agriculture and has grown corn and rice for many years. She buys products in Ventanas and sells them in the market in the same place.

She is requesting the loan to purchase manure and liquid fertilizer. The loan will help her to change her family's way of life. Her dream is to own a car. She enjoys spending time with her family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Honey Care has offered farmers in the area a chance to purchase year-old beehives that have been repaired and re-waxed, and many individuals opted to buy these cheaper hives instead of new ones.

John is married and has six children. His wife works as a hairdresser, while he engages in projects on their land. He is currently growing trees on his plot, which will be of great benefit to his bee colonies, as they will thrive off of the nectar generated by the saplings. 

This is John’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his hives to support orphans in the area.  His hope for the future is to be able to “support these children so that they have a future.”

loans.use: to buy apiary materials and refurbished beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael lives in a small town close to Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Rael is married and has three children. Her husband works as a police officer, while Rael farms their land. She is currently growing maize, beans, bananas, and potatoes, as well as rearing cattle. Rael is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper, as it will lead to increased income from her farm.

This is Rael's first loan with Honey Care, and when asked about her hopes for the future, Rael replied: "to live a fulfilling life."

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married, and has four children. He acts as village chief (a position in the municipal government) and farms while his wife focuses on the house and activities on their land. He and his wife are currently growing maize, potatoes and beans as well as tending to livestock. 

Peter lives near Cherengani, in the Kitale region. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Peter is requesting a loan from Kiva to buy beehives to produce honey. He plans to use the income from his hives to invest in projects on his land. Peter is excited to start beekeeping, as he sees it as a good business that requires little work and has high rewards. He thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur, aged 26, is a single man from the village of Algeti. He lives with his parents, sister, brother, sister-in-law and niece. Zaur earns his living through an agricultural business and makes hay for selling.  Besides this, Zaur, his brother and father are employed at the local flour mill and get a monthly salary.  

In order to improve his income, Zaur is requesting this loan for purchasing four milk cows. He will start dairy farming and the women from his household will make cheese, yogurt and various products for selling as well as family consumption. This initiative will increase his income and Zaur will be able to improve the standard of living for his family members in the future.

loans.use: to buy four milk cows and start dairy farming

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 35, is from Naivasha. He is married and has a child who is 4 years old and in kindergarten.

Peter has a clothing business that he has been running for two years, and he has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy more clothes to add to his stock.

He hopes to own a kiosk in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to add to his stock.

loans.name: Naela

texts.en:
Naela is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Naela is a 43-year-old married woman from Qalqilia city. She is a mother for four sons and one daughter. Naerla's husband is an electrician. He opened his small workshop ten years ago. It is a good business and earns a good income. 

Naela's husband would like to improve his business, so Naela took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy new tools for his work. By taking this loan, Naela's husband will be able to improve workshop productivity and also the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to  help her husband to buy new tools for his work.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
To make a living, Wilfreda operates a business venture, providing repair services in their village. She earns well from the business to provide the family and she has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. She used that loan to improve her business. 

Recently, she took a new loan to buy a new set of tires and additional spare parts. She always finds ways to augment their living. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires and additional spare parts.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: María Moncerrate

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada, y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 6 años que estudia en escuela. Su marido trabaja en una empresa privada.
Doña María  es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta ganar su propios recursos, ella con la ayuda de su esposo construyeron pequeño galpón en el cual se dedica a la cría de chanchos, empezó con muy poco y ahora tiene más de 80 chanchos, para esto ella recibe la ayuda de sus padres y hermanos a quienes les paga un sueldo, mantiene sus animalitos por un buen tiempo y cuando están listos y con peso adecuado los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa, lleva más de 6 años en este negocio con el cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los chanchos. Lleva dos años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Su sueño es darles lo mejor a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Grupo De Crédito De Colorado meets once a fortnight in Colorado, in the Montecristo canton. The area is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its handicrafts which are renowned both nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous Panama straw hats.

This is where María lives. She is 27 years old and is married. They have a 6-year-old son who goes to school. Her husband works for a private company. María is a very determined woman who likes to earn her own income. 

With the help of her husband she built a small shed where she rears pigs. She started off with very little and now has more than 80 pigs. She gets help with the pigs from her parents and siblings and pays them a salary. She keeps the young animals for a good while and when they are ready and have gained enough weight she sells them to traders who come to the house. She has had this business for more than 6 years and it enables them to get on in life. 

The loan is to buy feed and medicines for the pigs. María has been in the communal bank for 2 years and she likes it because of the support she gets from the loans. Her dream is to provide the best for her son.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for pigs.

loans.name: Elodie Teclaire

texts.fr: Elodie est une femme de 31 ans, célibataire et mère de 2 enfants.elle possède et gère une boutique de vente de boisson hygiénique dans un quartier de la ville depuis 3 ans. elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des boissons afin de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire.les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans son capital et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Elodie is a 31-year-old woman who is unmarried and the mother of two. She owns and has been running a shop selling bottled beverages in a district in the city for three years. She is requesting a loan to bolster her stock of merchandise by purchasing some beverages to satisfy her growing customer base and to increase her sales. The profits generated are going to be reinvested as capital and used to meet family needs.

loans.use: to purchase bottled beverages to sell in her shop

loans.name: Elish

texts.en:
Elish is a glasses maker. He is 56 years old, has been married for 23 years and has two children. His elder son is married and his little son studies at college. Elish’s wife is a housewife. They are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their native land, Agdam city, and now live in the Baku region. 

It's noted that Elish prepares spectacles. Today, he wants to increase his business, and for this reason Elish needs a loan amount of 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Therefore, he has applied to Komak company. With this loan, Elish wants to buy a new apparatus which will be useful in his work. He says thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for help.

loans.use: to buy a new apparatus that will be helpful for making spectacles

loans.name: Iderbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Iderbaatar is 35 years old and lives with his wife in a Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife, Otgonbayar, is 30 and helps her husband to run their family business of manufacturing traditional leather boots and shoes at home.
 
Iderbaatar started their leather shoes and boots manufacturing business at home in 2008. They have expanded their operation and productivity over the years, and last year, they started building their own house from their profit. They are planning on finishing the house next year from their business profit. 

Iderbaatar purchases leather from Ulaanbaatar and makes boots and shoes by order. He is now requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase materials and inventories to meet the orders on time.

loans.use: to purchase materials and inventories to manufacture leather shoes and boots at home

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a single lady, 33 years old.

She has been in business for six years now and her monthly income is KES 40,000.

Mercy has borrowed the loan to purchase more stock and expand the current business. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods.

loans.name: Francisco Vicente

texts.es: Francisco agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella desea seguir participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negocio, ella continúa con el negocio de crianza de pollos. Ya son tres años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien pero siempre necesita capital para comprar mercadería entonces una vecina le invitó a participar del banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más pollos.
texts.en:
Francisco is grateful to the lenders for the loan.  He feels happy with the offered support. 

He hopes to continue working with this project because it has helped him to grow his business capital and to feel motivated in working to improve his business.  He had had this business raising chickens for three years, and it is going well despite the fact that he always needs capital in order to buy supplies.  Because of this, a neighbor invited him to participate in the "Virgen de Chanca" communal bank.

At this time, he is requesting a loan to buy more chickens.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is a 38-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and four kids (two sons and two daughters) in a very simple house in the city. Amjad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low salary that is the only source of income for his family. He appears in this photo.

Amjad is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to buy a water purification machine for his home. He will use his loan to provide clean water for his family. In the future, Amjad would like to buy all the needed stuff for his home to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home

loans.name: Wajasiriamali   Grp   Mwanza Group

texts.en:
Magreth is in her mid-40s and widowed with four children who are still in school. For the past ten years, she has been selling ripe bananas. Magreth works from eight in the morning until two in the afternoon and is able to make a good monthly profit. She is the leader of a loan group called “Wajasiriamali – Mza,” that is comprised of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loan.

Magreth will use her portion of the group loan to buy bananas to sell to more people. This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to buy more bananas and she has successfully repaid her loans. Magreth used the profit from her loans to pay school fees, cover household expenses, and save in the bank. In the future, she dreams of opening her own company of selling food.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell to more people

loans.name: Yinger Marilin

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Yinger, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 14 y 8 años de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es mecánico automotriz.
Doña Yinger como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito para ella y para que su esposo lo utilice en su trabajo, él tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz en su casa lugar en el cual ella también vende ciertos repuestos como aceites, líquidos de frenos, llantas entre otras cosas, ella  les vende a los clientes que a diario asisten al taller de su esposo el cual es muy concurrido ya que su marido tiene mucha experiencia arreglando automotores, el lleva más de 17 años con el taller el cual es la forma de como él se gana la vida y el sustento de la familia.
Este crédito es para comprar llantas, aceites y repuestos. Lleva 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Su sueño es que  sus hijos  sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank Grupo De Crédito De Colorado meets once a fortnight in Colorado, in the Montecristo canton. The area is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its handicrafts which are renowned both nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous Panama straw hats.

This is where Yinger lives. She is 37 years old and is married. They have three children aged 17,14 and 8; the older ones are at college and the youngest is at primary school. Yinger's husband is a car mechanic. 

As a good wife, Yinger is taking out the loan for herself and for her husband to use in his work. He has a car repair workshop at their home where she also sells some spares such as oil, brake fluid, tyres and other items. She sells these on a daily basis to customers who visit her husband's workshop, which is very busy. He has a lot of experience repairing cars and has had the workshop for more than 17 years. This is how he earns a living and provides for the family. 

The loan is to buy tyres, oil and spares. Yinger has been in the communal bank for 8 years and she likes it because the loans help her to finance her business. Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy tyres, oil and spare parts.

loans.name: Christelle Nadine

texts.fr: Christelle est une femme de 28 ans, célibataire et mère de 4 enfant dont deux vont à l'école. elle possède et gère une boutique de vente de crédit de communication et de prestation de photocopie dans un quartier de la ville depuis 7 ans. elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock de crédit de communication et acheter une phtocopieuse afin de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. les bénéfices générés de cette opération vont lui permettre d'agrandir son bureau de photocopie en ouvrant un cybercafé d'une part et d'autre part subviendront aux besoins de sa famille (éducation, nutrition, logement, santé).
texts.en: Christelle is a 28-year-old woman who is unmarried and the mother of four, of whom two are in school. She owns and has been running a shop selling communication credits (phone minutes) and photocopy services in a district in the city for seven years. She is requesting a loan to bolster her stock of communication credits and to purchase a photocopier, so as to satisfy her growing customer base and to increase her sales. The profits generated from this operation are going to enable her to expand her photocopy office by opening a cybercafé, as well as to meet family needs (education, food, housing, healthcare).

loans.use: to purchase communication credits (phone minutes) and a photocopier

loans.name: Merha May

texts.en:
Merha May is married and operates a general store in their village to make a living. She has been in this business for five years and she earns from this.

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She needs additional stocks to offer in order to gain more profit. 

In the future, she wants to improve her business and provide her family a better living.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 70 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, es una madre que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para arreglos de los corrales donde cría a sus animales y de esta manera darle una mejor distribución que contribuirá para una mejor producción de sus animales.
texts.en:
Isabel is 70 years old and lives with her daughter in the district of Cayalti, where people make a living in agriculture, trade, and livestock.  The district is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

She makes a living raising and selling guinea pigs.  Her business is located in her home.  She is the type of mother that applies herself completely to the work that she does.  

She is requesting a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles in order to fix up the pens where she raises and breeds her animals.  In doing this, she will give them a better living space that will contribute to greater production.

loans.use: to fix up the pens where she raises her animals.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn runs a sari sari (variety) store in her community where she sells groceries to earn a living. She also cooks banana cue (deep-fried bananas) to earn additional income. 

Jocelyn is requesting a loan from GDMPC to purchase raw ingredients to cook. In the future, she wants to improve her business and provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Julia Sandra

texts.es: Doña Julia tiene 51 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Boaco. Casada y madre de tres hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida (de manera ambulante). Inicio este negocio vendiendo lácteos y rosquillas de forma ambulante a los cinco años de edad. Luego, tuvo otro negocio de pulpería; es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora, toda su vida ha sido muy dependiente, dedicada con mucho sacrificio a la comercialización. Su meta es obtener más clientes y ver crecer su negocio de comideria. Solicita el crédito para comprar: carne de res, carne de pollo, aceite, arroz, verduras; entre otro, con el fin de ofrecer diferentes platillos a sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que obtendrá mejores ventas  e incrementar sus ganancias para invertir en la compra de productos. Su plan futuro es ser una comerciante mayorista.
texts.en:
Julia, 51, is from the city of Boaco.  She's married and the mother of three adult children.

Julia's a merchant by trade and she works selling food as a street vendor.  She started this business with dairy products and "rosquillas" [ring-shaped cookie] when she was five years old. Then she had another business, a grocery store.

Julia's an enterprising and determined woman.  Her whole life she has been very dependent and, with great sacrifice, dedicated to sales.  Her goal is to acquire more customers and see her food business grow.

Julia's requesting the loan to buy beef, chicken, oil, rice, vegetables, and other ingredients so she can offer her customers a variety of dishes.  She thinks the loan will be a big help to her because she'll have better sales and increase her earnings to invest in buying products.

Her plan for the future is to be a wholesale merchant.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, oil, rice, vegetables, and other food

loans.name: Sandra Edith

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 31 años de edad estado civil Unión libre vive con el esposo  y con sus hijos de 15, 13 11 y 8 años, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama ASOCIACIÓN MONTUBIOS VENTANILLA NORTE se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Ventanilla Norte, perteneciente al cantón ventanas, se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Sandra se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar una casita .
Le gusta trabajar y  planchar.
texts.en:
Sandra is 31 years old and in a common-law marriage. She lives with her husband and their sons, who are 15, 13, 11, and 8 years old. She lives in the Ventanas canton, in the Los Ríos province. The communal bank is called "Asociacion Montubios Ventanilla Norte", and is located in the Ventanilla Norte province, in the Ventanas canton. Its residents work in agriculture and livestock.

Sandra makes a living in agriculture and has grown corn and rice for many years. She makes her purchases in Ventanas and sells them in the same market.

She is requesting a loan to purchase manure, urea, and liquid fertilizers for her corn and rice crops. The loan will help her to increase her profits for her family's use and to invest. Her dream is to purchase a home. She likes to work and iron.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like manure, urea, and liquid fertilizer.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 56 years old and married with two sons who are students. He lives with his family in Batumi district. Avtandil’s wife works as in a cafe and earns 400 GEL monthly. Avtandil works as an electrician in both a substation and for private customers. He works really hard to cover all of his family’s monthly costs, but it's too hard to pay the university fees for his two sons and secure money for other family expenses. 

Avtandil is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy an aquarium and grow fish to sell to restaurants at a good price. His loan is part of a startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Avtandil’s new business initiative will give him the chance to have financial stability and grow his monthly income.

loans.use: to buy an aquarium to grow fish to sell

loans.name: Diana's Group

texts.en:
Diana's Group is made up of two married women who, on average, are 36-years-old and have two children. They live in nuclear families with their husbands and children in the Teshie neighborhood of the city of Accra. These women know one another through the neighborhood, friendship, and business ties. In order to strengthen their financial means to better conduct their business, they joined micro finance institution ID-Ghana and are on their fourth loan.

This group of women sells drinks and bread. Diana sells drinks and with her loan, she plans to purchase various types of drinks from Accra's wholesalers. She sells her wares at home, at retail prices for cash, not on credit. Diana is expecting to see an average weekly profit of GHS 150, which will be reinvested in the businesses and will repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy and sell drinks to her customers.

loans.name: Sevak

texts.en:
Sevak is from Norapat village of the Armavir region. It has already been 10 years that Sevak has been involved in furniture making. In the basement of his house, Sevak makes different types of furniture (bed, sofa, chairs, desks, etc).
 
He works hard to satisfy his clients' needs, and due to his attentive and hard work, he has a number of customers from the whole region. Now, because of the coming holidays, the number of orders has increased, and with his current materials, Sevak isn't able to complete them. He is asking for this loan to be able to purchase materials and tools needed for his work. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
